register.name: BAT
register.description:
Last Measured Battery Voltage
This register may be read while BATUPD.STAT = 1

field.name: RESERVED11
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: INT
field.description:
Integer part:
0x0: 0V + fractional part ... 0x3: 3V + fractional part 0x4: 4V + fractional part

field.name: FRAC
field.description:
Fractional part, standard binary fractional encoding.
0x00: .0V ... 0x20: 1/8 = .125V 0x40: 1/4 = .25V 0x80: 1/2 = .5V ... 0xA0: 1/2 + 1/8 = .625V ... 0xFF: Max

register.name: BATUPD
register.description:
Battery Update
Indicates BAT Updates

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: STAT
field.description:
0: No update since last clear 1: New battery voltage is present.
Write 1 to clear the status.

register.name: TEMP
register.description:
Temperature
Last Measured Temperature in Degrees Celsius
This register may be read while TEMPUPD.STAT = 1.

field.name: RESERVED17
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: INT
field.description:
Integer part (signed) of temperature value. Total value = INTEGER + FRACTIONAL 2's complement encoding
0x100: Min value 0x1D8: -40C 0x1FF: -1C 0x00: 0C 0x1B: 27C 0x55: 85C 0xFF: Max value

field.name: RESERVED0
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

register.name: TEMPUPD
register.description:
Temperature Update
Indicates TEMP Updates

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: STAT
field.description:
0: No update since last clear 1: New temperature is present.
Write 1 to clear the status.

peripheral.name: AON_EVENT
peripheral.description:
This module configures the event fabric located in the AON domain.
Note: This module is only supporting 32 bit ReadWrite access from MCU

register.name: MCUWUSEL
register.description:
Wake-up Selector For MCU
This register contains pointers to 4 events which are routed to AON_WUC as wakeup sources for MCU. AON_WUC will start a wakeup sequence for the MCU domain when either of the 4 selected events are asserted. A wakeup sequence will guarantee that the MCU power switches are turned on, LDO resources are available and SCLK_HF is available and selected as clock source for MCU.
Note: It is recommended ( or required when AON_WUC:MCUCLK.PWR_DWN_SRC=NONE) to also setup a wakeup event here before MCU is requesting powerdown. ( PRCM requests uLDO, see conditions in PRCM:VDCTL.ULDO ) as it will speed up the wakeup procedure.

field.name: RESERVED30
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: WU3_EV
field.description:
MCU Wakeup Source #3
AON Event Source selecting 1 of 4 events routed to AON_WUC for waking up the MCU domain from Power Off or Power Down. Note:

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_COMPB_ASYNC_N
enumeratedValue.description: Comparator B not triggered. Asynchronous signal directly from AUX Comparator B (inverted) as opposed to AUX_COMPB which is synchronized in AUX

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_COMPB_ASYNC
enumeratedValue.description: Comparator B triggered. Asynchronous signal directly from the AUX Comparator B as opposed to AUX_COMPB which is synchronized in AUX

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_SWEV2
enumeratedValue.description: AUX Software triggered event #2. Triggered by AUX_EVCTL:SWEVSET.SWEV2

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_SWEV1
enumeratedValue.description: AUX Software triggered event #1. Triggered by AUX_EVCTL:SWEVSET.SWEV1

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_SWEV0
enumeratedValue.description: AUX Software triggered event #0. Triggered by AUX_EVCTL:SWEVSET.SWEV0

enumeratedValue.name: RTC_UPD
enumeratedValue.description: RTC Update Tick (16 kHz signal, i.e. event line toggles value every 32 kHz clock period)

field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

register.name: AUXWUSEL
register.description:
Wake-up Selector For AUX
This register contains pointers to 3 events which are routed to AON_WUC as wakeup sources for AUX. AON_WUC will start a wakeup sequence for the AUX domain when either of the 3 selected events are asserted. A wakeup sequence will guarantee that the AUX power switches are turned on, LDO resources are available and SCLK_HF is available and selected as clock source for AUX.
Note: It is recommended ( or required when AON_WUC:AUXCLK.PWR_DWN_SRC=NONE) to also setup a wakeup event here before AUX is requesting powerdown. ( AUX_WUC:PWRDWNREQ.REQ is asserted] ) as it will speed up the wakeup procedure.

peripheral.name: AON_IOC
peripheral.description: Always On (AON) IO Controller - controls IO operation when the MCU IO Controller (IOC) is powered off and resides in the AON domain. Note: This module only supports 32 bit Read/Write access from MCU.

register.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

field.name: GRAY_CODE
field.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

register.name: IOCLATCH
register.description:
IO Latch Control
Controls transparency of all latches holding I/O or configuration state from the MCU IOC

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: EN
field.description:
Controls latches between MCU IOC and AON_IOC.
The latches are transparent by default.
They must be closed prior to power off the domain(s) controlling the IOs in order to preserve IO values on external pins.

enumeratedValue.name: TRANSP
enumeratedValue.description: Latches are transparent, meaning the value of the IO is directly controlled by the GPIO or peripheral value

enumeratedValue.name: STATIC
enumeratedValue.description: Latches are static, meaning the current value on the IO pin is frozen by latches and kept even if GPIO module or a peripheral module is turned off

register.name: CLK32KCTL
register.description: SCLK_LF External Output Control

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: OE_N
field.description: 0: Output enable active. SCLK_LF output on IO pin that has PORT_ID (e.g. IOC:IOCFG0.PORT_ID) set to AON_CLK32K. 1: Output enable not active

peripheral.name: AON_RTC
peripheral.description:
This component control the Real Time Clock residing in AON
Note: This module is only supporting 32 bit ReadWrite access.

register.name: CTL
register.description:
Control
This register contains various bitfields for configuration of RTC

field.name: RESERVED19
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: COMB_EV_MASK
field.description: Eventmask selecting which delayed events that form the combined event.

enumeratedValue.name: CH2
enumeratedValue.description: Use Channel 2 delayed event in combined event

enumeratedValue.name: CH1
enumeratedValue.description: Use Channel 1 delayed event in combined event

enumeratedValue.name: CH0
enumeratedValue.description: Use Channel 0 delayed event in combined event

enumeratedValue.name: NONE
enumeratedValue.description: No event is selected for combined event.

field.name: RESERVED12
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: EV_DELAY
field.description: Number of SCLK_LF clock cycles waited before generating delayed events. (Common setting for all RTC cannels) the delayed event is delayed

field.name: RESET
field.description:
RTC Counter reset.
Writing 1 to this bit will reset the RTC counter.
This bit is cleared when reset takes effect

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: RTC_4KHZ_EN
field.description:
RTC_4KHZ is a 4 KHz reference output, tapped from SUBSEC.VALUE bit 19 which is used by AUX timer.
0: RTC_4KHZ signal is forced to 0 1: RTC_4KHZ is enabled ( provied that RTC is enabled EN)

field.name: RTC_UPD_EN
field.description:
RTC_UPD is a 16 KHz signal used to sync up the radio timer. The 16 Khz is SCLK_LF divided by 2
0: RTC_UPD signal is forced to 0 1: RTC_UPD signal is toggling @16 kHz

field.name: EN
field.description:
Enable RTC counter
0: Halted (frozen) 1: Running

register.name: EVFLAGS
register.description:
Event Flags, RTC Status
This register contains event flags from the 3 RTC channels. Each flag will be cleared when writing a '1' to the corresponding bitfield.

field.name: RESERVED17
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CH2
field.description:
Channel 2 event flag, set when CHCTL.CH2_EN = 1 and the RTC value matches or passes the CH2CMP value.
An event will be scheduled to occur as soon as possible when writing to CH2CMP provided that the channel is enabled and the new value matches any time between next RTC value and 1 second in the past
Writing 1 clears this flag. Note that a new event can not occur on this channel in first 2 SCLK_LF cycles after a clearance.
AUX_SCE can read the flag through AUX_WUC:WUEVFLAGS.AON_RTC_CH2 and clear it using AUX_WUC:WUEVCLR.AON_RTC_CH2.

field.name: RESERVED9
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CH1
field.description:
Channel 1 event flag, set when CHCTL.CH1_EN = 1 and one of the following: - CHCTL.CH1_CAPT_EN = 0 and the RTC value matches or passes the CH1CMP value. - CHCTL.CH1_CAPT_EN = 1 and capture occurs.
An event will be scheduled to occur as soon as possible when writing to CH1CMP provided that the channel is enabled, in compare mode and the new value matches any time between next RTC value and 1 second in the past.
Writing 1 clears this flag. Note that a new event can not occur on this channel in first 2 SCLK_LF cycles after a clearance.

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CH0
field.description:
Channel 0 event flag, set when CHCTL.CH0_EN = 1 and the RTC value matches or passes the CH0CMP value.
An event will be scheduled to occur as soon as possible when writing to CH0CMP provided that the channels is enabled and the new value matches any time between next RTC value and 1 second in the past.
Writing 1 clears this flag. Note that a new event can not occur on this channel in first 2 SCLK_LF cycles after a clearance.

register.name: SEC
register.description: Second Counter Value, Integer Part

field.name: VALUE
field.description:
Unsigned integer representing Real Time Clock in seconds.
When reading this register the content of SUBSEC.VALUE is simultaneously latched. A consistent reading of the combined Real Time Clock can be obtained by first reading this register, then reading SUBSEC register.

register.name: SUBSEC
register.description: Second Counter Value, Fractional Part

field.name: VALUE
field.description:
Unsigned integer representing Real Time Clock in fractions of a second (VALUE/2^32 seconds) at the time when SEC register was read.
Examples : - 0x0000_0000 = 0.0 sec - 0x4000_0000 = 0.25 sec - 0x8000_0000 = 0.5 sec - 0xC000_0000 = 0.75 sec

register.name: SUBSECINC
register.description: Subseconds Increment Value added to SUBSEC.VALUE on every SCLK_LFclock cycle.

field.name: RESERVED24
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: VALUEINC
field.description:
This value compensates for a SCLK_LF clock which has an offset from 32768 Hz.
The compensation value can be found as 2^38 / freq, where freq is SCLK_LF clock frequency in Hertz
This value is added to SUBSEC.VALUE on every cycle, and carry of this is added to SEC.VALUE. To perform the addition, bits [23:6] are aligned with SUBSEC.VALUE bits [17:0]. The remaining bits [5:0] are accumulated in a hidden 6-bit register that generates a carry into the above mentioned addition on overflow. The default value corresponds to incrementing by precisely 1/32768 of a second.
NOTE: This register is read only. Modification of the register value must be done using registers AUX_WUC:RTCSUBSECINC1 , AUX_WUC:RTCSUBSECINC0 and AUX_WUC:RTCSUBSECINCCTL

register.name: CHCTL
register.description: Channel Configuration

field.name: RESERVED19
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CH2_CONT_EN
field.description: Set to enable continuous operation of Channel 2

field.name: RESERVED17
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CH2_EN
field.description:
RTC Channel 2 Enable
0: Disable RTC Channel 2 1: Enable RTC Channel 2

field.name: RESERVED10
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CH1_CAPT_EN
field.description:
Set Channel 1 mode
0: Compare mode (default) 1: Capture mode

field.name: CH1_EN
field.description:
RTC Channel 1 Enable
0: Disable RTC Channel 1 1: Enable RTC Channel 1

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CH0_EN
field.description:
RTC Channel 0 Enable
0: Disable RTC Channel 0 1: Enable RTC Channel 0

register.name: CH0CMP
register.description: Channel 0 Compare Value

field.name: VALUE
field.description:
RTC Channel 0 compare value.
Bit 31 to 16 represents seconds and bits 15 to 0 represents subseconds of the compare value.
The compare value is compared against SEC.VALUE (15:0) and SUBSEC.VALUE (31:16) values of the Real Time Clock register. A Cannel 0 event is generated when {SEC.VALUE(15:0),SUBSEC.VALUE (31:16)} is reaching or exciting the compare value.
Writing to this register can trigger an immediate*) event in case the new compare value matches a Real Time Clock value from 1 second in the past up till current Real Time Clock value.
Example: To generate a compare 5.5 seconds RTC start,- set this value = 0x0005_8000
*) It can take up to 2 SCLK_LF clock cycles before event occurs due to synchronization.

register.name: CH1CMP
register.description: Channel 1 Compare Value

field.name: VALUE
field.description:
RTC Channel 1 compare value.
Bit 31 to 16 represents seconds and bits 15 to 0 represents subseconds of the compare value.
The compare value is compared against SEC.VALUE (15:0) and SUBSEC.VALUE (31:16) values of the Real Time Clock register. A Cannel 0 event is generated when {SEC.VALUE(15:0),SUBSEC.VALUE (31:16)} is reaching or exciting the compare value.
Writing to this register can trigger an immediate*) event in case the new compare value matches a Real Time Clock value from 1 second in the past up till current Real Time Clock value.
Example: To generate a compare 5.5 seconds RTC start,- set this value = 0x0005_8000
*) It can take up to 2 SCLK_LF clock cycles before event occurs due to synchronization.

register.name: CH2CMP
register.description: Channel 2 Compare Value

field.name: VALUE
field.description:
RTC Channel 2 compare value.
Bit 31 to 16 represents seconds and bits 15 to 0 represents subseconds of the compare value.
The compare value is compared against SEC.VALUE (15:0) and SUBSEC.VALUE (31:16) values of the Real Time Clock register. A Cannel 0 event is generated when {SEC.VALUE(15:0),SUBSEC.VALUE (31:16)} is reaching or exciting the compare value.
Writing to this register can trigger an immediate*) event in case the new compare value matches a Real Time Clock value from 1 second in the past up till current Real Time Clock value.
Example: To generate a compare 5.5 seconds RTC start,- set this value = 0x0005_8000
*) It can take up to 2 SCLK_LF clock cycles before event occurs due to synchronization.

register.name: CH2CMPINC
register.description:
Channel 2 Compare Value Auto-increment
This register is primarily used to generate periodical wake-up for the AUX_SCE module, through the [AUX_EVCTL.EVSTAT0.AON_RTC] event.

field.name: VALUE
field.description: If CHCTL.CH2_CONT_EN is set, this value is added to CH2CMP.VALUE on every channel 2 compare event.

register.name: CH1CAPT
register.description:
Channel 1 Capture Value
If CHCTL.CH1_EN = 1and CHCTL.CH1_CAPT_EN = 1, capture occurs on each rising edge of the event selected in AON_EVENT:RTCSEL.

field.name: SEC
field.description: Value of SEC.VALUE bits 15:0 at capture time.

field.name: SUBSEC
field.description: Value of SUBSEC.VALUE bits 31:16 at capture time.

register.name: SYNC
register.description:
AON Synchronization
This register is used for synchronizing between MCU and entire AON domain.

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: WBUSY
field.description:
This register will always return 0,- however it will not return the value until there are no outstanding write requests between MCU and AON
Note: Writing to this register prior to reading will force a wait until next SCLK_LF edge. This is recommended for syncing read registers from AON when waking up from sleep Failure to do so may result in reading AON values from prior to going to sleep

peripheral.name: AON_SYSCTL
peripheral.description:
This component controls AON_SYSCTL, which is the device's system controller.
Note: This module is only supporting 32 bit ReadWrite access from MCU

register.name: PWRCTL
register.description:
Power Management
This register controls bitfields for setting low level power management features such as selection of regulator for VDDR supply and control of IO ring where certain segments can be enabled / disabled.

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: DCDC_ACTIVE
field.description:
Select to use DCDC regulator for VDDR in active mode
0: Use GLDO for regulation of VDDRin active mode. 1: Use DCDC for regulation of VDDRin active mode.

field.name: EXT_REG_MODE
field.description:
Status of source for VDDRsupply:
0: DCDC/GLDO are generating VDDR 1: DCDC/GLDO are bypassed, external regulator supplies VDDR

field.name: DCDC_EN
field.description:
Select to use DCDC regulator during recharge of VDDR
0: Use GLDO for recharge of VDDR 1: Use DCDC for recharge of VDDR
Note: This bitfield should be set to the same as DCDC_ACTIVE

register.name: RESETCTL
register.description:
Reset Management
This register contains bitfields releated to system reset such as reset source and reset request and control of brown out resets.

field.name: SYSRESET
field.description:
Cold reset register. Writing 1 to this bitfield will reset the entire chip and cause boot code to run again.
0: No effect 1: Generate system reset. Appears as SYSRESET in RESET_SRC.

field.name: RESERVED26
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: BOOT_DET_1_CLR
field.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

field.name: BOOT_DET_0_CLR
field.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

field.name: RESERVED18
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: BOOT_DET_1_SET
field.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

field.name: BOOT_DET_0_SET
field.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

field.name: WU_FROM_SD
field.description:
A Wakeup from SHUTDOWN on an IO event has occurred, or a wakeup from SHUTDOWN has occurred as a result of the debugger being attached.. (TCK pin being forced low)
Please refer to [IOC:IOCFGn,.WU_CFG] for configuring the IO's as wakeup sources.
0: Wakeup occurred from cold reset or brown out as seen in RESET_SRC 1: A wakeup has occurred from SHUTDOWN
Note: This flag can not be cleared and will therefor remain valid untill poweroff/reset

field.name: GPIO_WU_FROM_SD
field.description:
A wakeup from SHUTDOWN on an IO event has occurred
Please refer to [IOC:IOCFGn,.WU_CFG] for configuring the IO's as wakeup sources.
0: The wakeup did not occur from SHUTDOWN on an IO event 1: A wakeup from SHUTDOWN occurred from an IO event
The case where WU_FROM_SD is asserted but this bitfield is not asserted will only occur in a debug session. The boot code will not proceed with wakeup from SHUTDOWN procedure until this bitfield is asserted as well.
Note: This flag can not be cleared and will therefor remain valid untill poweroff/reset

field.name: BOOT_DET_1
field.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

field.name: BOOT_DET_0
field.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

field.name: VDDS_LOSS_EN_OVR
field.description:
Override of VDDS_LOSS_EN
0: Brown out detect of VDDS is ignored, unless VDDS_LOSS_EN=1 1: Brown out detect of VDDS generates system reset (regardless of VDDS_LOSS_EN)
This bit can be locked

field.name: VDDR_LOSS_EN_OVR
field.description:
Override of VDDR_LOSS_EN
0: Brown out detect of VDDR is ignored, unless VDDR_LOSS_EN=1 1: Brown out detect of VDDR generates system reset (regardless of VDDR_LOSS_EN)
This bit can be locked

field.name: VDD_LOSS_EN_OVR
field.description:
Override of VDD_LOSS_EN
0: Brown out detect of VDD is ignored, unless VDD_LOSS_EN=1 1: Brown out detect of VDD generates system reset (regardless of VDD_LOSS_EN)
This bit can be locked

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: VDDS_LOSS_EN
field.description:
Controls reset generation in case VDDS is lost
0: Brown out detect of VDDS is ignored, unless VDDS_LOSS_EN_OVR=1 1: Brown out detect of VDDS generates system reset

field.name: VDDR_LOSS_EN
field.description:
Controls reset generation in case VDDR is lost
0: Brown out detect of VDDR is ignored, unless VDDR_LOSS_EN_OVR=1 1: Brown out detect of VDDR generates system reset

field.name: VDD_LOSS_EN
field.description:
Controls reset generation in case VDD is lost
0: Brown out detect of VDD is ignored, unless VDD_LOSS_EN_OVR=1 1: Brown out detect of VDD generates system reset

field.name: CLK_LOSS_EN
field.description:
Controls reset generation in case SCLK_LF is lost. (provided that clock loss detection is enabled by DDI_0_OSC:CTL0.CLK_LOSS_EN)
Note: Clock loss reset generation must be disabled before SCLK_LF clock source is changed in DDI_0_OSC:CTL0.SCLK_LF_SRC_SEL and remain disabled untill the change is confirmed in DDI_0_OSC:STAT0.SCLK_LF_SRC. Failure to do so may result in a spurious system reset. Clock loss reset generation can be disabled through this bitfield or by clearing DDI_0_OSC:CTL0.CLK_LOSS_EN
0: Clock loss is ignored 1: Clock loss generates system reset

field.name: RESET_SRC
field.description: Shows the source of the last system reset: Occurrence of one of the reset sources may trigger several other reset sources as essential parts of the system are undergoing reset. This field will report the root cause of the reset (not the other resets that are consequence of the system reset). To support this feature the actual register is not captured before the reset source being released. If a new reset source is triggered, in a window of four 32 kHz periods after the previous has been released, this register may indicate Power on reset as source.

enumeratedValue.name: WARMRESET
enumeratedValue.description: Software reset via PRCM warm reset request

field.name: RESERVED0
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

register.name: SLEEPCTL
register.description:
Sleep Mode
This register is used to unfreeze the IO pad ring after waking up from SHUTDOWN

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: IO_PAD_SLEEP_DIS
field.description:
Controls the I/O pad sleep mode. The boot code will set this bitfield automatically unless waking up from a SHUTDOWN ( RESETCTL.WU_FROM_SD is set ).
0: I/O pad sleep mode is enabled, ie all pads are latched and can not toggle. 1: I/O pad sleep mode is disabled
Application software may want to reconfigure the state for all IO's before setting this bitfield upon waking up from a SHUTDOWN.

peripheral.name: AON_WUC
peripheral.description:
This component control the Wakeup controller residing in the AON domain.
Note: This module is only supporting 32 bit ReadWrite access from MCU

register.name: MCUCLK
register.description:
MCU Clock Management
This register contains bitfields related to the MCU clock.

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: RCOSC_HF_CAL_DONE
field.description:
MCU bootcode will set this bit when RCOSC_HF is calibrated. The FLASH can not be used until this bit is set.
1: RCOSC_HF is calibrated to 48 MHz, allowing FLASH to power up. 0: RCOSC_HF is not yet calibrated, ie FLASH must not assume that the SCLK_HF is safe

field.name: PWR_DWN_SRC
field.description:
Controls the clock source for the entire MCU domain while MCU is requesting powerdown.
When MCU requests powerdown with SCLK_HF as source, then WUC will switch over to this clock source during powerdown, and automatically switch back to SCLK_HF when MCU is no longer requesting powerdown and system is back in active mode.

register.name: AUXCLK
register.description:
AUX Clock Management
This register contains bitfields that are relevant for setting up the clock to the AUX domain.

field.name: RESERVED13
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: PWR_DWN_SRC
field.description: When AUX requests powerdown with SCLK_HF as source, then WUC will switch over to this clock source during powerdown, and automatically switch back to SCLK_HF when AUX system is back in active mode

field.name: SCLK_HF_DIV
field.description:
Select the AUX clock divider for SCLK_HF
NB: It is not supported to change the AUX clock divider while SCLK_HF is active source for AUX

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: SRC
field.description:
Selects the clock source for AUX:
NB: Switching the clock source is guaranteed to be glitchless

register.name: MCUCFG
register.description:
MCU Configuration
This register contains power management related bitfields for the MCU domain.

field.name: RESERVED18
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: VIRT_OFF
field.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

field.name: FIXED_WU_EN
field.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

field.name: RESERVED4
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: SRAM_RET_EN
field.description: MCU SRAM is partitioned into 4 banks . This register controls which of the banks that has retention during MCU power off

enumeratedValue.name: RET_FULL
enumeratedValue.description: Retention on for all banks (SRAM:BANK0, SRAM:BANK1 ,SRAM:BANK2 and SRAM:BANK3)

enumeratedValue.name: RET_LEVEL3
enumeratedValue.description: Retention on for SRAM:BANK0, SRAM:BANK1 and SRAM:BANK2

enumeratedValue.name: RET_LEVEL2
enumeratedValue.description: Retention on for SRAM:BANK0 and SRAM:BANK1

register.name: AUXCFG
register.description:
AUX Configuration
This register contains power management related signals for the AUX domain.

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: RAM_RET_EN
field.description:
This bit controls retention mode for the AUX_RAM:BANK0:
0: Retention is disabled 1: Retention is enabled
NB: If retention is disabled, the AUX_RAM will be powered off when it would otherwise be put in retention mode

register.name: AUXCTL
register.description:
AUX Control
This register contains events and control signals for the AUX domain.

field.name: RESET_REQ
field.description:
Reset request for AUX. Writing 1 to this register will assert reset to AUX. The reset will be held until the bit is cleared again.
0: AUX reset pin will be deasserted 1: AUX reset pin will be asserted

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: SCE_RUN_EN
field.description:
Enables (1) or disables (0) AUX_SCE execution. AUX_SCE execution will begin when AUX Domain is powered and either this or AUX_SCE:CTL.CLK_EN is set.
Setting this bit will assure that AUX_SCE execution starts as soon as AUX power domain is woken up. ( AUX_SCE:CTL.CLK_EN will be reset to 0 if AUX power domain has been off)
0: AUX_SCE execution will be disabled if AUX_SCE:CTL.CLK_EN is 0 1: AUX_SCE execution is enabled.

field.name: SWEV
field.description:
Writing 1 sets the software event to the AUX domain, which can be read through AUX_WUC:WUEVFLAGS.AON_SW.
This event is normally cleared by AUX_SCE through the AUX_WUC:WUEVCLR.AON_SW. It can also be cleared by writing 0 to this register.
Reading 0 means that there is no outstanding software event for AUX.
Note that it can take up to 1,5 SCLK_LF clock cycles to clear the event from AUX.

field.name: AUX_FORCE_ON
field.description:
Forces the AUX domain into active mode, overriding the requests from AUX_WUC:PWROFFREQ, AUX_WUC:PWRDWNREQ and AUX_WUC:MCUBUSCTL. Note that an ongoing AUX_WUC:PWROFFREQ will complete before this bit will set the AUX domain into active mode.
MCU must set this bit in order to access the AUX peripherals. The AUX domain status can be read from PWRSTAT.AUX_PD_ON
0: AUX is allowed to Power Off, Power Down or Disconnect. 1: AUX Power OFF, Power Down or Disconnect requests will be overruled

register.name: PWRSTAT
register.description:
Power Status
This register is used to monitor various power management related signals in AON. Most signals are for test, calibration and debug purpose only, and others can be used to detect that AUX or JTAG domains are powered up.

field.name: RESERVED10
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: AUX_PWR_DWN
field.description:
Indicates the AUX powerdown state when AUX domain is powered up.
0: Active mode 1: AUX Powerdown request has been granted

field.name: RESERVED7
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: JTAG_PD_ON
field.description:
Indicates JTAG power state:
0: JTAG is powered off 1: JTAG is powered on

field.name: AUX_PD_ON
field.description:
Indicates AUX power state:
0: AUX is not ready for use ( may be powered off or in power state transition ) 1: AUX is powered on, connected to bus and ready for use,

field.name: MCU_PD_ON
field.description:
Indicates MCU power state:
0: MCU Power sequencing is not yet finalized and MCU_AONIF registers may not be reliable 1: MCU Power sequencing is finalized and all MCU_AONIF registers are reliable

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: AUX_BUS_CONNECTED
field.description:
Indicates that AUX Bus is connected:
0: AUX bus is not connected 1: AUX bus is connected ( idle_ack = 0 )

field.name: AUX_RESET_DONE
field.description:
Indicates Reset Done from AUX:
0: AUX is being reset 1: AUX reset is released

field.name: RESERVED0
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

register.name: SHUTDOWN
register.description:
Shutdown Control
This register contains bitfields required for entering shutdown mode

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: EN
field.description:
Writing a 1 to this bit forces a shutdown request to be registered and all I/O values to be latched - in the PAD ring, possibly enabling I/O wakeup. Writing 0 will cancel a registered shutdown request and open th I/O latches residing in the PAD ring.
A registered shutdown request takes effect the next time power down conditions exists. At this time, the will not enter Powerdown mode, but instead it will turn off all internal powersupplies, effectively putting the device into Shutdown mode.

register.name: CTL0
register.description:
Control 0
This register contains various chip level control and debug bitfields.

field.name: RESERVED9
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: PWR_DWN_DIS
field.description:
Controls whether MCU and AUX requesting to be powered off will enable a transition to powerdown:
0: Enabled 1: Disabled

field.name: RESERVED4
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: AUX_SRAM_ERASE
field.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

field.name: MCU_SRAM_ERASE
field.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

field.name: RESERVED0
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

register.name: CTL1
register.description:
Control 1
This register contains various chip level control and debug bitfields.

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: MCU_RESET_SRC
field.description:
Indicates source of last MCU Voltage Domain warm reset request:
0: MCU SW reset 1: JTAG reset
This bit can only be cleared by writing a 1 to it

field.name: MCU_WARM_RESET
field.description:
Indicates type of last MCU Voltage Domain reset:
0: Last MCU reset was not a warm reset 1: Last MCU reset was a warm reset (requested from MCU or JTAG as indicated in MCU_RESET_SRC)
This bit can only be cleared by writing a 1 to it

register.name: RECHARGECFG
register.description:
Recharge Controller Configuration
This register sets all relevant patameters for controlling the recharge algorithm.

field.name: ADAPTIVE_EN
field.description:
Enable adaptive recharge
Note: Recharge can be turned completely of by setting MAX_PER_E=7 and MAX_PER_M=31 and this bitfield to 0

field.name: RESERVED24
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: C2
field.description:
Gain factor for adaptive recharge algorithm
period_new=period * ( 1+/-(2^-C1+2^-C2) ) Valid values for C2 is 2 to 10
Note: Rounding may cause adaptive recharge not to start for very small values of both Gain and Initial period. Criteria for algorithm to start is MAX(PERIOD*2^-C1,PERIOD*2^-C2) >= 1

field.name: C1
field.description:
Gain factor for adaptive recharge algorithm
period_new=period * ( 1+/-(2^-C1+2^-C2) ) Valid values for C1 is 1 to 10
Note: Rounding may cause adaptive recharge not to start for very small values of both Gain and Initial period. Criteria for algorithm to start is MAX(PERIOD*2^-C1,PERIOD*2^-C2) >= 1

field.name: MAX_PER_M
field.description: This register defines the maximum period that the recharge algorithm can take, i.e. it defines the maximum number of cycles between 2 recharges. The maximum number of cycles is specified with a 5 bit mantissa and 3 bit exponent: MAXCYCLES=(MAX_PER_M*16+15)*2^MAX_PER_E This field sets the mantissa of MAXCYCLES

field.name: MAX_PER_E
field.description: This register defines the maximum period that the recharge algorithm can take, i.e. it defines the maximum number of cycles between 2 recharges. The maximum number of cycles is specified with a 5 bit mantissa and 3 bit exponent: MAXCYCLES=(MAX_PER_M*16+15)*2^MAX_PER_E This field sets the exponent MAXCYCLES

field.name: PER_M
field.description: Number of 32 KHz clocks between activation of recharge controller For recharge algorithm, PERIOD is the initial period when entering powerdown mode. The adaptive recharge algorithm will not change this register PERIOD will effectively be a 16 bit value coded in a 5 bit mantissa and 3 bit exponent: This field sets the Mantissa of the Period. PERIOD=(PER_M*16+15)*2^PER_E

field.name: PER_E
field.description: Number of 32 KHz clocks between activation of recharge controller For recharge algorithm, PERIOD is the initial period when entering powerdown mode. The adaptive recharge algorithm will not change this register PERIOD will effectively be a 16 bit value coded in a 5 bit mantissa and 3 bit exponent: This field sets the Exponent of the Period. PERIOD=(PER_M*16+15)*2^PER_E

register.name: RECHARGESTAT
register.description:
Recharge Controller Status
This register controls various status registers which are updated during recharge. The register is mostly intended for test and debug.

field.name: RESERVED20
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: VDDR_SMPLS
field.description:
The last 4 VDDR samples, bit 0 being the newest.
The register is being updated in every recharge period with a shift left, and bit 0 is updated with the last VDDR sample, ie a 1 is shiftet in in case VDDR > VDDR_threshold just before recharge starts. Otherwise a 0 will be shifted in.

field.name: MAX_USED_PER
field.description:
The maximum value of recharge period seen with VDDR>threshold.
The VDDR voltage is compared against the threshold voltage at just before each recharge. If VDDR is above threshold, MAX_USED_PER is updated with max ( current recharge peride; MAX_USED_PER ) This way MAX_USED_PER can track the recharge period where VDDR is decharged to the threshold value. We can therefore use the value as an indication of the leakage current during recharge.
This bitfield is cleared to 0 when writing this register.

register.name: OSCCFG
register.description:
Oscillator Configuration
This register sets the period for Amplitude compensation requests sent to the oscillator control system. The amplitude compensations is only applicable when XOSC_HF is running in low power mode.

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: PER_M
field.description:
Number of 32 KHz clocks between oscillator amplitude calibrations. When this counter expires, an oscillator amplitude compensation is triggered immediately in Active mode. When this counter expires in Powerdown mode an internal flag is set such that the amplitude compensation is postponed until the next recharge occurs.
The Period will effectively be a 16 bit value coded in a 5 bit mantissa and 3 bit exponent PERIOD=(PER_M*16+15)*2^PER_E This field sets the mantissa Note: Oscillator amplitude calibration is turned of when both this bitfield and PER_E are set to 0

field.name: PER_E
field.description: Number of 32 KHz clocks between oscillator amplitude calibrations. When this counter expires, an oscillator amplitude compensation is triggered immediately in Active mode. When this counter expires in Powerdown mode an internal flag is set such that the amplitude compensation is postponed until the next recharge occurs. The Period will effectively be a 16 bit value coded in a 5 bit mantissa and 3 bit exponent PERIOD=(PER_M*16+15)*2^PER_E This field sets the exponent Note: Oscillator amplitude calibration is turned of when both PER_M and this bitfield are set to 0

register.name: JTAGCFG
register.description:
JTAG Configuration
This register contains control for configuration of the JTAG domain,- hereunder access permissions for each TAP.

field.name: RESERVED9
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: JTAG_PD_FORCE_ON
field.description:
Controls JTAG PowerDomain power state:
0: Controlled exclusively by debug subsystem. (JTAG Powerdomain will be powered off unless a debugger is attached) 1: JTAG Power Domain is forced on, independent of debug subsystem.
NB: The reset value causes JTAG Power Domain to be powered on by default. Software must clear this bit to turn off the JTAG Power Domain

field.name: RESERVED0
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

register.name: JTAGUSERCODE
register.description:
JTAG USERCODE
Boot code copies the JTAG USERCODE to this register from where it is forwarded to the debug subsystem.

field.name: USER_CODE
field.description: 32-bit JTAG USERCODE register feeding main JTAG TAP NB: This field can be locked

register.name: ADC0
register.description:
ADC Control 0
ADC Sample Control. Only to be used through TI provided API.

field.name: SMPL_MODE
field.description:
ADC Sampling mode:
0: Synchronous mode 1: Asynchronous mode
The ADC does a sample-and-hold before conversion. In synchronous mode the sampling starts when the ADC clock detects a rising edge on the trigger signal. Jitter/uncertainty will be inferred in the detection if the trigger signal originates from a domain that is asynchronous to the ADC clock. SMPL_CYCLE_EXP determines the the duration of sampling. Conversion starts immediately after sampling ends.
In asynchronous mode the sampling is continuous when enabled. Sampling ends and conversion starts immediately with the rising edge of the trigger signal. Sampling restarts when the conversion has finished. Asynchronous mode is useful when it is important to avoid jitter in the sampling instant of an externally driven signal

field.name: SMPL_CYCLE_EXP
field.description: Controls the sampling duration before conversion when the ADC is operated in synchronous mode (SMPL_MODE = 0). The setting has no effect in asynchronous mode. The sampling duration is given as 2^(SMPL_CYCLE_EXP + 1) / 6 us.

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: RESET_N
field.description:
Reset ADC digital subchip, active low. ADC must be reset every time it is reconfigured.
0: Reset 1: Normal operation

field.name: EN
field.description:
ADC Enable
0: Disable 1: Enable

field.name: VTRIM
field.description:
Trim output voltage of ADC fixed reference (64 steps, 2's complement). Applies only for ADCREF0.SRC = 0.
Examples: 0x00 - nominal voltage 1.43V 0x01 - nominal + 0.4% 1.435V 0x3F - nominal - 0.4% 1.425V 0x1F - maximum voltage 1.6V 0x20 - minimum voltage 1.3V

register.name: GPIODOUT
register.description:
General Purpose Input Output Data Out
The output data register is used to set data on AUXIO that are controlled by instance i of AUX_AIODIO. Hence, in formulas below i = 0 for AUX_AIODIO0 and i = 1 for AUX_AIODIO1

field.name: RESERVED8

field.name: IO7_0
field.description: Write 1 to bit index n in this bit vector to set AUXIO[8i+n]. Write 0 to bit index n in this bit vector to clear AUXIO[8i+n].

register.name: IOMODE
register.description:
Input Output Mode
This register controls pull-up, pull-down, and output mode for AUXIO that are controlled by instance i of AUX_AIODIO. Hence, in formulas below i = 0 for AUX_AIODIO0 and i = 1 for AUX_AIODIO1

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: IO7
field.description: Select mode for AUXIO[8i+7].

enumeratedValue.name: OPEN_SOURCE
enumeratedValue.description:
Open-Source Mode:
When GPIODOUT bit 7 is 0: AUXIO[8i+7] is tri-stated or pulled. This depends on IOC:IOCFGn.PULL_CTL.
When GPIODOUT bit 7 is 1: AUXIO[8i+7] is driven high.

enumeratedValue.name: OPEN_DRAIN
enumeratedValue.description:
Open-Drain Mode:
When GPIODOUT bit 7 is 0: AUXIO[8i+7] is driven low.
When GPIODOUT bit 7 is 1: AUXIO[8i+7] is tri-stated or pulled. This depends on IOC:IOCFGn.PULL_CTL.

enumeratedValue.name: IN
enumeratedValue.description:
Input Mode:
When GPIODIE bit 7 is 0: AUXIO[8i+7] is enabled for analog signal transfer.
When GPIODIE bit 7 is 1: AUXIO[8i+7] is enabled for digital input.

enumeratedValue.name: OUT
enumeratedValue.description:
Output Mode:
GPIODOUT bit 7 drives AUXIO[8i+7].

register.name: GPIODIN
register.description:
General Purpose Input Output Data In
This register provides synchronized input data for AUXIO that are controlled by instance i of AUX_AIODIO. Hence, in formulas below i = 0 for AUX_AIODIO0 and I = 1 for AUX_AIODIO1.

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: IO7_0
field.description: Bit n in this bit vector contains the value for AUXIO[8i+n] when GPIODIE bit n is set. Otherwise, bit n value is old.

register.name: GPIODOUTSET
register.description:
General Purpose Input Output Data Out Set
Set bits in GPIODOUT in instance i of AUX_AIODIO. Hence, in formulas below i = 0 for AUX_AIODIO0 and i = 1 for AUX_AIODIO1.

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: IO7_0
field.description:
Write 1 to bit index n in this bit vector to set GPIODOUT bit n.
Read value is 0.

register.name: GPIODOUTCLR
register.description:
General Purpose Input Output Data Out Clear
Clear bits in GPIODOUT instance i of AUX_AIODIO. Hence, in formulas below i = 0 for AUX_AIODIO0 and i = 1 for AUX_AIODIO1.

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: IO7_0
field.description:
Write 1 to bit index n in this bit vector to clear GPIODOUT bit n.
Read value is 0.

register.name: GPIODOUTTGL

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: IO7_0
field.description:
Write 1 to bit index n in this bit vector to toggle GPIODOUT bit n.
Read value is 0.

register.name: GPIODIE
register.description:
General Purpose Input Output Digital Input Enable
This register controls input buffers for AUXIO that are controlled by instance i of AUX_AIODIO. Hence, in formulas below i = 0 for AUX_AIODIO0 and I = 1 for AUX_AIODIO1.

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: IO7_0
field.description:
Write 1 to bit index n in this bit vector to enable digital input buffer for AUXIO[8i+n]. Write 0 to bit index n in this bit vector to disable digital input buffer for AUXIO[8i+n].
You must enable the digital input buffer for AUXIO[8i+n] to read the pin value in GPIODIN. You must disable the digital input buffer for analog input or pins that float to avoid current leakage.

register.name: ADCCTL
register.description:
ADC Control
Configuration of ADI_4_AUX:ADC0.SMPL_MODE decides if the ADC trigger starts sampling or conversion.

field.name: RESERVED14
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: START_POL
field.description: Select active polarity for START_SRC event.

enumeratedValue.name: FALL
enumeratedValue.description: Set ADC trigger on falling edge of event source.

enumeratedValue.name: RISE
enumeratedValue.description: Set ADC trigger on rising edge of event source.

field.name: START_SRC
field.description:
Select ADC trigger event source from the asynchronous AUX event bus.
Set START_SRC to NO_EVENT<n> if you want to trigger the ADC manually through ADCTRIG.START.

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CMD
field.description:
ADC interface command.
Non-enumerated values are not supported. The written value is returned when read.

enumeratedValue.name: FLUSH
enumeratedValue.description:
Flush ADC FIFO.
You must set CMD to EN or DIS after flush.
System CPU must wait two clock cycles before it sets CMD to EN or DIS.

register.name: ADCFIFOSTAT
register.description:
ADC FIFO Status
FIFO can hold up to four ADC samples.

field.name: RESERVED5
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: OVERFLOW
field.description:
FIFO overflow flag.
0: FIFO has not overflowed. 1: FIFO has overflowed, this flag is sticky until you flush the FIFO.
When the flag is set, the ADC FIFO write pointer is static. It is not possible to add more samples to the ADC FIFO. Flush FIFO to clear the flag.

field.name: UNDERFLOW
field.description:
FIFO underflow flag.
0: FIFO has not underflowed. 1: FIFO has underflowed, this flag is sticky until you flush the FIFO.
When the flag is set, the ADC FIFO read pointer is static. Read returns the previous sample that was read. Flush FIFO to clear the flag.

field.name: FULL
field.description:
FIFO full flag.
0: FIFO is not full, there is less than 4 samples in the FIFO. 1: FIFO is full, there are 4 samples in the FIFO.
When the flag is set, it is not possible to add more samples to the ADC FIFO. An attempt to add samples sets the OVERFLOW flag.

field.name: ALMOST_FULL
field.description:
FIFO almost full flag.
0: There are less than 3 samples in the FIFO, or the FIFO is full. The FULL flag is also asserted in the latter case. 1: There are 3 samples in the FIFO, there is room for one more sample.

field.name: EMPTY
field.description:
FIFO empty flag.
0: FIFO contains one or more samples. 1: FIFO is empty.
When the flag is set, read returns the previous sample that was read and sets the UNDERFLOW flag.

register.name: ADCFIFO
register.description: ADC FIFO

field.name: RESERVED12
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: DATA
field.description:
FIFO data.
Read: Get oldest ADC sample from FIFO.
Write: Write dummy sample to FIFO. This is useful for code development when you do not have real ADC samples.

register.name: ADCTRIG
register.description: ADC Trigger

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: START
field.description:
Manual ADC trigger.
0: No effect. 1: Single ADC trigger.
To manually trigger the ADC, you must set ADCCTL.START_SRC to NO_EVENT<n> to avoid conflict with event-driven ADC trigger.

field.name: RESET_N

0: ISRC drives 0 uA. 1: ISRC drives current ADI_4_AUX:ISRC.TRIM to COMPA_IN.

field.name: RESERVED17
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: ALLOW_SCLK_HF_SWITCHING
field.description:
0: Default - Switching of HF clock source is disabled . 1: Allows switching of sclk_hf source.
Provided to prevent switching of the SCLK_HF source when running from flash (a long period during switching could corrupt flash). When sclk_hf switching is disabled, a new source can be started when SCLK_HF_SRC_SEL is changed, but the switch will not occur until this bit is set. This bit should be set to enable clock switching after STAT0.PENDINGSCLKHFSWITCHING indicates the new HF clock is ready. When switching completes (also indicated by STAT0.PENDINGSCLKHFSWITCHING) sclk_hf switching should be disabled to prevent flash corruption. Switching should not be enabled when running from flash.

field.name: RESERVED15
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: HPOSC_MODE_EN
field.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

field.name: RESERVED13
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: RCOSC_LF_TRIMMED
field.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

field.name: XOSC_HF_POWER_MODE
field.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

field.name: XOSC_LF_DIG_BYPASS
field.description:
Bypass XOSC_LF and use the digital input clock from AON for the xosc_lf clock.
0: Use 32kHz XOSC as xosc_lf clock source 1: Use digital input (from AON) as xosc_lf clock source.
This bit will only have effect when SCLK_LF_SRC_SEL is selecting the xosc_lf as the sclk_lf source. The muxing performed by this bit is not glitch free. The following procedure must be followed when changing this field to avoid glitches on sclk_lf.
1) Set SCLK_LF_SRC_SEL to select any source other than the xosc_lf clock source. 2) Set or clear this bit to bypass or not bypass the xosc_lf. 3) Set SCLK_LF_SRC_SEL to use xosc_lf.
It is recommended that either the rcosc_hf or xosc_hf (whichever is currently active) be selected as the source in step 1 above. This provides a faster clock change.

field.name: CLK_LOSS_EN
field.description:
Enable clock loss detection and hence the indicators to system controller. Checks both SCLK_HF and SCLK_LF clock loss indicators.
0: Disable 1: Enable
Clock loss detection must be disabled when changing the sclk_lf source. STAT0.SCLK_LF_SRC can be polled to determine when a change to a new sclk_lf source has completed.

field.name: ACLK_TDC_SRC_SEL
field.description:
Source select for aclk_tdc.
00: RCOSC_HF (48MHz) 01: RCOSC_HF (24MHz) 10: XOSC_HF (24MHz) 11: Not used

field.name: ACLK_REF_SRC_SEL
field.description:
Source select for aclk_ref
00: RCOSC_HF derived (31.25kHz) 01: XOSC_HF derived (31.25kHz) 10: RCOSC_LF (32kHz) 11: XOSC_LF (32.768kHz)

field.name: RAMPSTATE
field.description: AMPCOMP FSM State

field.name: HPM_UPDATE_AMP
field.description: OSC amplitude during HPM_UPDATE state. When amplitude compensation of XOSC_HF is enabled in high performance mode, this value is the amplitude of the crystal oscillations measured by the on-chip oscillator ADC, divided by 15 mV. For example, a value of 0x20 would indicate that the amplitude of the crystal is approximately 480 mV. To enable amplitude compensation, AON_WUC OSCCFG must be set to a non-zero value.

field.name: LPM_UPDATE_AMP
field.description: OSC amplitude during LPM_UPDATE state When amplitude compensation of XOSC_HF is enabled in low power mode, this value is the amplitude of the crystal oscillations measured by the on-chip oscillator ADC, divided by 15 mV. For example, a value of 0x20 would indicate that the amplitude of the crystal is approximately 480 mV. To enable amplitude compensation, AON_WUC OSCCFG must be set to a non-zero value.

To manually trigger vector 1 execution: - AUX_SCE must sleep. - Set VEC1_EV to a known static value. - Toggle VEC1_POL twice.

field.name: VEC1_EN
field.description:
Vector 1 trigger enable.
When enabled, VEC1_EV event with VEC1_POL polarity triggers a jump to vector # 1 when AUX_SCE sleeps.
Lower vectors (0) have priority.

field.name: VEC1_EV
field.description: Select vector 1 trigger source event.

field.name: RESERVED7
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: VEC0_POL
field.description:
Vector 0 trigger event polarity.
To manually trigger vector 0 execution: - AUX_SCE must sleep. - Set VEC0_EV to a known static value. - Toggle VEC0_POL twice.

field.name: VEC0_EN
field.description:
Vector 0 trigger enable.
When enabled, VEC0_EV event with VEC0_POL polarity triggers a jump to vector # 0 when AUX_SCE sleeps.

field.name: VEC0_EV
field.description: Select vector 0 trigger source event.

register.name: VECCFG1
register.description:
Vector Configuration 1
AUX_SCE event vectors 2 and 3 configuration

field.name: RESERVED15
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: VEC3_POL
field.description:
Vector 3 trigger event polarity.
To manually trigger vector 3 execution: - AUX_SCE must sleep. - Set VEC3_EV to a known static value. - Toggle VEC3_POL twice.

field.name: VEC3_EN
field.description:
Vector 3 trigger enable.
When enabled, VEC3_EV event with VEC3_POL polarity triggers a jump to vector # 3 when AUX_SCE sleeps.
Lower vectors (0, 1, and 2) have priority.

field.name: VEC3_EV
field.description: Select vector 3 trigger source event.

field.name: RESERVED7
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: VEC2_POL
field.description:
Vector 2 trigger event polarity.
To manually trigger vector 2 execution: - AUX_SCE must sleep. - Set VEC2_EV to a known static value. - Toggle VEC2_POL twice.

field.name: VEC2_EN
field.description:
Vector 2 trigger enable.
When enabled, VEC2_EV event with VEC2_POL polarity triggers a jump to vector # 2 when AUX_SCE sleeps.
Lower vectors (0 and 1) have priority.

field.name: VEC2_EV
field.description: Select vector 2 trigger source event.

register.name: SCEWEVSEL
register.description:
Sensor Controller Engine Wait Event Selection
Configuration of this register controls bit index 7 in AUX_SCE:WUSTAT.EV_SIGNALS. This bit can be used by AUX_SCE WEV0, WEV1, BEV0 and BEV1 instructions

field.name: RESERVED5
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: WEV7_EV
field.description: Select event source to connect to AUX_SCE:WUSTAT.EV_SIGNALS bit 7.

register.name: EVTOAONFLAGS
register.description:
Events To AON Flags
This register contains a collection of event flags routed to AON_EVENT.
To clear an event flag, write to EVTOAONFLAGSCLR or write 0 to event flag in this register.

field.name: RESERVED9
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: TIMER1_EV
field.description: This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOAONPOL.TIMER1_EV occurs on EVSTAT0.TIMER1_EV.

field.name: TIMER0_EV
field.description: This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOAONPOL.TIMER0_EV occurs on EVSTAT0.TIMER0_EV.

field.name: TDC_DONE
field.description: This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOAONPOL.TDC_DONE occurs on EVSTAT0.TDC_DONE.

field.name: ADC_DONE
field.description: This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOAONPOL.ADC_DONE occurs on EVSTAT0.ADC_DONE.

field.name: AUX_COMPB
field.description: This event flag is set when edge selected by EVTOAONPOL.AUX_COMPB occurs on EVSTAT0.AUX_COMPB.

field.name: AUX_COMPA
field.description: This event flag is set when edge selected by EVTOAONPOL.AUX_COMPA occurs on EVSTAT0.AUX_COMPA.

field.name: SWEV2
field.description: This event flag is set when software writes a 1 to SWEVSET.SWEV2.

field.name: SWEV1
field.description: This event flag is set when software writes a 1 to SWEVSET.SWEV1.

field.name: SWEV0
field.description: This event flag is set when software writes a 1 to SWEVSET.SWEV0.

register.name: EVTOAONPOL
register.description:
Events To AON Polarity
Event source polarity configuration for EVTOAONFLAGS.

field.name: RESERVED9
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: TIMER1_EV
field.description: Select the level of EVSTAT0.TIMER1_EV that sets EVTOAONFLAGS.TIMER1_EV.

field.name: TIMER0_EV
field.description: Select the level of EVSTAT0.TIMER0_EV that sets EVTOAONFLAGS.TIMER0_EV.

field.name: TDC_DONE

field.name: RESERVED2

register.name: DMACTL
register.description: Direct Memory Access Control

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: REQ_MODE
field.description: UDMA0 Request mode

enumeratedValue.name: SINGLE
enumeratedValue.description: Single requests are generated on UDMA0 channel 7 when the condition configured in SEL is met.

enumeratedValue.name: BURST
enumeratedValue.description: Burst requests are generated on UDMA0 channel 7 when the condition configured in SEL is met.

field.name: EN
field.description:
uDMA ADC interface enable.
0: Disable UDMA0 interface to ADC. 1: Enable UDMA0 interface to ADC.

field.name: SEL
field.description: Select FIFO watermark level required to trigger a UDMA0 transfer of ADC FIFO data.

enumeratedValue.name: FIFO_ALMOST_FULL
enumeratedValue.description: UDMA0 trigger event will be generated when the ADC FIFO is almost full (3/4 full).

enumeratedValue.name: FIFO_NOT_EMPTY
enumeratedValue.description: UDMA0 trigger event will be generated when there are samples in the ADC FIFO.

register.name: SWEVSET
register.description:
Software Event Set
Set software event flags from AUX domain to AON and MCU domains. CPUs in MCU domain can read the event flags from EVTOAONFLAGS and clear them in EVTOAONFLAGSCLR.
Use of these event flags is software-defined.

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: SWEV2
field.description:
Software event flag 2.
0: No effect. 1: Set software event flag 2.

field.name: SWEV1
field.description:
Software event flag 1.
0: No effect. 1: Set software event flag 1.

field.name: SWEV0
field.description:
Software event flag 0.
0: No effect. 1: Set software event flag 0.

register.name: EVSTAT0
register.description:
Event Status 0
Register holds events 0 thru 15 of the 32-bit event bus that is synchronous to AUX clock. The following subscribers use the asynchronous version of events in this register. - AUX_ANAIF. - AUX_TDC.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: AUXIO2
field.description: AUXIO2 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO0:GPIODIN bit 2.

field.name: AUXIO1
field.description: AUXIO1 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO0:GPIODIN bit 1.

field.name: AUXIO0
field.description: AUXIO0 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO0:GPIODIN bit 0.

field.name: AON_PROG_WU
field.description: AON_EVENT:AUXWUSEL.WU2_EV OR AON_EVENT:AUXWUSEL.WU1_EV OR AON_EVENT:AUXWUSEL.WU0_EV

field.name: AON_SW
field.description: AON_WUC:AUXCTL.SWEV

field.name: OBSMUX1
field.description: Observation input 1 from IOC. This event is configured by IOC:OBSAUXOUTPUT.SEL1.

field.name: OBSMUX0
field.description: Observation input 0 from IOC. This event is configured by IOC:OBSAUXOUTPUT.SEL0 and can be overridden by IOC:OBSAUXOUTPUT.SEL_MISC.

field.name: ADC_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL
field.description: AUX_ANAIF:ADCFIFOSTAT.ALMOST_FULL

field.name: ADC_DONE
field.description: AUX_ANAIF ADC conversion done event.

field.name: SMPH_AUTOTAKE_DONE
field.description: See AUX_SMPH:AUTOTAKE.SMPH_ID for description.

field.name: TIMER1_EV
field.description: AUX_TIMER1_EV event, see AUX_TIMER:T1TARGET for description.

field.name: TIMER0_EV
field.description: AUX_TIMER0_EV event, see AUX_TIMER:T0TARGET for description.

field.name: TDC_DONE
field.description: AUX_TDC:STAT.DONE

field.name: AUX_COMPB
field.description: Comparator B output

field.name: AUX_COMPA
field.description: Comparator A output

field.name: AON_RTC_CH2
field.description: AON_RTC:EVFLAGS.CH2

register.name: EVSTAT1
register.description:
Event Status 1
Current event source levels, 31:16

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: ADC_IRQ
field.description:
The logical function for this event is configurable.
When DMACTL.EN = 1 : Event = UDMA0 Channel 7 done event OR AUX_ANAIF:ADCFIFOSTAT.OVERFLOW OR AUX_ANAIF:ADCFIFOSTAT.UNDERFLOW
When DMACTL.EN = 0 : Event = (NOT AUX_ANAIF:ADCFIFOSTAT.EMPTY) OR AUX_ANAIF:ADCFIFOSTAT.OVERFLOW OR AUX_ANAIF:ADCFIFOSTAT.UNDERFLOW
Bit 7 in UDMA0:DONEMASK must be 0.

field.name: MCU_EV
field.description: Event from EVENT configured by EVENT:AUXSEL0.

field.name: ACLK_REF
field.description: TDC reference clock. It is configured by DDI_0_OSC:CTL0.ACLK_REF_SRC_SEL and enabled by AUX_WUC:REFCLKCTL.REQ.

register.name: EVTOMCUFLAGS
register.description:
Events to MCU Flags
This register contains a collection of event flags routed to MCU domain.
To clear an event flag, write to EVTOMCUFLAGSCLR or write 0 to event flag in this register. Follow procedure described in AUX_SYSIF:WUCLR to clear AUX_WU_EV event flag.

field.name: RESERVED11
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.description: This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.ADC_IRQ occurs on EVSTAT0.ADC_IRQ.

field.description: This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.MCU_OBSMUX0 occurs on EVSTAT0.MCU_OBSMUX0.

field.name: ADC_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL
field.description: This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.ADC_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL occurs on EVSTAT0.ADC_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL.

field.name: ADC_DONE
field.description: This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.ADC_DONE occurs on EVSTAT0.ADC_DONE.

field.name: SMPH_AUTOTAKE_DONE
field.description: This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.SMPH_AUTOTAKE_DONE occurs on EVSTAT0.SMPH_AUTOTAKE_DONE.

field.name: TIMER1_EV
field.description: This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.TIMER1_EV occurs on EVSTAT0.TIMER1_EV.

field.name: TIMER0_EV
field.description: This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.TIMER0_EV occurs on EVSTAT0.TIMER0_EV.

field.name: TDC_DONE
field.description: This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.TDC_DONE occurs on EVSTAT0.TDC_DONE.

field.name: AUX_COMPB
field.description: This event flag is set when edge selected by EVTOMCUPOL.AUX_COMPB occurs on EVSTAT0.AUX_COMPB.

field.name: AUX_COMPA
field.description: This event flag is set when edge selected by EVTOMCUPOL.AUX_COMPA occurs on EVSTAT0.AUX_COMPA.

field.name: AON_WU_EV
field.description: This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.AON_WU_EV occurs on the reduction-OR of the AUX_EVCTL:EVSTAT0.RTC_CH2_EV, AUX_EVCTL:EVSTAT0.AON_SW, and AUX_EVCTL:EVSTAT0.AON_PROG_WU events.

register.name: COMBEVTOMCUMASK
register.description:
Combined Event To MCU Mask
Select event flags in EVTOMCUFLAGS that contribute to the AUX_COMB event to EVENT and system CPU.
The AUX_COMB event is high as long as one or more of the included event flags are set.

field.name: RESERVED11
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.description:

0: Exclude. 1: Include.

field.description:

0: Exclude. 1: Include.

field.name: ADC_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL

0: Exclude. 1: Include.

field.description:

0: Exclude. 1: Include.

0: Exclude 1: Include.

field.name: AUX_COMPA

register.name: VECFLAGS
register.description:
Vector Flags
If a vector flag becomes 1 and AUX_SCE sleeps, AUX_SCE will wake up and execute the corresponding vector. The vector with the lowest index will execute first if multiple vectors flags are set. AUX_SCE must return to sleep to execute the next vector.
During execution of a vector, AUX_SCE must clear the vector flag that triggered execution. Write 1 to bit index n in VECFLAGSCLR to clear vector flag n.

field.name: RESERVED4
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: VEC3
field.description:
Vector flag 3.
The vector flag is set if the edge selected VECCFG1.VEC3_POL occurs on the event selected in VECCFG1.VEC3_EV.
The flag is cleared by writing a 0 to this bit, or (preferably) a 1 to VECFLAGSCLR.VEC3.

field.name: VEC2
field.description:
Vector flag 2.
The vector flag is set if the edge selected VECCFG1.VEC2_POL occurs on the event selected in VECCFG1.VEC2_EV.
The flag is cleared by writing a 0 to this bit, or (preferably) a 1 to VECFLAGSCLR.VEC2.

field.name: VEC1
field.description:
Vector flag 1.
The vector flag is set if the edge selected VECCFG0.VEC1_POL occurs on the event selected in VECCFG0.VEC1_EV.
The flag is cleared by writing a 0 to this bit, or (preferably) a 1 to VECFLAGSCLR.VEC1.

field.name: VEC0
field.description:
Vector flag 0.
The vector flag is set if the edge selected VECCFG0.VEC0_POL occurs on the event selected in VECCFG0.VEC0_EV.
The flag is cleared by writing a 0 to this bit, or (preferably) a 1 to VECFLAGSCLR.VEC0.

register.name: EVTOMCUFLAGSCLR
register.description:
Events To MCU Flags Clear
Clear event flags in EVTOMCUFLAGS.
In order to clear a level sensitive event flag, the event must be deasserted.

Read value is 0.

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: STAT
field.description:

0: Semaphore not available. 1: Semaphore granted.
