register.name: AUTOTAKE
register.description:
Auto Take
Sticky Request for Single Semaphore.

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: SMPH_ID
field.description:
Write the semaphore ID,0x0-0x7, to SMPH_ID to request this semaphore until it is granted.
When semaphore SMPH_ID is granted, event AUX_EVCTL:EVSTAT0.AUX_SMPH_AUTOTAKE_DONE becomes 1.
The event becomes 0 when software releases the semaphore or writes a new value to SMPH_ID.
To avoid corrupted semaphores: - Usage of this functionality must be restricted to one CPU core. - Software must wait until AUX_EVCTL:EVSTAT0.AUX_SMPH_AUTOTAKE_DONE is 1 before it writes a new value to SMPH_ID.

register.name: CTL
register.description: Control

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CMD
field.description: TDC commands.

enumeratedValue.name: ABORT
enumeratedValue.description:
Force TDC state machine back to IDLE state.
Never write this command while AUX_TDC:STAT.STATE equals CLR_CNT or WAIT_CLR_CNT_DONE.

enumeratedValue.name: RUN
enumeratedValue.description:
Asynchronous counter start.
The counter starts to count when the start event is high. To achieve precise edge-to-edge measurements you must ensure that the start event is low for at least 420 ns after you write this command.

enumeratedValue.name: RUN_SYNC_START
enumeratedValue.description:
Synchronous counter start.
The counter looks for the opposite edge of the selected start event before it starts to count when the selected edge occurs. This guarantees an edge-triggered start and is recommended for frequency measurements.

enumeratedValue.name: CLR_RESULT
enumeratedValue.description:
Clear STAT.SAT, STAT.DONE, and RESULT.VALUE.
This is not needed as prerequisite for a measurement. Reliable clear is only guaranteed from IDLE state.

register.name: STAT
register.description: Status

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: SAT
field.description:
TDC measurement saturation flag.
0: Conversion has not saturated. 1: Conversion stopped due to saturation.
This field is cleared when a new measurement is started or when CLR_RESULT is written to CTL.CMD.

field.name: DONE
field.description:
TDC measurement complete flag.
0: TDC measurement has not yet completed. 1: TDC measurement has completed.
This field clears when a new TDC measurement starts or when you write CLR_RESULT to CTL.CMD.

field.name: STATE
field.description: TDC state machine status.

enumeratedValue.name: FORCE_STOP
enumeratedValue.description: Current state is TDC_FORCESTOP. You wrote ABORT to CTL.CMD to abort the TDC measurement.

enumeratedValue.name: START_FALL
enumeratedValue.description: Current state is TDC_WAIT_STARTFALL. The fast-counter circuit waits for a falling edge on the start event.

enumeratedValue.name: WAIT_CLR_CNT_DONE
enumeratedValue.description: Current state is TDC_STATE_WAIT_CLRCNT_DONE. The state machine waits for fast-counter circuit to finish reset.

enumeratedValue.name: POR
enumeratedValue.description: Current state is TDC_STATE_POR. This is the reset state.

enumeratedValue.name: GET_RESULT
enumeratedValue.description: Current state is TDC_STATE_GETRESULTS. The state machine copies the counter value from the fast-counter circuit.

enumeratedValue.name: WAIT_STOP_CNTDWN
enumeratedValue.description: Current state is TDC_STATE_WAIT_STOPCNTDOWN. The fast-counter circuit looks for the stop condition. It will ignore a number of stop events configured in TRIGCNTLOAD.CNT.

enumeratedValue.name: WAIT_STOP
enumeratedValue.description: Current state is TDC_STATE_WAIT_STOP. The state machine waits for the fast-counter circuit to stop.

enumeratedValue.name: CLR_CNT
enumeratedValue.description: Current state is TDC_STATE_CLRCNT. The fast-counter circuit is reset.

enumeratedValue.name: IDLE
enumeratedValue.description: Current state is TDC_STATE_IDLE. This is the default state after reset and abortion. State will change when you write CTL.CMD to either RUN_SYNC_START or RUN.

enumeratedValue.name: WAIT_START_STOP_CNT_EN
enumeratedValue.description: Current state is TDC_STATE_WAIT_STARTSTOPCNTEN. The fast-counter circuit looks for the start condition. The state machine waits for the fast-counter to increment.

enumeratedValue.name: WAIT_START
enumeratedValue.description: Current state is TDC_STATE_WAIT_START. The fast-counter circuit looks for the start condition. The state machine waits for the fast-counter to increment.

register.name: RESULT
register.description:
Result
Result of last TDC conversion

field.name: RESERVED25
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: VALUE
field.description:
TDC conversion result.
The result of the TDC conversion is given in number of clock edges of the clock source selected in DDI_0_OSC:CTL0.ACLK_TDC_SRC_SEL. Both rising and falling edges are counted.
If TDC counter saturates, VALUE is slightly higher than SATCFG.LIMIT, as it takes a non-zero time to stop the measurement. Hence, the maximum value of this field becomes slightly higher than 2^24 if you configure SATCFG.LIMIT to R24.

register.name: SATCFG
register.description: Saturation Configuration

field.name: RESERVED4
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: LIMIT
field.description:
Saturation limit.
The flag STAT.SAT is set when the TDC counter saturates.
Values not enumerated are not supported

enumeratedValue.name: R24
enumeratedValue.description: Result bit 24: TDC conversion saturates and stops when RESULT.VALUE[24] is set.

enumeratedValue.name: R23
enumeratedValue.description: Result bit 23: TDC conversion saturates and stops when RESULT.VALUE[23] is set.

enumeratedValue.name: R22
enumeratedValue.description: Result bit 22: TDC conversion saturates and stops when RESULT.VALUE[22] is set.

enumeratedValue.name: R21
enumeratedValue.description: Result bit 21: TDC conversion saturates and stops when RESULT.VALUE[21] is set.

enumeratedValue.name: R20
enumeratedValue.description: Result bit 20: TDC conversion saturates and stops when RESULT.VALUE[20] is set.

enumeratedValue.name: R19
enumeratedValue.description: Result bit 19: TDC conversion saturates and stops when RESULT.VALUE[19] is set.

enumeratedValue.name: R18
enumeratedValue.description: Result bit 18: TDC conversion saturates and stops when RESULT.VALUE[18] is set.

enumeratedValue.name: R17
enumeratedValue.description: Result bit 17: TDC conversion saturates and stops when RESULT.VALUE[17] is set.

enumeratedValue.name: R16
enumeratedValue.description: Result bit 16: TDC conversion saturates and stops when RESULT.VALUE[16] is set.

enumeratedValue.name: R15
enumeratedValue.description: Result bit 15: TDC conversion saturates and stops when RESULT.VALUE[15] is set.

enumeratedValue.name: R14
enumeratedValue.description: Result bit 14: TDC conversion saturates and stops when RESULT.VALUE[14] is set.

enumeratedValue.name: R13
enumeratedValue.description: Result bit 13: TDC conversion saturates and stops when RESULT.VALUE[13] is set.

enumeratedValue.name: R12
enumeratedValue.description: Result bit 12: TDC conversion saturates and stops when RESULT.VALUE[12] is set.

register.name: TRIGSRC
register.description:
Trigger Source
Select source and polarity for TDC start and stop events. See the Technical Reference Manual for event timing requirements.

field.name: RESERVED14
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: STOP_POL
field.description:
Polarity of stop source.
Change only while STAT.STATE is IDLE.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: TDC conversion stops when low level is detected.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: TDC conversion stops when high level is detected.

field.name: STOP_SRC
field.description:
Select stop source from the asynchronous AUX event bus.
Change only while STAT.STATE is IDLE.

enumeratedValue.name: TDC_PRE
enumeratedValue.description: Select TDC Prescaler event which is generated by configuration of PRECTL.

field.name: RESERVED6
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: START_POL
field.description:
Polarity of start source.
Change only while STAT.STATE is IDLE.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: TDC conversion starts when low level is detected.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: TDC conversion starts when high level is detected.

field.name: START_SRC
field.description:
Select start source from the asynchronous AUX event bus.
Change only while STAT.STATE is IDLE.

enumeratedValue.name: TDC_PRE
enumeratedValue.description: Select TDC Prescaler event which is generated by configuration of PRECTL.

register.name: TRIGCNT
register.description:
Trigger Counter
Stop-counter control and status.

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CNT
field.description:
Number of stop events to ignore when AUX_TDC:TRIGCNTCFG.EN is 1.
Read CNT to get the remaining number of stop events to ignore during a TDC measurement.
Write CNT to update the remaining number of stop events to ignore during a TDC measurement. The TDC measurement ignores updates of CNT if there are no more stop events left to ignore.
When AUX_TDC:TRIGCNTCFG.EN is 1, TRIGCNTLOAD.CNT is loaded into CNT at the start of the measurement.

register.name: TRIGCNTLOAD
register.description:
Trigger Counter Load
Stop-counter load.

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CNT
field.description:
Number of stop events to ignore when AUX_TDC:TRIGCNTCFG.EN is 1.
To measure frequency of an event source: - Set start event equal to stop event. - Set CNT to number of periods to measure. Both 0 and 1 values measures a single event source period.
To measure pulse width of an event source: - Set start event source equal to stop event source. - Select different polarity for start and stop event. - Set CNT to 0.
To measure time from the start event to the Nth stop event when N > 1: - Select different start and stop event source. - Set CNT to (N-1).
See the Technical Reference Manual for event timing requirements.
When AUX_TDC:TRIGCNTCFG.EN is 1, CNT is loaded into TRIGCNT.CNT at the start of the measurement.

register.name: TRIGCNTCFG
register.description:
Trigger Counter Configuration
Stop-counter configuration.

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: EN
field.description:
Enable stop-counter.
0: Disable stop-counter. 1: Enable stop-counter.
Change only while STAT.STATE is IDLE.

register.name: PRECTL
register.description:
Prescaler Control
The prescaler can be used to count events that are faster than the AUX clock frequency. It can be used to: - count pulses on a specified event from the asynchronous event bus. - prescale a specified event from the asynchronous event bus.
To use the prescaler output as an event source in TDC measurements you must set both TRIGSRC.START_SRC and TRIGSRC.STOP_SRC to AUX_TDC_PRE.
It is recommended to use the prescaler when the signal frequency to measure exceeds 1/10th of the AUX clock frequency.

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: RESET_N
field.description:
Prescaler reset.
0: Reset prescaler. 1: Release reset of prescaler.
AUX_TDC_PRE event becomes 0 when you reset the prescaler.

field.name: RATIO
field.description:
Prescaler ratio.
This controls how often the AUX_TDC_PRE event is generated by the prescaler.

enumeratedValue.name: DIV64
enumeratedValue.description:
Prescaler divides input by 64.
AUX_TDC_PRE event has a rising edge for every 64 rising edges of the input. AUX_TDC_PRE event toggles on every 32nd rising edge of the input.

enumeratedValue.name: DIV16
enumeratedValue.description:
Prescaler divides input by 16.
AUX_TDC_PRE event has a rising edge for every 16 rising edges of the input. AUX_TDC_PRE event toggles on every 8th rising edge of the input.

field.name: RESERVED5
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: SRC
field.description:
Prescaler event source.
Select an event from the asynchronous AUX event bus to connect to the prescaler input.
Configure only while RESET_N is 0.

register.name: PRECNT
register.description: Prescaler Counter

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CNT
field.description:
Prescaler counter value.
Write a value to CNT to capture the value of the 16-bit prescaler counter into CNT. Read CNT to get the captured value.
The read value gets 1 LSB uncertainty if the event source level rises when you release the reset.
You must capture the prescaler counter value when the event source level is stable, either high or low: - Disable AUX I/O input buffer to clamp AUXIO event low. - Disable COMPA to clamp AUX_COMPA event low. The read value can in general get 1 LSB uncertainty when you gate the event source asynchronously.
Please note the following: - The prescaler counter is reset to 2 by PRECTL.RESET_N. - The captured value is 2 when the number of rising edges on prescaler input is less than 3. Otherwise, captured value equals number of event pulses - 1.

register.name: T0CFG
register.description: Timer 0 Configuration

field.name: RESERVED14
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: TICK_SRC_POL
field.description: Tick source polarity for Timer 0.

enumeratedValue.name: FALL
enumeratedValue.description: Count on falling edges of TICK_SRC.

enumeratedValue.name: RISE
enumeratedValue.description: Count on rising edges of TICK_SRC.

field.name: TICK_SRC
field.description: Select Timer 0 tick source from the synchronous event bus.

enumeratedValue.name: RTC_4KHZ
enumeratedValue.description: AON_RTC:SUBSEC.VALUE bit 19. AON_RTC:CTL.RTC_4KHZ_EN enables this event.

field.name: PRE
field.description:
Prescaler division ratio is 2^PRE:
0x0: Divide by 1. 0x1: Divide by 2. 0x2: Divide by 4. ... 0xF: Divide by 32,768.

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: MODE
field.description:
Timer 0 mode.
Configure source for Timer 0 prescaler.

enumeratedValue.name: TICK
enumeratedValue.description: Use event set by TICK_SRC as source for prescaler.

enumeratedValue.name: CLK
enumeratedValue.description: Use AUX clock as source for prescaler.

field.name: RELOAD
field.description: Timer 0 reload mode.

enumeratedValue.name: CONT
enumeratedValue.description:
Continuous mode.
Timer 0 restarts when the counter value becomes equal to or greater than ( T0TARGET.VALUE - 1).

enumeratedValue.name: MAN
enumeratedValue.description:
Manual mode.
Timer 0 stops and T0CTL.EN becomes 0 when the counter value becomes equal to or greater than T0TARGET.VALUE.

register.name: T1CFG
register.description: Timer 1 Configuration

field.name: RESERVED14
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: TICK_SRC_POL
field.description: Tick source polarity for Timer 1.

enumeratedValue.name: FALL
enumeratedValue.description: Count on falling edges of TICK_SRC.

enumeratedValue.name: RISE
enumeratedValue.description: Count on rising edges of TICK_SRC.

field.name: TICK_SRC
field.description: Select Timer 1 tick source from the synchronous event bus.

enumeratedValue.name: RTC_4KHZ
enumeratedValue.description: AON_RTC:SUBSEC.VALUE bit 19. AON_RTC:CTL.RTC_4KHZ_EN enables this event.

field.name: PRE
field.description:
Prescaler division ratio is 2^PRE:
0x0: Divide by 1. 0x1: Divide by 2. 0x2: Divide by 4. ... 0xF: Divide by 32,768.

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: MODE
field.description:
Timer 1 mode.
Configure source for Timer 1 prescaler.

enumeratedValue.name: TICK
enumeratedValue.description: Use event set by TICK_SRC as source for prescaler.

enumeratedValue.name: CLK
enumeratedValue.description: Use AUX clock as source for prescaler.

field.name: RELOAD
field.description: Timer 1 reload mode.

enumeratedValue.name: CONT
enumeratedValue.description:
Continuous mode.
Timer 1 restarts when the counter value becomes equal to or greater than ( T1TARGET.VALUE - 1).

register.name: T0CTL
register.description: Timer 0 Control

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: EN
field.description:
Timer 0 enable.
0: Disable Timer 0. 1: Enable Timer 0.
The counter restarts from 0 when you enable Timer 0.

register.name: T0TARGET
register.description: Timer 0 Target

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: VALUE
field.description:
Timer 0 target value.
Manual Reload Mode: - Timer 0 increments until the counter value becomes equal to or greater than VALUE. - AUX_TIMER0_EV pulses high for 1 AUX clock period when the counter value is equal to or greater than VALUE.
Note: When VALUE is 0, Timer 0 counts to 1. AUX_TIMER0_EV pulses high for 1 AUX clock period.
Continuous Reload Mode: - Timer 0 increments until the counter value becomes equal to or greater than ( VALUE - 1), then restarts from 0. - AUX_TIMER0_EV pulses high for 1 AUX clock period when the counter value is 0, except for when you enable the timer.
Note: When VALUE is less than 2, Timer 0 counter value remains 0. AUX_TIMER0_EV goes high and remains high 1 AUX clock period after you enable the timer.
It is allowed to update the VALUE while the timer runs.

register.name: T1TARGET
register.description:
Timer 1 Target
Timer 1 counter target value

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: VALUE
field.description:
Timer 1 target value.
Manual Reload Mode: - Timer 1 increments until the counter value becomes equal to or greater than VALUE. - AUX_TIMER1_EV pulses high for 1 AUX clock period when the counter value is equal to or greater than VALUE.
Note: When VALUE is 0, Timer 1 counts to 1. AUX_TIMER1_EV pulses high for 1 AUX clock period.
Continuous Reload Mode: - Timer 1 increments until the counter value becomes equal to or greater than ( VALUE - 1), then restarts from 0. - AUX_TIMER1_EV pulses high for 1 AUX clock period when the counter value is 0, except for when you enable the timer.
Note: When VALUE is less than 2, Timer 1 counter value remains 0. AUX_TIMER1_EV goes high and remains high 1 AUX clock period after you enable the timer.
It is allowed to update the VALUE while the timer runs.

register.name: T1CTL
register.description: Timer 1 Control

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: EN
field.description:
Timer 1 enable.
0: Disable Timer 1. 1: Enable Timer 1.
The counter restarts from 0 when you enable Timer 1.

register.name: MODCLKEN0
register.description:
Module Clock Enable
Clock enable for each module in the AUX domain
For use by the system CPU
The settings in this register are OR'ed with the corresponding settings in MODCLKEN1. This allows the system CPU and AUX_SCE to request clocks independently. Settings take effect immediately.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: AUX_ADI4
field.description: Enables (1) or disables (0) clock for AUX_ADI4.

enumeratedValue.name: EN
enumeratedValue.description: System CPU has requested clock for AUX_ADI4

enumeratedValue.name: DIS
enumeratedValue.description: System CPU has not requested clock for AUX_ADI4

field.description: Enables (1) or disables (0) clock for AUX_DDI0_OSC.

field.name: TDC
field.description:
Enables (1) or disables (0) clock for AUX_TDCIF.
Note that the TDC counter and reference clock sources must be requested separately using TDCCLKCTL and REFCLKCTL, respectively.

enumeratedValue.name: EN

enumeratedValue.name: DIS

field.description:
Enables (1) or disables (0) clock for AUX_ANAIF.
Note that the ADC internal clock must be requested separately using ADCCLKCTL.

register.name: PWROFFREQ
register.description:
Power Off Request
Requests power off request for the AUX domain. When powered off, the power supply and clock is disabled. This may only be used when taking the entire device into shutdown mode (i.e. with full device reset when resuming operation).
Power off is prevented if AON_WUC:AUXCTL.AUX_FORCE_ON has been set, or if MCUBUSCTL.DISCONNECT_REQ has been cleared.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: REQ
field.description:
Power off request
0: No action 1: Request to power down AUX. Once set, this bit shall not be cleared. The bit will be reset again when AUX is powered up again.
The request will only happen if AONCTLSTAT.AUX_FORCE_ON = 0 and MCUBUSSTAT.DISCONNECTED=1.

register.name: PWRDWNREQ
register.description:
Power Down Request
Request from AUX for system to enter power down. When system is in power down there is limited current supply available and the clock source is set by AON_WUC:AUXCLK.PWR_DWN_SRC

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: REQ
field.description:
Power down request
0: Request for system to be in active mode 1: Request for system to be in power down mode
When REQ is 1 one shall assume that the system is in power down, and that current supply is limited. When setting REQ = 0, one shall assume that the system is in power down until PWRDWNACK.ACK = 0

register.name: PWRDWNACK
register.description: Power Down Acknowledgment

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: ACK
field.description:
Power down acknowledgment. Indicates whether the power down request given by PWRDWNREQ.REQ is captured by the AON domain or not
0: AUX can assume that the system is in active mode 1: The request for power down is acknowledged and the AUX must act like the system is in power down mode and power supply is limited
The system CPU cannot use this bit since the bus bridge between MCU domain and AUX domain is always disconnected when this bit is set. For AUX_SCE use only

register.name: CLKLFREQ
register.description: Low Frequency Clock Request

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: REQ
field.description:
Low frequency request
0: Request clock frequency to be controlled by AON_WUC:AUXCLK and the system state 1: Request low frequency clock SCLK_LF as the clock source for AUX
This bit must not be modified unless CLKLFACK.ACK matches the current value

register.name: CLKLFACK
register.description: Low Frequency Clock Acknowledgment

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: ACK
field.description:
Acknowledgment of CLKLFREQ.REQ
0: Acknowledgement that clock frequency is controlled by AON_WUC:AUXCLK and the system state 1: Acknowledgement that the low frequency clock SCLK_LF is the clock source for AUX

register.name: WUEVFLAGS
register.description:
Wake-up Event Flags
Status of wake-up events from the AON domain
The event flags are cleared by setting the corresponding bits in WUEVCLR

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: AON_RTC_CH2
field.description: Indicates pending event from AON_RTC_CH2 compare. Note that this flag will be set whenever the AON_RTC_CH2 event happens, but that does not mean that this event is a wake-up event. To make the AON_RTC_CH2 a wake-up event for the AUX domain configure it as a wake-up event in AON_EVENT:AUXWUSEL.WU0_EV, AON_EVENT:AUXWUSEL.WU1_EV or AON_EVENT:AUXWUSEL.WU2_EV.

field.name: AON_SW
field.description: Indicates pending event triggered by system CPU writing a 1 to AON_WUC:AUXCTL.SWEV.

field.name: AON_PROG_WU
field.description: Indicates pending event triggered by the sources selected in AON_EVENT:AUXWUSEL.WU0_EV, AON_EVENT:AUXWUSEL.WU1_EV and AON_EVENT:AUXWUSEL.WU2_EV.

register.name: WUEVCLR
register.description:
Wake-up Event Clear
Clears wake-up events from the AON domain

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: AON_RTC_CH2
field.description:
Set to clear the WUEVFLAGS.AON_RTC_CH2 wake-up event. Note that if RTC channel 2 is also set as source for AON_PROG_WU this field can also clear WUEVFLAGS.AON_PROG_WU
This bit must remain set until WUEVFLAGS.AON_RTC_CH2 returns to 0.

field.name: AON_SW
field.description:
Set to clear the WUEVFLAGS.AON_SW wake-up event.
This bit must remain set until WUEVFLAGS.AON_SW returns to 0.

field.name: AON_PROG_WU
field.description:
Set to clear the WUEVFLAGS.AON_PROG_WU wake-up event. Note only if an IO event is selected as wake-up event, is it possible to use this field to clear the source. Other sources cannot be cleared using this field.
The IO pin needs to be assigned to AUX in the IOC and the input enable for the pin needs to be set in AIODIO0 or AIODIO1 for this clearing to take effect.
This bit must remain set until WUEVFLAGS.AON_PROG_WU returns to 0.

register.name: ADCCLKCTL
register.description:
ADC Clock Control
Controls the ADC internal clock
Note that the ADC command and data interface requires MODCLKEN0.ANAIF or MODCLKEN1.ANAIF also to be set

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: ACK
field.description: Acknowledges the last value written to REQ.

field.name: REQ
field.description:
Enables(1) or disables (0) the ADC internal clock.
This bit must not be modified unless ACK matches the current value.

register.name: TDCCLKCTL
register.description:
TDC Clock Control
Controls the TDC counter clock source, which steps the TDC counter value
The source of this clock is controlled by OSC_DIG:CTL0.ACLK_TDC_SRC_SEL.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: ACK
field.description: Acknowledges the last value written to REQ.

field.name: REQ
field.description:
Enables(1) or disables (0) the TDC counter clock source.
This bit must not be modified unless ACK matches the current value.

register.name: REFCLKCTL
register.description:
Reference Clock Control
Controls the TDC reference clock source, which is to be compared against the TDC counter clock.
The source of this clock is controlled by OSC_DIG:CTL0.ACLK_REF_SRC_SEL.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: ACK
field.description: Acknowledges the last value written to REQ.

field.name: REQ
field.description:
Enables(1) or disables (0) the TDC reference clock source.
This bit must not be modified unless ACK matches the current value.

register.name: RTCSUBSECINC0
register.description:
Real Time Counter Sub Second Increment 0
New value for the real-time counter (AON_RTC) sub-second increment value, part corresponding to AON_RTC:SUBSECINC bits 15:0.
After setting INC15_0 and RTCSUBSECINC1.INC23_16, the value is loaded into AON_RTC:SUBSECINC.VALUEINC by setting RTCSUBSECINCCTL.UPD_REQ.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: INC15_0
field.description: Bits 15:0 of the RTC sub-second increment value.

register.name: RTCSUBSECINC1
register.description:
Real Time Counter Sub Second Increment 1
New value for the real-time counter (AON_RTC) sub-second increment value, part corresponding to AON_RTC:SUBSECINC bits 23:16.
After setting RTCSUBSECINC0.INC15_0 and INC23_16, the value is loaded into AON_RTC:SUBSECINC.VALUEINC by setting RTCSUBSECINCCTL.UPD_REQ.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: INC23_16
field.description: Bits 23:16 of the RTC sub-second increment value.

register.name: RTCSUBSECINCCTL
register.description: Real Time Counter Sub Second Increment Control

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: UPD_ACK
field.description: Acknowledgment of the UPD_REQ.

field.name: UPD_REQ
field.description:
Signal that a new real time counter sub second increment value is available
0: New sub second increment is not available 1: New sub second increment is available
This bit must not be modified unless UPD_ACK matches the current value.

register.name: MCUBUSCTL
register.description:
MCU Bus Control
Controls the connection between the AUX domain bus and the MCU domain bus.
The buses must be disconnected to allow power-down or power-off of the AUX domain.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: DISCONNECT_REQ
field.description:
Requests the AUX domain bus to be disconnected from the MCU domain bus. The request has no effect when AON_WUC:AUX_CTL.AUX_FORCE_ON is set.
The disconnection status can be monitored through MCUBUSSTAT. Note however that this register cannot be read by the system CPU while disconnected.
It is recommended that this bit is set and remains set after initial power-up, and that the system CPU uses AON_WUC:AUX_CTL.AUX_FORCE_ON to connect/disconnect the bus.

register.name: MCUBUSSTAT
register.description:
MCU Bus Status
Indicates the connection state of the AUX domain and MCU domain buses.
Note that this register cannot be read from the MCU domain while disconnected, and is therefore only useful for the AUX_SCE.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: DISCONNECTED
field.description: Indicates whether the AUX domain and MCU domain buses are currently disconnected (1) or connected (0).

field.name: DISCONNECT_ACK
field.description:
Acknowledges reception of the bus disconnection request, by matching the value of MCUBUSCTL.DISCONNECT_REQ.
Note that if AON_WUC:AUXCTL.AUX_FORCE_ON = 1 a reconnect to the MCU domain bus will be made regardless of the state of MCUBUSCTL.DISCONNECT_REQ

register.name: AONCTLSTAT
register.description:
AON Domain Control Status
Status of AUX domain control from AON_WUC.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: AUX_FORCE_ON
field.description: Status of AON_WUC:AUX_CTL.AUX_FORCE_ON.

field.name: SCE_RUN_EN
field.description: Status of AON_WUC:AUX_CTL.SCE_RUN_EN.

register.name: AUXIOLATCH
register.description:
AUX Input Output Latch
Controls latching of signals between AUX_AIODIO0/AUX_AIODIO1 and AON_IOC.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: EN
field.description:
Opens (1) or closes (0) the AUX_AIODIO0/AUX_AIODIO1 signal latching.
At startup, set EN = TRANSP before configuring AUX_AIODIO0/AUX_AIODIO1 and subsequently selecting AUX mode in the AON_IOC.
When powering off the AUX domain (using PWROFFREQ.REQ), set EN = STATIC in advance preserve the current state (mode and output value) of the I/O pins.

register.name: MODCLKEN1
register.description:
Module Clock Enable 1
Clock enable for each module in the AUX domain, for use by the AUX_SCE. Settings take effect immediately.
The settings in this register are OR'ed with the corresponding settings in MODCLKEN0. This allows system CPU and AUX_SCE to request clocks independently.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: AUX_ADI4
field.description: Enables (1) or disables (0) clock for AUX_ADI4.

enumeratedValue.name: EN
enumeratedValue.description: AUX_SCE has requested clock for AUX_ADI4

enumeratedValue.name: DIS
enumeratedValue.description: AUX_SCE has not requested clock for AUX_ADI4

field.name: AUX_DDI0_OSC
field.description: Enables (1) or disables (0) clock for AUX_DDI0_OSC.

enumeratedValue.description: AUX_SCE has requested clock for AUX_DDI0_OSC

enumeratedValue.name: DIS

field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: ANAIF

field.name: TIMER

enumeratedValue.name: EN

field.name: AIODIO1

enumeratedValue.name: EN
enumeratedValue.description: AUX_SCE has requested clock for AIODIO1

enumeratedValue.name: DIS
enumeratedValue.description: AUX_SCE has not requested clock for AIODIO1

field.name: AIODIO0
field.description: Enables (1) or disables (0) clock for AUX_AIODIO0.

enumeratedValue.name: EN

field.name: SMPH
field.description: Enables (1) or disables (0) clock for AUX_SMPH.

enumeratedValue.name: EN
enumeratedValue.description: AUX_SCE has requested clock for SMPH

enumeratedValue.name: DIS
enumeratedValue.description: AUX_SCE has not requested clock for SMPH

register.name: RESERVED_0
register.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: RESERVED0
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

register.name: EXT_LF_CLK
register.description: Extern LF clock configuration

field.name: DIO
field.description: Unsigned integer, selecting the DIO to supply external 32kHz clock as SCLK_LF when MODE_CONF.SCLK_LF_OPTION is set to EXTERNAL. The selected DIO will be marked as reserved by the pin driver (TI-RTOS environment) and hence not selectable for other usage.

field.name: RTC_INCREMENT
field.description: Unsigned integer, defining the input frequency of the external clock and is written to AON_RTC:SUBSECINC.VALUEINC. Defined as follows: EXT_LF_CLK.RTC_INCREMENT = 2^38/InputClockFrequency in Hertz (e.g.: RTC_INCREMENT=0x800000 for InputClockFrequency=32768 Hz)

register.name: MODE_CONF_1
register.description: Mode Configuration 1

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: ALT_DCDC_VMIN
field.description:
Minimum voltage for when DC/DC should be used if alternate DC/DC setting is enabled (SIZE_AND_DIS_FLAGS.DIS_ALT_DCDC_SETTING=0). Voltage = (28 + ALT_DCDC_VMIN) / 16. 0: 1.75V 1: 1.8125V ... 14: 2.625V 15: 2.6875V
NOTE! The DriverLib function SysCtrl_DCDC_VoltageConditionalControl() must be called regularly to apply this field (handled automatically if using TI RTOS!).

field.name: ALT_DCDC_DITHER_EN
field.description: Enable DC/DC dithering if alternate DC/DC setting is enabled (SIZE_AND_DIS_FLAGS.DIS_ALT_DCDC_SETTING=0). 0: Dither disable 1: Dither enable

field.name: ALT_DCDC_IPEAK
field.description: Inductor peak current if alternate DC/DC setting is enabled (SIZE_AND_DIS_FLAGS.DIS_ALT_DCDC_SETTING=0). Assuming 10uH external inductor! Peak current = 31 + ( 4 * ALT_DCDC_IPEAK ) : 0: 31mA (min) ... 4: 47mA ... 7: 59mA (max)

field.name: DELTA_IBIAS_INIT
field.description: Signed delta value for IBIAS_INIT. Delta value only applies if SIZE_AND_DIS_FLAGS.DIS_XOSC_OVR=0. See FCFG1:AMPCOMP_CTRL1.IBIAS_INIT

field.name: DELTA_IBIAS_OFFSET
field.description: Signed delta value for IBIAS_OFFSET. Delta value only applies if SIZE_AND_DIS_FLAGS.DIS_XOSC_OVR=0. See FCFG1:AMPCOMP_CTRL1.IBIAS_OFFSET

field.name: XOSC_MAX_START
field.description: Unsigned value of maximum XOSC startup time (worst case) in units of 100us. Value only applies if SIZE_AND_DIS_FLAGS.DIS_XOSC_OVR=0.

register.name: SIZE_AND_DIS_FLAGS
register.description: CCFG Size and Disable Flags

field.name: SIZE_OF_CCFG
field.description: Total size of CCFG in bytes.

field.name: DISABLE_FLAGS
field.description: Reserved for future use. Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset/default value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: DIS_TCXO
field.description: Disable TCXO. 0: TCXO functionality enabled. 1: TCXO functionality disabled. Note: An external TCXO is required if DIS_TCXO = 0.

field.name: DIS_GPRAM
field.description: Disable GPRAM (or use the 8K VIMS RAM as CACHE RAM). 0: GPRAM is enabled and hence CACHE disabled. 1: GPRAM is disabled and instead CACHE is enabled (default). Notes: - Disabling CACHE will reduce CPU execution speed (up to 60%). - GPRAM is 8 K-bytes in size and located at 0x11000000-0x11001FFF if enabled. See: VIMS:CTL.MODE

field.name: DIS_ALT_DCDC_SETTING
field.description:
Disable alternate DC/DC settings. 0: Enable alternate DC/DC settings. 1: Disable alternate DC/DC settings. See: MODE_CONF_1.ALT_DCDC_VMIN MODE_CONF_1.ALT_DCDC_DITHER_EN MODE_CONF_1.ALT_DCDC_IPEAK
NOTE! The DriverLib function SysCtrl_DCDC_VoltageConditionalControl() must be called regularly to apply this field (handled automatically if using TI RTOS!).

field.name: DIS_XOSC_OVR
field.description: Disable XOSC override functionality. 0: Enable XOSC override functionality. 1: Disable XOSC override functionality. See: MODE_CONF_1.DELTA_IBIAS_INIT MODE_CONF_1.DELTA_IBIAS_OFFSET MODE_CONF_1.XOSC_MAX_START

register.name: MODE_CONF
register.description: Mode Configuration 0

field.name: VDDR_TRIM_SLEEP_DELTA
field.description: Signed delta value to apply to the VDDR_TRIM_SLEEP target, minus one. See FCFG1:VOLT_TRIM.VDDR_TRIM_SLEEP_H. 0x8 (-8) : Delta = -7 ... 0xF (-1) : Delta = 0 0x0 (0) : Delta = +1 ... 0x7 (7) : Delta = +8

field.name: DCDC_RECHARGE
field.description:
DC/DC during recharge in powerdown. 0: Use the DC/DC during recharge in powerdown. 1: Do not use the DC/DC during recharge in powerdown (default).
NOTE! The DriverLib function SysCtrl_DCDC_VoltageConditionalControl() must be called regularly to apply this field (handled automatically if using TI RTOS!).

field.name: DCDC_ACTIVE
field.description:
DC/DC in active mode. 0: Use the DC/DC during active mode. 1: Do not use the DC/DC during active mode (default).
NOTE! The DriverLib function SysCtrl_DCDC_VoltageConditionalControl() must be called regularly to apply this field (handled automatically if using TI RTOS!).

field.name: VDDR_EXT_LOAD
field.description: Reserved for future use. Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset/default value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: VDDS_BOD_LEVEL
field.description: VDDS BOD level. 0: VDDS BOD level is 2.0 V (necessary for maximum PA output power on CC13x0). 1: VDDS BOD level is 1.8 V (or 1.7 V for external regulator mode) (default).

field.name: SCLK_LF_OPTION
field.description: Select source for SCLK_LF.

enumeratedValue.name: EXTERNAL_LF
enumeratedValue.description: External low frequency clock on DIO defined by EXT_LF_CLK.DIO. The RTC tick speed AON_RTC:SUBSECINC is updated to EXT_LF_CLK.RTC_INCREMENT (done in the trimDevice() xxWare boot function). External clock must always be running when the chip is in standby for VDDR recharge timing.

enumeratedValue.name: XOSC_HF_DLF
enumeratedValue.description: 31.25kHz clock derived from 24MHz XOSC (dividing by 768 in HW). The RTC tick speed [AON_RTC.SUBSECINC.*] is updated to 0x8637BD, corresponding to a 31.25kHz clock (done in the trimDevice() xxWare boot function). Standby power mode is not supported when using this clock source.

field.name: VDDR_TRIM_SLEEP_TC
field.description:
0x1: VDDR_TRIM_SLEEP_DELTA is not temperature compensated 0x0: RTOS/driver temperature compensates VDDR_TRIM_SLEEP_DELTA every time standby mode is entered. This improves low-temperature RCOSC_LF frequency stability in standby mode.
When temperature compensation is performed, the delta is calculates this way: Delta = max (delta, min(8, floor(62-temp)/8)) Here, delta is given by VDDR_TRIM_SLEEP_DELTA, and temp is the current temperature in degrees C.

field.name: RTC_COMP
field.description: Reserved for future use. Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset/default value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: XOSC_FREQ
field.description: Reserved for future use. Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset/default value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: XOSC_CAP_MOD
field.description: Enable modification (delta) to XOSC cap-array. Value specified in XOSC_CAPARRAY_DELTA. 0: Apply cap-array delta 1: Do not apply cap-array delta (default)

field.name: HF_COMP
field.description: Reserved for future use. Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset/default value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: XOSC_CAPARRAY_DELTA
field.description: Signed 8-bit value, directly modifying trimmed XOSC cap-array step value. Enabled by XOSC_CAP_MOD.

field.name: VDDR_CAP
field.description:
Unsigned 8-bit integer, representing the minimum decoupling capacitance (worst case) on VDDR, in units of 100nF. This should take into account capacitor tolerance and voltage dependent capacitance variation. This bit affects the recharge period calculation when going into powerdown or standby.
NOTE! If using the following functions this field must be configured (used by TI RTOS): SysCtrlSetRechargeBeforePowerDown() SysCtrlAdjustRechargeAfterPowerDown()

register.name: VOLT_LOAD_0
register.description: Voltage Load 0 Enabled by MODE_CONF.VDDR_EXT_LOAD.

field.name: VDDR_EXT_TP45
field.description: Reserved for future use. Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset/default value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: VDDR_EXT_TP25
field.description: Reserved for future use. Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset/default value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: VDDR_EXT_TP5
field.description: Reserved for future use. Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset/default value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: VDDR_EXT_TM15
field.description: Reserved for future use. Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset/default value may result in undefined behavior.

register.name: VOLT_LOAD_1
register.description: Voltage Load 1 Enabled by MODE_CONF.VDDR_EXT_LOAD.

field.description: Reserved for future use. Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset/default value may result in undefined behavior.

register.name: IEEE_MAC_0
register.description: IEEE MAC Address 0

field.name: ADDR
field.description: Bits[31:0] of the 64-bits custom IEEE MAC address. If different from 0xFFFFFFFF then the value of this field is applied; otherwise use value from FCFG.

register.name: IEEE_MAC_1
register.description: IEEE MAC Address 1

field.name: ADDR
field.description: Bits[63:32] of the 64-bits custom IEEE MAC address. If different from 0xFFFFFFFF then the value of this field is applied; otherwise use value from FCFG.

register.name: IEEE_BLE_0
register.description: IEEE BLE Address 0

field.name: ADDR
field.description: Bits[31:0] of the 64-bits custom IEEE BLE address. If different from 0xFFFFFFFF then the value of this field is applied; otherwise use value from FCFG.

register.name: IEEE_BLE_1
register.description: IEEE BLE Address 1

field.name: ADDR
field.description: Bits[63:32] of the 64-bits custom IEEE BLE address. If different from 0xFFFFFFFF then the value of this field is applied; otherwise use value from FCFG.

register.name: BL_CONFIG
register.description: Bootloader Configuration Configures the functionality of the ROM boot loader. If both the boot loader is enabled by the BOOTLOADER_ENABLE field and the boot loader backdoor is enabled by the BL_ENABLE field it is possible to force entry of the ROM boot loader even if a valid image is present in flash.

field.name: BOOTLOADER_ENABLE
field.description: Bootloader enable. Boot loader can be accessed if IMAGE_VALID_CONF.IMAGE_VALID is non-zero or BL_ENABLE is enabled (and conditions for boot loader backdoor are met). 0xC5: Boot loader is enabled. Any other value: Boot loader is disabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: BL_LEVEL
field.description: Sets the active level of the selected DIO number BL_PIN_NUMBER if boot loader backdoor is enabled by the BL_ENABLE field. 0: Active low. 1: Active high.

field.name: BL_PIN_NUMBER
field.description: DIO number that is level checked if the boot loader backdoor is enabled by the BL_ENABLE field.

field.name: BL_ENABLE
field.description:
Enables the boot loader backdoor. 0xC5: Boot loader backdoor is enabled. Any other value: Boot loader backdoor is disabled.
NOTE! Boot loader must be enabled (see BOOTLOADER_ENABLE) if boot loader backdoor is enabled.

register.name: ERASE_CONF
register.description: Erase Configuration

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CHIP_ERASE_DIS_N
field.description: Chip erase. This bit controls if a chip erase requested through the JTAG WUC TAP will be ignored in a following boot caused by a reset of the MCU VD. A successful chip erase operation will force the content of the flash main bank back to the state as it was when delivered by TI. 0: Disable. Any chip erase request detected during boot will be ignored. 1: Enable. Any chip erase request detected during boot will be performed by the boot FW.

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: BANK_ERASE_DIS_N
field.description: Bank erase. This bit controls if the ROM serial boot loader will accept a received Bank Erase command (COMMAND_BANK_ERASE). A successful Bank Erase operation will erase all main bank sectors not protected by write protect configuration bits in CCFG. 0: Disable the boot loader bank erase function. 1: Enable the boot loader bank erase function.

register.name: CCFG_TI_OPTIONS
register.description: TI Options

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: TI_FA_ENABLE
field.description: TI Failure Analysis. 0xC5: Enable the functionality of unlocking the TI FA (TI Failure Analysis) option with the unlock code. All other values: Disable the functionality of unlocking the TI FA option with the unlock code.

register.name: CCFG_TAP_DAP_0
register.description: Test Access Points Enable 0

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CPU_DAP_ENABLE
field.description: Enable CPU DAP. 0xC5: Main CPU DAP access is enabled during power-up/system-reset by ROM boot FW. Any other value: Main CPU DAP access will remain disabled out of power-up/system-reset.

field.name: PRCM_TAP_ENABLE
field.description: Enable PRCM TAP. 0xC5: PRCM TAP access is enabled during power-up/system-reset by ROM boot FW if enabled by corresponding configuration value in FCFG1 defined by TI. Any other value: PRCM TAP access will remain disabled out of power-up/system-reset.

field.name: TEST_TAP_ENABLE
field.description: Enable Test TAP. 0xC5: TEST TAP access is enabled during power-up/system-reset by ROM boot FW if enabled by corresponding configuration value in FCFG1 defined by TI. Any other value: TEST TAP access will remain disabled out of power-up/system-reset.

register.name: CCFG_TAP_DAP_1
register.description: Test Access Points Enable 1

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: PBIST2_TAP_ENABLE
field.description: Enable PBIST2 TAP. 0xC5: PBIST2 TAP access is enabled during power-up/system-reset by ROM boot FW if enabled by corresponding configuration value in FCFG1 defined by TI. Any other value: PBIST2 TAP access will remain disabled out of power-up/system-reset.

field.name: PBIST1_TAP_ENABLE
field.description: Enable PBIST1 TAP. 0xC5: PBIST1 TAP access is enabled during power-up/system-reset by ROM boot FW if enabled by corresponding configuration value in FCFG1 defined by TI. Any other value: PBIST1 TAP access will remain disabled out of power-up/system-reset.

field.name: WUC_TAP_ENABLE
field.description: Enable WUC TAP 0xC5: WUC TAP access is enabled during power-up/system-reset by ROM boot FW if enabled by corresponding configuration value in FCFG1 defined by TI. Any other value: WUC TAP access will remain disabled out of power-up/system-reset.

register.name: IMAGE_VALID_CONF
register.description: Image Valid

field.name: IMAGE_VALID
field.description:
This field must have a value of 0x00000000 in order for enabling the boot sequence to transfer control to a flash image. A non-zero value forces the boot sequence to call the boot loader.
For CC2640R2: This field must have the address value of the start of the flash vector table in order for enabling the boot sequence to transfer control to a flash image. Any illegal vector table start address value forces the boot sequence to call the boot loader. Note that if any other legal vector table start address value than 0x0 is selected the PRCM:WARMRESET.WR_TO_PINRESET must be set to 1.

register.name: CTRL
register.description: Control Use the DWT Control Register to enable the DWT unit.

field.name: RESERVED26
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: NOCYCCNT
field.description: When set, CYCCNT is not supported.

field.name: NOPRFCNT
field.description: When set, FOLDCNT, LSUCNT, SLEEPCNT, EXCCNT, and CPICNT are not supported.

field.name: RESERVED23
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CYCEVTENA
field.description:
Enables Cycle count event. Emits an event when the POSTCNT counter triggers it. See CYCTAP and POSTPRESET for details. This event is only emitted if PCSAMPLEENA is disabled. PCSAMPLEENA overrides the setting of this bit.
0: Cycle count events disabled 1: Cycle count events enabled

field.name: FOLDEVTENA
field.description:
Enables Folded instruction count event. Emits an event when FOLDCNT overflows (every 256 cycles of folded instructions). A folded instruction is one that does not incur even one cycle to execute. For example, an IT instruction is folded away and so does not use up one cycle.
0: Folded instruction count events disabled. 1: Folded instruction count events enabled.

field.name: LSUEVTENA
field.description:
Enables LSU count event. Emits an event when LSUCNT overflows (every 256 cycles of LSU operation). LSU counts include all LSU costs after the initial cycle for the instruction.
0: LSU count events disabled. 1: LSU count events enabled.

field.name: SLEEPEVTENA
field.description:
Enables Sleep count event. Emits an event when SLEEPCNT overflows (every 256 cycles that the processor is sleeping).
0: Sleep count events disabled. 1: Sleep count events enabled.

field.name: EXCEVTENA
field.description:
Enables Interrupt overhead event. Emits an event when EXCCNT overflows (every 256 cycles of interrupt overhead).
0x0: Interrupt overhead event disabled. 0x1: Interrupt overhead event enabled.

field.name: CPIEVTENA
field.description:
Enables CPI count event. Emits an event when CPICNT overflows (every 256 cycles of multi-cycle instructions).
0: CPI counter events disabled. 1: CPI counter events enabled.

field.name: EXCTRCENA
field.description:
Enables Interrupt event tracing.
0: Interrupt event trace disabled. 1: Interrupt event trace enabled.

field.name: RESERVED13
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: PCSAMPLEENA
field.description:
Enables PC Sampling event. A PC sample event is emitted when the POSTCNT counter triggers it. See CYCTAP and POSTPRESET for details. Enabling this bit overrides CYCEVTENA.
0: PC Sampling event disabled. 1: Sampling event enabled.

field.name: SYNCTAP
field.description: Selects a synchronization packet rate. CYCCNTENA and CPU_ITM:TCR.SYNCENA must also be enabled for this feature. Synchronization packets (if enabled) are generated on tap transitions (0 to1 or 1 to 0).

field.name: CYCTAP
field.description: Selects a tap on CYCCNT. These are spaced at bits [6] and [10]. When the selected bit in CYCCNT changes from 0 to 1 or 1 to 0, it emits into the POSTCNT, post-scalar counter. That counter then counts down. On a bit change when post-scalar is 0, it triggers an event for PC sampling or cycle count event (see details in CYCEVTENA).

field.name: POSTCNT
field.description: Post-scalar counter for CYCTAP. When the selected tapped bit changes from 0 to 1 or 1 to 0, the post scalar counter is down-counted when not 0. If 0, it triggers an event for PCSAMPLEENA or CYCEVTENA use. It also reloads with the value from POSTPRESET.

field.name: POSTPRESET
field.description: Reload value for post-scalar counter POSTCNT. When 0, events are triggered on each tap change (a power of 2). If this field has a non-0 value, it forms a count-down value, to be reloaded into POSTCNT each time it reaches 0. For example, a value 1 in this register means an event is formed every other tap change.

field.name: CYCCNTENA
field.description: Enable CYCCNT, allowing it to increment and generate synchronization and count events. If NOCYCCNT = 1, this bit reads zero and ignore writes.

register.name: CYCCNT
register.description:
Current PC Sampler Cycle Count This register is used to count the number of core cycles. This counter can measure elapsed execution time. This is a free-running counter (this counter will not advance in power modes where free-running clock to CPU stops). The counter has three functions:
1: When CTRL.PCSAMPLEENA = 1, the PC is sampled and emitted when the selected tapped bit changes value (0 to 1 or 1 to 0) and any post-scalar value counts to 0. 2: When CTRL.CYCEVTENA = 1 , (and CTRL.PCSAMPLEENA = 0), an event is emitted when the selected tapped bit changes value (0 to 1 or 1 to 0) and any post-scalar value counts to 0. 3: Applications and debuggers can use the counter to measure elapsed execution time. By subtracting a start and an end time, an application can measure time between in-core clocks (other than when Halted in debug). This is valid to 2^32 core clock cycles (for example, almost 89.5 seconds at 48MHz).

register.name: CPICNT
register.description: CPI Count This register is used to count the total number of instruction cycles beyond the first cycle.

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CPICNT
field.description: Current CPI counter value. Increments on the additional cycles (the first cycle is not counted) required to execute all instructions except those recorded by LSUCNT. This counter also increments on all instruction fetch stalls. If CTRL.CPIEVTENA is set, an event is emitted when the counter overflows. This counter initializes to 0 when it is enabled using CTRL.CPIEVTENA.

register.name: EXCCNT
register.description: Exception Overhead Count This register is used to count the total cycles spent in interrupt processing.

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: EXCCNT
field.description: Current interrupt overhead counter value. Counts the total cycles spent in interrupt processing (for example entry stacking, return unstacking, pre-emption). An event is emitted on counter overflow (every 256 cycles). This counter initializes to 0 when it is enabled using CTRL.EXCEVTENA.

register.name: SLEEPCNT
register.description: Sleep Count This register is used to count the total number of cycles during which the processor is sleeping.

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: SLEEPCNT
field.description: Sleep counter. Counts the number of cycles during which the processor is sleeping. An event is emitted on counter overflow (every 256 cycles). This counter initializes to 0 when it is enabled using CTRL.SLEEPEVTENA. Note that the sleep counter is clocked using CPU's free-running clock. In some power modes the free-running clock to CPU is gated to minimize power consumption. This means that the sleep counter will be invalid in these power modes.

register.name: LSUCNT
register.description: LSU Count This register is used to count the total number of cycles during which the processor is processing an LSU operation beyond the first cycle.

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: LSUCNT
field.description: LSU counter. This counts the total number of cycles that the processor is processing an LSU operation. The initial execution cost of the instruction is not counted. For example, an LDR that takes two cycles to complete increments this counter one cycle. Equivalently, an LDR that stalls for two cycles (i.e. takes four cycles to execute), increments this counter three times. An event is emitted on counter overflow (every 256 cycles). This counter initializes to 0 when it is enabled using CTRL.LSUEVTENA.

register.name: FOLDCNT
register.description: Fold Count This register is used to count the total number of folded instructions. The counter increments on each instruction which takes 0 cycles.

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: FOLDCNT
field.description: This counts the total number folded instructions. This counter initializes to 0 when it is enabled using CTRL.FOLDEVTENA.

register.name: PCSR
register.description: Program Counter Sample This register is used to enable coarse-grained software profiling using a debug agent, without changing the currently executing code. If the core is not in debug state, the value returned is the instruction address of a recently executed instruction. If the core is in debug state, the value returned is 0xFFFFFFFF.

field.name: EIASAMPLE
field.description: Execution instruction address sample, or 0xFFFFFFFF if the core is halted.

register.name: COMP0
register.description: Comparator 0 This register is used to write the reference value for comparator 0.

field.name: COMP
field.description: Reference value to compare against PC or the data address as given by FUNCTION0. Comparator 0 can also compare against the value of the PC Sampler Counter (CYCCNT).

register.name: MASK0
register.description: Mask 0 Use the DWT Mask Registers 0 to apply a mask to data addresses when matching against COMP0.

field.name: RESERVED4
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: MASK
field.description: Mask on data address when matching against COMP0. This is the size of the ignore mask. That is, DWT matching is performed as:(ADDR ANDed with (0xFFFF left bit-shifted by MASK)) == COMP0. However, the actual comparison is slightly more complex to enable matching an address wherever it appears on a bus. So, if COMP0 is 3, this matches a word access of 0, because 3 would be within the word.

register.name: FUNCTION0
register.description: Function 0 Use the DWT Function Registers 0 to control the operation of the comparator 0. This comparator can: 1. Match against either the PC or the data address. This is controlled by CYCMATCH. This function is only available for comparator 0 (COMP0). 2. Emit data or PC couples, trigger the ETM, or generate a watchpoint depending on the operation defined by FUNCTION.

field.name: RESERVED25
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: MATCHED
field.description: This bit is set when the comparator matches, and indicates that the operation defined by FUNCTION has occurred since this bit was last read. This bit is cleared on read.

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CYCMATCH
field.description: This bit is only available in comparator 0. When set, COMP0 will compare against the cycle counter (CYCCNT).

field.name: RESERVED6
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: EMITRANGE
field.description: Emit range field. This bit permits emitting offset when range match occurs. PC sampling is not supported when emit range is enabled. This field only applies for: FUNCTION = 1, 2, 3, 12, 13, 14, and 15.

field.name: RESERVED4
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: FUNCTION
field.description:
Function settings.
0x0: Disabled 0x1: EMITRANGE = 0, sample and emit PC through ITM. EMITRANGE = 1, emit address offset through ITM 0x2: EMITRANGE = 0, emit data through ITM on read and write. EMITRANGE = 1, emit data and address offset through ITM on read or write. 0x3: EMITRANGE = 0, sample PC and data value through ITM on read or write. EMITRANGE = 1, emit address offset and data value through ITM on read or write. 0x4: Watchpoint on PC match. 0x5: Watchpoint on read. 0x6: Watchpoint on write. 0x7: Watchpoint on read or write. 0x8: ETM trigger on PC match 0x9: ETM trigger on read 0xA: ETM trigger on write 0xB: ETM trigger on read or write 0xC: EMITRANGE = 0, sample data for read transfers. EMITRANGE = 1, sample Daddr (lower 16 bits) for read transfers 0xD: EMITRANGE = 0, sample data for write transfers. EMITRANGE = 1, sample Daddr (lower 16 bits) for write transfers 0xE: EMITRANGE = 0, sample PC + data for read transfers. EMITRANGE = 1, sample Daddr (lower 16 bits) + data for read transfers 0xF: EMITRANGE = 0, sample PC + data for write transfers. EMITRANGE = 1, sample Daddr (lower 16 bits) + data for write transfers
Note 1: If the ETM is not fitted, then ETM trigger is not possible. Note 2: Data value is only sampled for accesses that do not fault (MPU or bus fault). The PC is sampled irrespective of any faults. The PC is only sampled for the first address of a burst. Note 3: PC match is not recommended for watchpoints because it stops after the instruction. It mainly guards and triggers the ETM.

register.name: COMP1
register.description: Comparator 1 This register is used to write the reference value for comparator 1.

field.name: COMP
field.description: Reference value to compare against PC or the data address as given by FUNCTION1. Comparator 1 can also compare data values. So this register can contain reference values for data matching.

register.name: MASK1
register.description: Mask 1 Use the DWT Mask Registers 1 to apply a mask to data addresses when matching against COMP1.

field.name: RESERVED4
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: MASK
field.description: Mask on data address when matching against COMP1. This is the size of the ignore mask. That is, DWT matching is performed as:(ADDR ANDed with (0xFFFF left bit-shifted by MASK)) == COMP1. However, the actual comparison is slightly more complex to enable matching an address wherever it appears on a bus. So, if COMP1 is 3, this matches a word access of 0, because 3 would be within the word.

register.name: FUNCTION1
register.description: Function 1 Use the DWT Function Registers 1 to control the operation of the comparator 1. This comparator can: 1. Perform data value comparisons if associated address comparators have performed an address match. This function is only available for comparator 1 (COMP1). 2. Emit data or PC couples, trigger the ETM, or generate a watchpoint depending on the operation defined by FUNCTION.

field.name: RESERVED25
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: MATCHED
field.description: This bit is set when the comparator matches, and indicates that the operation defined by FUNCTION has occurred since this bit was last read. This bit is cleared on read.

field.name: RESERVED20
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: DATAVADDR1
field.description: Identity of a second linked address comparator for data value matching when DATAVMATCH == 1 and LNK1ENA == 1.

field.name: DATAVADDR0
field.description: Identity of a linked address comparator for data value matching when DATAVMATCH == 1.

field.name: DATAVSIZE
field.description:
Defines the size of the data in the COMP1 register that is to be matched:
0x0: Byte 0x1: Halfword 0x2: Word 0x3: Unpredictable.

field.name: LNK1ENA
field.description:
Read only bit-field only supported in comparator 1.
0: DATAVADDR1 not supported 1: DATAVADDR1 supported (enabled)

field.name: DATAVMATCH
field.description:
Data match feature:
0: Perform address comparison 1: Perform data value compare. The comparators given by DATAVADDR0 and DATAVADDR1 provide the address for the data comparison. The FUNCTION setting for the comparators given by DATAVADDR0 and DATAVADDR1 are overridden and those comparators only provide the address match for the data comparison.
This bit is only available in comparator 1.

field.name: RESERVED6
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: EMITRANGE
field.description: Emit range field. This bit permits emitting offset when range match occurs. PC sampling is not supported when emit range is enabled. This field only applies for: FUNCTION = 1, 2, 3, 12, 13, 14, and 15.

field.name: RESERVED4
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: FUNCTION
field.description:
Function settings:
0x0: Disabled 0x1: EMITRANGE = 0, sample and emit PC through ITM. EMITRANGE = 1, emit address offset through ITM 0x2: EMITRANGE = 0, emit data through ITM on read and write. EMITRANGE = 1, emit data and address offset through ITM on read or write. 0x3: EMITRANGE = 0, sample PC and data value through ITM on read or write. EMITRANGE = 1, emit address offset and data value through ITM on read or write. 0x4: Watchpoint on PC match. 0x5: Watchpoint on read. 0x6: Watchpoint on write. 0x7: Watchpoint on read or write. 0x8: ETM trigger on PC match 0x9: ETM trigger on read 0xA: ETM trigger on write 0xB: ETM trigger on read or write 0xC: EMITRANGE = 0, sample data for read transfers. EMITRANGE = 1, sample Daddr (lower 16 bits) for read transfers 0xD: EMITRANGE = 0, sample data for write transfers. EMITRANGE = 1, sample Daddr (lower 16 bits) for write transfers 0xE: EMITRANGE = 0, sample PC + data for read transfers. EMITRANGE = 1, sample Daddr (lower 16 bits) + data for read transfers 0xF: EMITRANGE = 0, sample PC + data for write transfers. EMITRANGE = 1, sample Daddr (lower 16 bits) + data for write transfers
Note 1: If the ETM is not fitted, then ETM trigger is not possible. Note 2: Data value is only sampled for accesses that do not fault (MPU or bus fault). The PC is sampled irrespective of any faults. The PC is only sampled for the first address of a burst. Note 3: FUNCTION is overridden for comparators given by DATAVADDR0 and DATAVADDR1 if DATAVMATCH is also set. The comparators given by DATAVADDR0 and DATAVADDR1 can then only perform address comparator matches for comparator 1 data matches. Note 4: If the data matching functionality is not included during implementation it is not possible to set DATAVADDR0, DATAVADDR1, or DATAVMATCH. This means that the data matching functionality is not available in the implementation. Test the availability of data matching by writing and reading DATAVMATCH. If it is not settable then data matching is unavailable. Note 5: PC match is not recommended for watchpoints because it stops after the instruction. It mainly guards and triggers the ETM.

register.description: Comparator 2 This register is used to write the reference value for comparator 2.

register.name: MASK2

field.name: RESERVED4
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: MASK

That is, DWT matching is performed as:(ADDR ANDed with (0xFFFF left bit-shifted by MASK)) == COMP2. However, the actual comparison is slightly more complex to enable matching an address wherever it appears on a bus. So, if COMP2 is 3, this matches a word access of 0, because 3 would be within the word.

register.description: Function 2 Use the DWT Function Registers 2 to control the operation of the comparator 2. This comparator can emit data or PC couples, trigger the ETM, or generate a watchpoint depending on the operation defined by FUNCTION.

EMITRANGE = 1, emit data and address offset through ITM on read or write. 0x3: EMITRANGE = 0, sample PC and data value through ITM on read or write. EMITRANGE = 1, emit address offset and data value through ITM on read or write. 0x4: Watchpoint on PC match. 0x5: Watchpoint on read. 0x6: Watchpoint on write. 0x7: Watchpoint on read or write. 0x8: ETM trigger on PC match 0x9: ETM trigger on read 0xA: ETM trigger on write 0xB: ETM trigger on read or write 0xC: EMITRANGE = 0, sample data for read transfers. EMITRANGE = 1, sample Daddr (lower 16 bits) for read transfers 0xD: EMITRANGE = 0, sample data for write transfers. EMITRANGE = 1, sample Daddr (lower 16 bits) for write transfers 0xE: EMITRANGE = 0, sample PC + data for read transfers. EMITRANGE = 1, sample Daddr (lower 16 bits) + data for read transfers 0xF: EMITRANGE = 0, sample PC + data for write transfers. EMITRANGE = 1, sample Daddr (lower 16 bits) + data for write transfers
Note 1: If the ETM is not fitted, then ETM trigger is not possible. Note 2: Data value is only sampled for accesses that do not fault (MPU or bus fault). The PC is sampled irrespective of any faults. The PC is only sampled for the first address of a burst. Note 3: PC match is not recommended for watchpoints because it stops after the instruction. It mainly guards and triggers the ETM.

register.name: CTRL
register.description: Control This register is used to enable the flash patch block.

field.name: RESERVED14
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: NUM_CODE2
field.description: Number of full banks of code comparators, sixteen comparators per bank. Where less than sixteen code comparators are provided, the bank count is zero, and the number present indicated by NUM_CODE1. This read only field contains 3'b000 to indicate 0 banks for Cortex-M processor.

field.name: NUM_LIT
field.description:
Number of literal slots field.
0x0: No literal slots 0x2: Two literal slots

field.name: NUM_CODE1
field.description:
Number of code slots field.
0x0: No code slots 0x2: Two code slots 0x6: Six code slots

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: KEY
field.description: Key field. In order to write to this register, this bit-field must be written to '1'. This bit always reads 0.

field.name: ENABLE
field.description:
Flash patch unit enable bit
0x0: Flash patch unit disabled 0x1: Flash patch unit enabled

register.name: REMAP
register.description: Remap This register provides the remap base address location where a matched addresses are remapped. The three most significant bits and the five least significant bits of the remap base address are hard-coded to 3'b001 and 5'b00000 respectively. The remap base address must be in system space and is it required to be 8-word aligned, with one word allocated to each of the eight FPB comparators.

field.name: RESERVED29
field.description: This field always reads 3'b001. Writing to this field is ignored.

field.name: REMAP
field.description: Remap base address field.

field.name: RESERVED0
field.description: This field always reads 0. Writing to this field is ignored.

register.name: COMP0
register.description: Comparator 0

field.name: REPLACE
field.description:
This selects what happens when the COMP address is matched. Address remapping only takes place for the 0x0 setting.
0x0: Remap to remap address. See REMAP.REMAP 0x1: Set BKPT on lower halfword, upper is unaffected 0x2: Set BKPT on upper halfword, lower is unaffected 0x3: Set BKPT on both lower and upper halfwords.

field.name: RESERVED29
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: COMP
field.description: Comparison address.

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: ENABLE
field.description:
Compare and remap enable comparator 0. CTRL.ENABLE must also be set to enable comparisons.
0x0: Compare and remap for comparator 0 disabled 0x1: Compare and remap for comparator 0 enabled

register.name: TER
register.description: Trace Enable Use the Trace Enable Register to generate trace data by writing to the corresponding stimulus port. Note: Privileged writes are accepted to this register if TCR.ITMENA is set. User writes are accepted to this register if TCR.ITMENA is set and the appropriate privilege mask is cleared. Privileged access to the stimulus ports enables an RTOS kernel to guarantee instrumentation slots or bandwidth as required.
