enumeratedValue.description: UART0 combined interrupt, interrupt flags are found here UART0:MIS

enumeratedValue.name: SSI1_COMB
enumeratedValue.description: SSI1 combined interrupt, interrupt flags are found here SSI1:MIS

enumeratedValue.name: SSI0_COMB
enumeratedValue.description: SSI0 combined interrupt, interrupt flags are found here SSI0:MIS

enumeratedValue.name: RFC_CPE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Combined Interrupt for CPE Generated events. Corresponding flags are here RFC_DBELL:RFCPEIFG. Only interrupts selected with CPE1 in RFC_DBELL:RFCPEIFG can trigger a RFC_CPE_1 event

enumeratedValue.name: RFC_CPE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Combined Interrupt for CPE Generated events. Corresponding flags are here RFC_DBELL:RFCPEIFG. Only interrupts selected with CPE0 in RFC_DBELL:RFCPEIFG can trigger a RFC_CPE_0 event

enumeratedValue.name: RFC_HW_COMB
enumeratedValue.description: Combined RFC hardware interrupt, corresponding flag is here RFC_DBELL:RFHWIFG

enumeratedValue.name: RFC_CMD_ACK
enumeratedValue.description: RFC Doorbell Command Acknowledgement Interrupt, equvialent to RFC_DBELL:RFACKIFG.ACKFLAG

enumeratedValue.name: FLASH
enumeratedValue.description: FLASH controller error event, the status flags are FLASH:FEDACSTAT.FSM_DONE and FLASH:FEDACSTAT.RVF_INT

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_COMB
enumeratedValue.description: AUX combined event, the corresponding flag register is here AUX_EVCTL:EVTOMCUFLAGS

enumeratedValue.name: AON_RTC_COMB
enumeratedValue.description: Event from AON_RTC, controlled by the AON_RTC:CTL.COMB_EV_MASK setting

enumeratedValue.name: AON_GPIO_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Edge detect event from IOC. Configureded by the IOC:IOCFGn.EDGE_IRQ_EN and IOC:IOCFGn.EDGE_DET settings

register.name: GPT2BCAPTSEL
register.description: Output Selection for GPT2 1

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: EV
field.description:
Read/write selection value
Writing any other value than values defined by a ENUM may result in undefined behavior.

enumeratedValue.name: AON_RTC_UPD
enumeratedValue.description: RTC periodic event controlled by AON_RTC:CTL.RTC_UPD_EN

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_ADC_IRQ
enumeratedValue.description: AUX ADC interrupt event, corresponds to AUX_EVCTL:EVTOMCUFLAGS.ADC_IRQ. Status flags are found here AUX_EVCTL:EVTOMCUFLAGS

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_OBSMUX0
enumeratedValue.description: Loopback of OBSMUX0 through AUX, corresponds to AUX_EVCTL:EVTOMCUFLAGS.OBSMUX0

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_ADC_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL
enumeratedValue.description: AUX ADC FIFO watermark event, corresponds to AUX_EVCTL:EVTOMCUFLAGS.ADC_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_ADC_DONE
enumeratedValue.description: AUX ADC done, corresponds to AUX_EVCTL:EVTOMCUFLAGS.ADC_DONE

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_SMPH_AUTOTAKE_DONE
enumeratedValue.description: Autotake event from AUX semaphore, configured by AUX_SMPH:AUTOTAKE

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_TIMER1_EV
enumeratedValue.description: AUX timer 1 event, corresponds to AUX_EVCTL:EVTOMCUFLAGS.TIMER1_EV

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_TIMER0_EV
enumeratedValue.description: AUX timer 0 event, corresponds to AUX_EVCTL:EVTOMCUFLAGS.TIMER0_EV

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_TDC_DONE
enumeratedValue.description: AUX TDC measurement done event, corresponds to the flag AUX_EVCTL:EVTOMCUFLAGS.TDC_DONE and the AUX_TDC status AUX_TDC:STAT.DONE

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_COMPB
enumeratedValue.description: AUX Compare B event, corresponds to AUX_EVCTL:EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_COMPB

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_COMPA
enumeratedValue.description: AUX Compare A event, corresponds to AUX_EVCTL:EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_COMPA

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_AON_WU_EV
enumeratedValue.description: AON wakeup event, corresponds flags are here AUX_EVCTL:EVTOMCUFLAGS.AON_WU_EV

enumeratedValue.name: PORT_EVENT5
enumeratedValue.description: Port capture event from IOC, configured by IOC:IOCFGn.PORT_ID. Events on ports configured with ENUM PORT_EVENT4 wil be routed here.

enumeratedValue.name: PORT_EVENT4
enumeratedValue.description: Port capture event from IOC, configured by IOC:IOCFGn.PORT_ID. Events on ports configured with ENUM PORT_EVENT4 wil be routed here.

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_DMABREQ
enumeratedValue.description: DMA burst request event from AUX, configured by AUX_EVCTL:DMACTL

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_DMASREQ
enumeratedValue.description: DMA single request event from AUX, configured by AUX_EVCTL:DMACTL

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_SW_DMABREQ
enumeratedValue.description: DMA sofware trigger from AUX, triggered by AUX_EVCTL:DMASWREQ.START

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_ADC_IRQ
enumeratedValue.description: AUX ADC interrupt event, corresponds to AUX_EVCTL:EVTOMCUFLAGS.ADC_IRQ. Status flags are found here AUX_EVCTL:EVTOMCUFLAGS

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_OBSMUX0
enumeratedValue.description: Loopback of OBSMUX0 through AUX, corresponds to AUX_EVCTL:EVTOMCUFLAGS.OBSMUX0

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_ADC_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL
enumeratedValue.description: AUX ADC FIFO watermark event, corresponds to AUX_EVCTL:EVTOMCUFLAGS.ADC_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_ADC_DONE
enumeratedValue.description: AUX ADC done, corresponds to AUX_EVCTL:EVTOMCUFLAGS.ADC_DONE

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_SMPH_AUTOTAKE_DONE
enumeratedValue.description: Autotake event from AUX semaphore, configured by AUX_SMPH:AUTOTAKE

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_TIMER1_EV
enumeratedValue.description: AUX timer 1 event, corresponds to AUX_EVCTL:EVTOMCUFLAGS.TIMER1_EV

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_TIMER0_EV
enumeratedValue.description: AUX timer 0 event, corresponds to AUX_EVCTL:EVTOMCUFLAGS.TIMER0_EV

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_TDC_DONE

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_COMPB

enumeratedValue.name: CRYPTO_RESULT_AVAIL_IRQ

enumeratedValue.name: RFC_CPE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Combined Interrupt for CPE Generated events. Corresponding flags are here RFC_DBELL:RFCPEIFG. Only interrupts selected with CPE1 in RFC_DBELL:RFCPEIFG can trigger a RFC_CPE_1 event

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_SWEV1
enumeratedValue.description: AUX software event 1, triggered by AUX_EVCTL:SWEVSET.SWEV1, also available as AUX_EVENT2 AON wake up event. MCU domain wakeup control AON_EVENT:MCUWUSEL AUX domain wakeup control AON_EVENT:AUXWUSEL

enumeratedValue.name: RFC_CPE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Combined Interrupt for CPE Generated events. Corresponding flags are here RFC_DBELL:RFCPEIFG. Only interrupts selected with CPE0 in RFC_DBELL:RFCPEIFG can trigger a RFC_CPE_0 event

enumeratedValue.name: RFC_HW_COMB
enumeratedValue.description: Combined RFC hardware interrupt, corresponding flag is here RFC_DBELL:RFHWIFG

enumeratedValue.name: RFC_CMD_ACK
enumeratedValue.description: RFC Doorbell Command Acknowledgement Interrupt, equvialent to RFC_DBELL:RFACKIFG.ACKFLAG

enumeratedValue.name: DMA_CH0_DONE
enumeratedValue.description: DMA done for software tiggered UDMA channel 0, see UDMA0:SOFTREQ

register.name: FRZSEL0
register.description: Output Selection for FRZ Subscriber The halted debug signal is passed to peripherals such as the General Purpose Timer, Sensor Controller with Digital and Analog Peripherals (AUX), Radio, and RTC. When the system CPU halts, the connected peripherals that have freeze enabled also halt. The programmable output can be set to static values of 0 or 1, and can also be set to pass the halted signal.

register.name: USER_ID
register.description: User Identification. Reading this register and the ICEPICK_DEVICE_ID register is the only support way of identifying a device. The value of this register will be written to AON_WUC:JTAGUSERCODE by boot FW while in safezone.

field.name: PG_REV
field.description: Field used to distinguish revisions of the device.

field.name: VER
field.description:
Version number.
0x0: Bits [25:12] of this register has the stated meaning.
Any other setting indicate a different encoding of these bits.

field.name: RESERVED23
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: SEQUENCE
field.description:
Sequence.
Used to differentiate between marketing/orderable product where other fields of USER_ID is the same (temp range, flash size, voltage range etc)

field.name: PKG
field.description:
Package type.
0x0: 4x4mm QFN (RHB) package 0x1: 5x5mm QFN (RSM) package 0x2: 7x7mm QFN (RGZ) package 0x3: Wafer sale package (naked die) 0x4: 2.7x2.7mm WCSP (YFV) 0x5: 7x7mm QFN package with Wettable Flanks
Other values are reserved for future use. Packages available for a specific device are shown in the device datasheet.

field.name: PROTOCOL
field.description:
Protocols supported.
0x1: BLE 0x2: RF4CE 0x4: Zigbee/6lowpan 0x8: Proprietary
More than one protocol can be supported on same device - values above are then combined.

field.name: RESERVED0
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

peripheral.name: FLASH
peripheral.description: Flash sub-system registers, includes the Flash Memory Controller (FMC), flash read path, and an integrated Efuse controller and EFUSEROM.

register.name: STAT
register.description: FMC and Efuse Status

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: EFUSE_BLANK
field.description: Efuse scanning detected if fuse ROM is blank: 0 : Not blank 1 : Blank

field.name: EFUSE_TIMEOUT
field.description: Efuse scanning resulted in timeout error. 0 : No Timeout error 1 : Timeout Error

field.name: EFUSE_CRC_ERROR
field.description: Efuse scanning resulted in scan chain CRC error. 0 : No CRC error 1 : CRC Error

field.name: EFUSE_ERRCODE
field.description: Same as EFUSEERROR.CODE

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: SAMHOLD_DIS
field.description: Status indicator of flash sample and hold sequencing logic. This bit will go to 1 some delay after CFG.DIS_IDLE is set to 1. 0: Not disabled 1: Sample and hold disabled and stable

field.name: BUSY
field.description: Fast version of the FMC FMSTAT.BUSY bit. This flag is valid immediately after the operation setting it (FMSTAT.BUSY is delayed some cycles) 0 : Not busy 1 : Busy

field.name: POWER_MODE
field.description: Power state of the flash sub-system. 0 : Active 1 : Low power

register.name: EVFLAGS31_0
register.description:
Event Register for DIO 0 to 31
Reading this registers will return 1 for triggered event and 0 for non-triggered events. Writing a 1 to a bit field will clear the event.
The configuration of events is done inside MCU IOC, e.g. events for DIO #0 is configured in IOC:IOCFG0.EDGE_DET and IOC:IOCFG0.EDGE_IRQ_EN.

register.name: CFG
register.description: Configuration

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CFG
field.description: GPT Configuration 0x2- 0x3 - Reserved 0x5- 0x7 - Reserved

enumeratedValue.name: _16BIT_TIMER
enumeratedValue.description: 16-bit timer configuration. Configure for two 16-bit timers. Also see TAMR.TAMR and TBMR.TBMR.

register.name: TAMR
register.description: Timer A Mode

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: TCACT
field.description: Timer Compare Action Select

enumeratedValue.name: CLRSET_ON_TO
enumeratedValue.description: Clear CCP output pin immediately and set on Time-Out

enumeratedValue.name: SETCLR_ON_TO
enumeratedValue.description: Set CCP output pin immediately and clear on Time-Out

enumeratedValue.name: CLRTOG_ON_TO
enumeratedValue.description: Clear CCP output pin immediately and toggle on Time-Out

enumeratedValue.name: SETTOG_ON_TO
enumeratedValue.description: Set CCP output pin immediately and toggle on Time-Out

enumeratedValue.name: SET_ON_TO
enumeratedValue.description: Set CCP output pin on Time-Out

enumeratedValue.name: CLR_ON_TO
enumeratedValue.description: Clear CCP output pin on Time-Out

field.name: TACINTD
field.description: One-Shot/Periodic Interrupt Disable

field.name: TAPLO
field.description:
GPTM Timer A PWM Legacy Operation
0 Legacy operation with CCP pin driven Low when the TAILR register is reloaded after the timer reaches 0.
1 CCP is driven High when the TAILR register is reloaded after the timer reaches 0.
This bit is only valid in PWM mode.

enumeratedValue.name: CCP_ON_TO
enumeratedValue.description: CCP output pin is set to 1 on time-out

field.name: TAMRSU
field.description:
Timer A Match Register Update mode
This bit defines when the TAMATCHR and TAPR registers are updated.
If the timer is disabled (CTL.TAEN = 0) when this bit is set, TAMATCHR and TAPR are updated when the timer is enabled. If the timer is stalled (CTL.TASTALL = 1) when this bit is set, TAMATCHR and TAPR are updated according to the configuration of this bit.

enumeratedValue.name: TOUPDATE
enumeratedValue.description: Update TAMATCHR and TAPR, if used, on the next time-out.

enumeratedValue.name: CYCLEUPDATE
enumeratedValue.description: Update TAMATCHR and TAPR, if used, on the next cycle.

field.name: TAPWMIE
field.description:
GPTM Timer A PWM Interrupt Enable This bit enables interrupts in PWM mode on rising, falling, or both edges of the CCP output, as defined by the CTL.TAEVENT In addition, when this bit is set and a capture event occurs, Timer A automatically generates triggers to the DMA if the trigger capability is enabled by setting the CTL.TAOTE bit and the DMAEV.CAEDMAEN bit respectively.
0 Capture event interrupt is disabled. 1 Capture event interrupt is enabled. This bit is only valid in PWM mode.

enumeratedValue.name: EN
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt is enabled. This bit is only valid in PWM mode.

field.name: TAILD
field.description: GPT Timer A PWM Interval Load Write

enumeratedValue.name: TOUPDATE
enumeratedValue.description: Update the TAR register with the value in the TAILR register on the next timeout. If the prescaler is used, update the TAPS register with the value in the TAPR register on the next timeout.

enumeratedValue.name: CYCLEUPDATE
enumeratedValue.description: Update the TAR register with the value in the TAILR register on the next clock cycle. If the pre-scaler is used, update the TAPS register with the value in the TAPR register on the next clock cycle.

field.name: TASNAPS
field.description: GPT Timer A Snap-Shot Mode

enumeratedValue.name: EN
enumeratedValue.description: If Timer A is configured in the periodic mode, the actual free-running value of Timer A is loaded at the time-out event into the GPT Timer A (TAR) register.

field.name: TAWOT
field.description: GPT Timer A Wait-On-Trigger

enumeratedValue.name: WAIT
enumeratedValue.description: If Timer A is enabled (CTL.TAEN = 1), Timer A does not begin counting until it receives a trigger from the timer in the previous position in the daisy chain. This bit must be clear for GPT Module 0, Timer A. This function is valid for one-shot, periodic, and PWM modes

enumeratedValue.name: NOWAIT
enumeratedValue.description: Timer A begins counting as soon as it is enabled.

field.name: TAMIE
field.description: GPT Timer A Match Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.name: EN
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt is generated when the match value in TAMATCHR is reached in the one-shot and periodic modes.

enumeratedValue.name: DIS
enumeratedValue.description: The match interrupt is disabled for match events. Additionally, output triggers on match events are prevented.

field.name: TACDIR
field.description: GPT Timer A Count Direction

enumeratedValue.name: UP
enumeratedValue.description: The timer counts up. When counting up, the timer starts from a value of 0x0.

field.name: TAAMS
field.description:
GPT Timer A Alternate Mode
Note: To enable PWM mode, you must also clear TACM and then configure TAMR field to 0x2.

field.name: TACM
field.description: GPT Timer A Capture Mode

field.name: TAMR
field.description:
GPT Timer A Mode
0x0 Reserved 0x1 One-Shot Timer mode 0x2 Periodic Timer mode 0x3 Capture mode The Timer mode is based on the timer configuration defined by bits 2:0 in the CFG register

register.name: TBMR
register.description: Timer B Mode

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: TCACT
field.description: Timer Compare Action Select

enumeratedValue.name: CLRSET_ON_TO
enumeratedValue.description: Clear CCP output pin immediately and set on Time-Out

enumeratedValue.name: SETCLR_ON_TO
enumeratedValue.description: Set CCP output pin immediately and clear on Time-Out

enumeratedValue.name: CLRTOG_ON_TO
enumeratedValue.description: Clear CCP output pin immediately and toggle on Time-Out

enumeratedValue.name: SETTOG_ON_TO
enumeratedValue.description: Set CCP output pin immediately and toggle on Time-Out

enumeratedValue.name: SET_ON_TO
enumeratedValue.description: Set CCP output pin on Time-Out

enumeratedValue.name: CLR_ON_TO
enumeratedValue.description: Clear CCP output pin on Time-Out

field.name: TBCINTD
field.description: One-Shot/Periodic Interrupt Mode

field.name: TBPLO
field.description:
GPTM Timer B PWM Legacy Operation
0 Legacy operation with CCP pin driven Low when the TBILR register is reloaded after the timer reaches 0.
1 CCP is driven High when the TBILR register is reloaded after the timer reaches 0.
This bit is only valid in PWM mode.

enumeratedValue.name: CCP_ON_TO
enumeratedValue.description: CCP output pin is set to 1 on time-out

field.name: TBMRSU
field.description:
Timer B Match Register Update mode
This bit defines when the TBMATCHR and TBPR registers are updated
If the timer is disabled (CTL.TBEN is clear) when this bit is set, TBMATCHR and TBPR are updated when the timer is enabled. If the timer is stalled (CTL.TBSTALL is set) when this bit is set, TBMATCHR and TBPR are updated according to the configuration of this bit.

enumeratedValue.name: TOUPDATE
enumeratedValue.description: Update TBMATCHR and TBPR, if used, on the next time-out.

enumeratedValue.name: CYCLEUPDATE
enumeratedValue.description: Update TBMATCHR and TBPR, if used, on the next cycle.

field.name: TBPWMIE
field.description:
GPTM Timer B PWM Interrupt Enable This bit enables interrupts in PWM mode on rising, falling, or both edges of the CCP output, as defined by the CTL.TBEVENT In addition, when this bit is set and a capture event occurs, Timer A automatically generates triggers to the DMA if the trigger capability is enabled by setting the CTL.TBOTE bit and the DMAEV.CBEDMAEN bit respectively.
0 Capture event interrupt is disabled. 1 Capture event interrupt is enabled. This bit is only valid in PWM mode.

enumeratedValue.name: EN
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt is enabled. This bit is only valid in PWM mode.

field.name: TBILD
field.description: GPT Timer B PWM Interval Load Write

enumeratedValue.name: TOUPDATE
enumeratedValue.description: Update the TBR register with the value in the TBILR register on the next timeout. If the prescaler is used, update the TBPS register with the value in the TBPR register on the next timeout.

enumeratedValue.name: CYCLEUPDATE
enumeratedValue.description: Update the TBR register with the value in the TBILR register on the next clock cycle. If the pre-scaler is used, update the TBPS register with the value in the TBPR register on the next clock cycle.

field.name: TBSNAPS
field.description: GPT Timer B Snap-Shot Mode

enumeratedValue.name: EN
enumeratedValue.description: If Timer B is configured in the periodic mode

field.name: TBWOT
field.description: GPT Timer B Wait-On-Trigger

enumeratedValue.name: WAIT
enumeratedValue.description: If Timer B is enabled (CTL.TBEN is set), Timer B does not begin counting until it receives a trigger from the timer in the previous position in the daisy chain. This function is valid for one-shot, periodic, and PWM modes

enumeratedValue.name: NOWAIT
enumeratedValue.description: Timer B begins counting as soon as it is enabled.

field.name: TBMIE
field.description: GPT Timer B Match Interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: EN
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt is generated when the match value in the TBMATCHR register is reached in the one-shot and periodic modes.

enumeratedValue.name: DIS
enumeratedValue.description: The match interrupt is disabled for match events. Additionally, output triggers on match events are prevented.

field.name: TBCDIR
field.description: GPT Timer B Count Direction

enumeratedValue.name: UP
enumeratedValue.description: The timer counts up. When counting up, the timer starts from a value of 0x0.

field.name: TBAMS
field.description:
GPT Timer B Alternate Mode
Note: To enable PWM mode, you must also clear TBCM bit and configure TBMR field to 0x2.

field.name: TBCM
field.description: GPT Timer B Capture Mode

field.name: TBMR
field.description:
GPT Timer B Mode
0x0 Reserved 0x1 One-Shot Timer mode 0x2 Periodic Timer mode 0x3 Capture mode The Timer mode is based on the timer configuration defined by bits 2:0 in the CFG register

register.name: CTL
register.description: Control

field.name: RESERVED15
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: TBPWML
field.description:
GPT Timer B PWM Output Level
0: Output is unaffected. 1: Output is inverted.

field.name: RESERVED12
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: TBEVENT
field.description:
GPT Timer B Event Mode
The values in this register are defined as follows: Value Description 0x0 Positive edge 0x1 Negative edge 0x2 Reserved 0x3 Both edges Note: If PWM output inversion is enabled, edge detection interrupt behavior is reversed. Thus, if a positive-edge interrupt trigger has been set and the PWM inversion generates a postive edge, no event-trigger interrupt asserts. Instead, the interrupt is generated on the negative edge of the PWM signal.

field.name: TBSTALL
field.description: GPT Timer B Stall Enable

enumeratedValue.name: EN
enumeratedValue.description: Timer B freezes counting while the processor is halted by the debugger.

enumeratedValue.name: DIS
enumeratedValue.description: Timer B continues counting while the processor is halted by the debugger.

field.name: TBEN
field.description: GPT Timer B Enable

enumeratedValue.name: EN
enumeratedValue.description: Timer B is enabled and begins counting or the capture logic is enabled based on CFG register.

field.name: RESERVED7
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: TAPWML
field.description: GPT Timer A PWM Output Level

field.name: RESERVED4
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: TAEVENT
field.description:
GPT Timer A Event Mode
The values in this register are defined as follows: Value Description 0x0 Positive edge 0x1 Negative edge 0x2 Reserved 0x3 Both edges Note: If PWM output inversion is enabled, edge detection interrupt behavior is reversed. Thus, if a positive-edge interrupt trigger has been set and the PWM inversion generates a postive edge, no event-trigger interrupt asserts. Instead, the interrupt is generated on the negative edge of the PWM signal.

field.name: TASTALL
field.description: GPT Timer A Stall Enable

enumeratedValue.name: EN
enumeratedValue.description: Timer A freezes counting while the processor is halted by the debugger.

enumeratedValue.name: DIS
enumeratedValue.description: Timer A continues counting while the processor is halted by the debugger.

field.name: TAEN
field.description: GPT Timer A Enable

enumeratedValue.name: EN
enumeratedValue.description: Timer A is enabled and begins counting or the capture logic is enabled based on the CFG register.

register.name: IMR
register.description: Interrupt Mask This register is used to enable the interrupts. Associated registers: RIS, MIS, ICLR

field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: DMABIM
field.description: Enabling this bit will make the RIS.DMABRIS interrupt propagate to MIS.DMABMIS

field.name: RESERVED12
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: TBMIM
field.description: Enabling this bit will make the RIS.TBMRIS interrupt propagate to MIS.TBMMIS

field.name: CBEIM
field.description: Enabling this bit will make the RIS.CBERIS interrupt propagate to MIS.CBEMIS

field.name: CBMIM
field.description: Enabling this bit will make the RIS.CBMRIS interrupt propagate to MIS.CBMMIS

field.name: TBTOIM
field.description: Enabling this bit will make the RIS.TBTORIS interrupt propagate to MIS.TBTOMIS

field.name: RESERVED6
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: DMAAIM
field.description: Enabling this bit will make the RIS.DMAARIS interrupt propagate to MIS.DMAAMIS

field.name: TAMIM
field.description: Enabling this bit will make the RIS.TAMRIS interrupt propagate to MIS.TAMMIS

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CAEIM
field.description: Enabling this bit will make the RIS.CAERIS interrupt propagate to MIS.CAEMIS

field.name: CAMIM
field.description: Enabling this bit will make the RIS.CAMRIS interrupt propagate to MIS.CAMMIS

field.name: TATOIM

register.name: RIS
register.description: Raw Interrupt Status Associated registers: IMR, MIS, ICLR

field.name: RESERVED14
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: DMABRIS
field.description:
GPT Timer B DMA Done Raw Interrupt Status
0: Transfer has not completed 1: Transfer has completed

field.name: RESERVED12
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: TBMRIS
field.description:
GPT Timer B Match Raw Interrupt
0: The match value has not been reached 1: The match value is reached.
TBMR.TBMIE is set, and the match values in TBMATCHR and optionally TBPMR have been reached when configured in one-shot or periodic mode.

field.name: CBERIS
field.description:
GPT Timer B Capture Mode Event Raw Interrupt
0: The event has not occured. 1: The event has occured.
This interrupt asserts when the subtimer is configured in Input Edge-Time mode

field.name: CBMRIS
field.description:
GPT Timer B Capture Mode Match Raw Interrupt
0: The capture mode match for Timer B has not occurred. 1: A capture mode match has occurred for Timer B. This interrupt asserts when the values in the TBR and TBPR match the values in the TBMATCHR and TBPMR when configured in Input Edge-Time mode.
This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to the ICLR.CBMCINT bit.

field.name: TBTORIS
field.description:
GPT Timer B Time-out Raw Interrupt
0: Timer B has not timed out 1: Timer B has timed out.
This interrupt is asserted when a one-shot or periodic mode timer reaches its count limit. The count limit is 0 or the value loaded into TBILR, depending on the count direction.

field.name: RESERVED6
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: DMAARIS
field.description:
GPT Timer A DMA Done Raw Interrupt Status
0: Transfer has not completed 1: Transfer has completed

field.name: TAMRIS
field.description:
GPT Timer A Match Raw Interrupt
0: The match value has not been reached 1: The match value is reached.
TAMR.TAMIE is set, and the match values in TAMATCHR and optionally TAPMR have been reached when configured in one-shot or periodic mode.

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CAERIS
field.description:
GPT Timer A Capture Mode Event Raw Interrupt
0: The event has not occured. 1: The event has occured.
This interrupt asserts when the subtimer is configured in Input Edge-Time mode

field.name: CAMRIS
field.description:
GPT Timer A Capture Mode Match Raw Interrupt
0: The capture mode match for Timer A has not occurred. 1: A capture mode match has occurred for Timer A. This interrupt asserts when the values in the TAR and TAPR match the values in the TAMATCHR and TAPMR when configured in Input Edge-Time mode.
This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to the ICLR.CAMCINT bit.

field.name: TATORIS
field.description:
GPT Timer A Time-out Raw Interrupt
0: Timer A has not timed out 1: Timer A has timed out.
This interrupt is asserted when a one-shot or periodic mode timer reaches its count limit. The count limit is 0 or the value loaded into TAILR, depending on the count direction.

register.name: MIS
register.description: Masked Interrupt Status Values are result of bitwise AND operation between RIS and IMR Assosciated clear register: ICLR

field.name: RESERVED14
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: DMABMIS
field.description: 0: No interrupt or interrupt not enabled 1: RIS.DMABRIS = 1 && IMR.DMABIM = 1

field.name: RESERVED12
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: TBMMIS
field.description: 0: No interrupt or interrupt not enabled 1: RIS.TBMRIS = 1 && IMR.TBMIM = 1

field.name: CBEMIS
field.description: 0: No interrupt or interrupt not enabled 1: RIS.CBERIS = 1 && IMR.CBEIM = 1

field.name: CBMMIS
field.description: 0: No interrupt or interrupt not enabled 1: RIS.CBMRIS = 1 && IMR.CBMIM = 1

field.name: TBTOMIS
field.description: 0: No interrupt or interrupt not enabled 1: RIS.TBTORIS = 1 && IMR.TBTOIM = 1

field.name: RESERVED6
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: DMAAMIS
field.description: 0: No interrupt or interrupt not enabled 1: RIS.DMAARIS = 1 && IMR.DMAAIM = 1

field.name: TAMMIS
field.description: 0: No interrupt or interrupt not enabled 1: RIS.TAMRIS = 1 && IMR.TAMIM = 1

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CAEMIS
field.description: 0: No interrupt or interrupt not enabled 1: RIS.CAERIS = 1 && IMR.CAEIM = 1

field.name: CAMMIS
field.description: 0: No interrupt or interrupt not enabled 1: RIS.CAMRIS = 1 && IMR.CAMIM = 1

field.name: TATOMIS
field.description: 0: No interrupt or interrupt not enabled 1: RIS.TATORIS = 1 && IMR.TATOIM = 1

register.name: ICLR
register.description: Interrupt Clear This register is used to clear status bits in the RIS and MIS registers

field.name: RESERVED14
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: DMABINT
field.description: 0: Do nothing. 1: Clear RIS.DMABRIS and MIS.DMABMIS

field.name: RESERVED12
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: TBMCINT
field.description: 0: Do nothing. 1: Clear RIS.TBMRIS and MIS.TBMMIS

field.name: CBECINT
field.description: 0: Do nothing. 1: Clear RIS.CBERIS and MIS.CBEMIS

field.name: CBMCINT
field.description: 0: Do nothing. 1: Clear RIS.CBMRIS and MIS.CBMMIS

field.name: TBTOCINT
field.description: 0: Do nothing. 1: Clear RIS.TBTORIS and MIS.TBTOMIS

field.name: RESERVED6
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: DMAAINT
field.description: 0: Do nothing. 1: Clear RIS.DMAARIS and MIS.DMAAMIS

field.name: TAMCINT
field.description: 0: Do nothing. 1: Clear RIS.TAMRIS and MIS.TAMMIS

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CAECINT
field.description: 0: Do nothing. 1: Clear RIS.CAERIS and MIS.CAEMIS
