register.name: TAILR
register.description: Timer A Interval Load Register

register.name: TBILR
register.description: Timer B Interval Load Register

register.name: TAMATCHR
register.description:
Timer A Match Register
Interrupts can be generated when the timer value is equal to the value in this register in one-shot or periodic mode.
In Edge-Count mode, this register along with TAILR, determines how many edge events are counted. The total number of edge events counted is equal to the value in TAILR minus this value.
Note that in edge-count mode, when executing an up-count, the value of TAPR and TAILR must be greater than the value of TAPMR and this register.
In PWM mode, this value along with TAILR, determines the duty cycle of the output PWM signal.
When a 16/32-bit GPT is configured to one of the 32-bit modes, TAMATCHR appears as a 32-bit register. (The upper 16-bits correspond to the contents TBMATCHR).
In a 16-bit mode, the upper 16 bits of this register read as 0s and have no effect on the state of TBMATCHR.
Note : This register is updated internally (takes effect) based on TAMR.TAMRSU

register.name: TBMATCHR
register.description:
Timer B Match Register
When a GPT is configured to one of the 32-bit modes, the contents of bits 15:0 in this register are loaded into the upper 16 bits of TAMATCHR. Reads from this register return the current match value of Timer B and writes are ignored. In a 16-bit mode, bits 15:0 are used for the match value. Bits 31:16 are reserved in both cases.
Note : This register is updated internally (takes effect) based on TBMR.TBMRSU

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: TBMATCHR
field.description: GPT Timer B Match Register

register.name: TAPR
register.description: Timer A Pre-scale This register allows software to extend the range of the timers when they are used individually. When in one-shot or periodic down count modes, this register acts as a true prescaler for the timer counter. When acting as a true prescaler, the prescaler counts down to 0 before the value in TAR and TAV registers are incremented. In all other individual/split modes, this register is a linear extension of the upper range of the timer counter, holding bits 23:16 in the 16-bit modes of the 16/32-bit GPT.

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: TAPSR
field.description:
Timer A Pre-scale.
Prescaler ratio in one-shot and periodic count mode is TAPSR + 1, that is:
0: Prescaler ratio = 1 1: Prescaler ratio = 2 2: Prescaler ratio = 3 ... 255: Prescaler ratio = 256

register.name: TBPR
register.description: Timer B Pre-scale This register allows software to extend the range of the timers when they are used individually. When in one-shot or periodic down count modes, this register acts as a true prescaler for the timer counter. When acting as a true prescaler, the prescaler counts down to 0 before the value in TBR and TBV registers are incremented. In all other individual/split modes, this register is a linear extension of the upper range of the timer counter, holding bits 23:16 in the 16-bit modes of the 16/32-bit GPT.

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: TBPSR
field.description:
Timer B Pre-scale.
Prescale ratio in one-shot and periodic count mode is TBPSR + 1, that is:
0: Prescaler ratio = 1 1: Prescaler ratio = 2 2: Prescaler ratio = 3 ... 255: Prescaler ratio = 256

register.name: TAPMR
register.description: Timer A Pre-scale Match This register allows software to extend the range of the TAMATCHR when used individually.

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: TAPSMR
field.description: GPT Timer A Pre-scale Match. In 16 bit mode this field holds bits 23 to 16.

register.name: TBPMR
register.description: Timer B Pre-scale Match This register allows software to extend the range of the TBMATCHR when used individually.

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: TBPSMR
field.description: GPT Timer B Pre-scale Match Register. In 16 bit mode this field holds bits 23 to 16.

register.name: TAR
register.description:
Timer A Register This register shows the current value of the Timer A counter in all cases except for Input Edge Count and Time modes. In the Input Edge Count mode, this register contains the number of edges that have occurred. In the Input Edge Time mode, this register contains the time at which the last edge event took place.
When a GPT is configured to one of the 32-bit modes, this register appears as a 32-bit register (the upper 16-bits correspond to the contents of the Timer B (TBR) register). In the16-bit Input Edge Count, Input Edge Time, and PWM modes, bits 15:0 contain the value of the counter and bits 23:16 contain the value of the prescaler, which is the upper 8 bits of the count. Bits 31:24 always read as 0. To read the value of the prescaler in 16-bit One-Shot and Periodic modes, read bits [23:16] in the TAV register. To read the value of the prescalar in periodic snapshot mode, read the Timer A Prescale Snapshot (TAPS) register.

register.name: TBR
register.description:
Timer B Register This register shows the current value of the Timer B counter in all cases except for Input Edge Count and Time modes. In the Input Edge Count mode, this register contains the number of edges that have occurred. In the Input Edge Time mode, this register contains the time at which the last edge event took place.
When a GPTM is configured to one of the 32-bit modes, the contents of bits 15:0 in this register are loaded into the upper 16 bits of the TAR register. Reads from this register return the current value of Timer B. In a 16-bit mode, bits 15:0 contain the value of the counter and bits 23:16 contain the value of the prescaler in Input Edge Count, Input Edge Time, and PWM modes, which is the upper 8 bits of the count. Bits 31:24 always read as 0. To read the value of the prescaler in 16-bit One-Shot and Periodic modes, read bits [23:16] in the TBV register. To read the value of the prescalar in periodic snapshot mode, read the Timer B Prescale Snapshot (TBPS) register.

register.name: TAV
register.description:
Timer A Value When read, this register shows the current, free-running value of Timer A in all modes. Softwarecan use this value to determine the time elapsed between an interrupt and the ISR entry when using the snapshot feature with the periodic operating mode. When written, the value written into this register is loaded into the TAR register on the next clock cycle.
When a 16/32-bit GPTM is configured to one of the 32-bit modes, this register appears as a 32-bit register (the upper 16-bits correspond to the contents of the GPTM Timer B Value (TBV) register). In a 16-bit mode, bits 15:0 contain the value of the counter and bits 23:16 contain the current, free-running value of the prescaler, which is the upper 8 bits of the count in Input Edge Count, Input Edge Time, PWM and one-shot or periodic up count modes. In one-shot or periodic down count modes, the prescaler stored in 23:16 is a true prescaler, meaning bits 23:16 count down before decrementing the value in bits 15:0. The prescaler in bits 31:24 always reads as 0.

register.name: TBV
register.description:
Timer B Value When read, this register shows the current, free-running value of Timer B in all modes. Software can use this value to determine the time elapsed between an interrupt and the ISR entry. When written, the value written into this register is loaded into the TBR register on the next clock cycle.
When a 16/32-bit GPTM is configured to one of the 32-bit modes, the contents of bits 15:0 in this register are loaded into the upper 16 bits of the TAV register. Reads from this register return the current free-running value of Timer B. In a 16-bit mode, bits 15:0 contain the value of the counter and bits 23:16 contain the current, free-running value of the prescaler, which is the upper 8 bits of the count in Input Edge Count, Input Edge Time, PWM and one-shot or periodic up count modes. In one-shot or periodic down count modes, the prescaler stored in 23:16 is a true prescaler, meaning bits 23:16 count down before decrementing the value in bits 15:0. The prescaler in bits 31:24 always reads as 0.

register.name: TAPS
register.description:
Timer A Pre-scale Snap-shot
Based on the value in the register field TAMR.TAILD, this register is updated with the value from TAPR register either on the next cycle or on the next timeout.
This register shows the current value of the Timer A pre-scaler in the 16-bit mode.

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: PSS
field.description: GPT Timer A Pre-scaler

register.name: TBPS
register.description:
Timer B Pre-scale Snap-shot
Based on the value in the register field TBMR.TBILD, this register is updated with the value from TBPR register either on the next cycle or on the next timeout.
This register shows the current value of the Timer B pre-scaler in the 16-bit mode.

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: PSS
field.description: GPT Timer B Pre-scaler

register.name: TAPV
register.description: Timer A Pre-scale Value This register shows the current value of the Timer A free running pre-scaler in the 16-bit mode.

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: PSV
field.description: GPT Timer A Pre-scaler Value

register.name: TBPV
register.description: Timer B Pre-scale Value This register shows the current value of the Timer B free running pre-scaler in the 16-bit mode.

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: PSV
field.description: GPT Timer B Pre-scaler Value

register.name: DMAEV
register.description: DMA Event This register allows software to enable/disable GPT DMA trigger events.

field.name: RESERVED12
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved field. Writing any other value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: TBMDMAEN
field.description: GPT Timer B Match DMA Trigger Enable

field.name: CBEDMAEN
field.description: GPT Timer B Capture Event DMA Trigger Enable

field.name: CBMDMAEN
field.description: GPT Timer B Capture Match DMA Trigger Enable

field.name: TBTODMAEN
field.description: GPT Timer B Time-Out DMA Trigger Enable

field.name: RESERVED5
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved field. Writing any other value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: TAMDMAEN
field.description: GPT Timer A Match DMA Trigger Enable

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CAEDMAEN
field.description: GPT Timer A Capture Event DMA Trigger Enable

field.name: CAMDMAEN
field.description: GPT Timer A Capture Match DMA Trigger Enable

field.name: TATODMAEN
field.description: GPT Timer A Time-Out DMA Trigger Enable

register.name: VERSION
register.description: Peripheral Version This register provides information regarding the GPT version

register.name: ANDCCP
register.description: Combined CCP Output This register is used to logically AND CCP output pairs for each timer

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CCP_AND_EN
field.description:
Enables AND operation of the CCP outputs for timers A and B.
0 : PWM outputs of Timer A and Timer B are the internal generated PWM signals of the respective timers. 1 : PWM output of Timer A is ANDed version of Timer A and Timer B PWM signals and Timer B PWM ouput is Timer B PWM signal only.

register.name: SOAR
register.description: Slave Own Address This register consists of seven address bits that identify this I2C device on the I2C bus.

field.name: RESERVED7
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: OAR
field.description: I2C slave own address This field specifies bits a6 through a0 of the slave address.

register.name: SSTAT
register.description: Slave Status Note: This register shares address with SCTL, meaning that this register functions as a control register when written, and a status register when read.

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: FBR
field.description:
First byte received
0: The first byte has not been received. 1: The first byte following the slave's own address has been received.
This bit is only valid when the RREQ bit is set and is automatically cleared when data has been read from the SDR register. Note: This bit is not used for slave transmit operations.

field.name: TREQ
field.description:
Transmit request
0: No outstanding transmit request. 1: The I2C controller has been addressed as a slave transmitter and is using clock stretching to delay the master until data has been written to the SDR register.

field.name: RREQ
field.description:
Receive request
0: No outstanding receive data 1: The I2C controller has outstanding receive data from the I2C master and is using clock stretching to delay the master until data has been read from the SDR register.

register.name: SCTL
register.description: Slave Control Note: This register shares address with SSTAT, meaning that this register functions as a control register when written, and a status register when read.

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved field. Writing any other value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: DA
field.description:
Device active
0: Disables the I2C slave operation 1: Enables the I2C slave operation

register.name: SDR
register.description: Slave Data This register contains the data to be transmitted when in the Slave Transmit state, and the data received when in the Slave Receive state.

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: DATA
field.description: Data for transfer This field contains the data for transfer during a slave receive or transmit operation. When written the register data is used as transmit data. When read, this register returns the last data received. Data is stored until next update, either by a system write for transmit or by an external master for receive.

register.name: SIMR
register.description: Slave Interrupt Mask This register controls whether a raw interrupt is promoted to a controller interrupt.

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: STOPIM
field.description:
Stop condition interrupt mask
0: The SRIS.STOPRIS interrupt is suppressed and not sent to the interrupt controller. 1: The SRIS.STOPRIS interrupt is enabled and sent to the interrupt controller.

field.name: STARTIM
field.description:
Start condition interrupt mask
0: The SRIS.STARTRIS interrupt is suppressed and not sent to the interrupt controller. 1: The SRIS.STARTRIS interrupt is enabled and sent to the interrupt controller.

field.name: DATAIM
field.description:
Data interrupt mask
0: The SRIS.DATARIS interrupt is suppressed and not sent to the interrupt controller. 1: The SRIS.DATARIS interrupt is enabled and sent to the interrupt controller.

register.name: SRIS
register.description: Slave Raw Interrupt Status This register shows the unmasked interrupt status.

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: STOPRIS
field.description:
Stop condition raw interrupt status
0: No interrupt 1: A Stop condition interrupt is pending.
This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to SICR.STOPIC.

field.name: STARTRIS
field.description:
Start condition raw interrupt status
0: No interrupt 1: A Start condition interrupt is pending.
This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to SICR.STARTIC.

field.name: DATARIS
field.description:
Data raw interrupt status
0: No interrupt 1: A data received or data requested interrupt is pending.
This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to the SICR.DATAIC.

register.name: SMIS
register.description: Slave Masked Interrupt Status This register show which interrupt is active (based on result from SRIS and SIMR).

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: STOPMIS
field.description:
Stop condition masked interrupt status
0: An interrupt has not occurred or is masked/disabled. 1: An unmasked Stop condition interrupt is pending.
This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to the SICR.STOPIC.

field.name: STARTMIS
field.description:
Start condition masked interrupt status
0: An interrupt has not occurred or is masked/disabled. 1: An unmasked Start condition interrupt is pending.
This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to the SICR.STARTIC.

field.name: DATAMIS
field.description:
Data masked interrupt status
0: An interrupt has not occurred or is masked/disabled. 1: An unmasked data received or data requested interrupt is pending.
This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to the SICR.DATAIC.

register.name: SICR
register.description: Slave Interrupt Clear This register clears the raw interrupt SRIS.

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: STOPIC
field.description:
Stop condition interrupt clear
Writing 1 to this bit clears SRIS.STOPRIS and SMIS.STOPMIS.

field.name: STARTIC
field.description:
Start condition interrupt clear
Writing 1 to this bit clears SRIS.STARTRIS SMIS.STARTMIS.

field.name: DATAIC
field.description:
Data interrupt clear
Writing 1 to this bit clears SRIS.DATARIS SMIS.DATAMIS.

register.name: MSA
register.description: Master Salve Address This register contains seven address bits of the slave to be accessed by the master (a6-a0), and an RS bit determining if the next operation is a receive or transmit.

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: SA
field.description: I2C master slave address Defines which slave is addressed for the transaction in master mode

field.name: RS
field.description: Receive or Send This bit-field specifies if the next operation is a receive (high) or a transmit/send (low) from the addressed slave SA.

register.name: MSTAT
register.description: Master Status

field.name: RESERVED7
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: BUSBSY
field.description:
Bus busy
0: The I2C bus is idle. 1: The I2C bus is busy.
The bit changes based on the MCTRL.START and MCTRL.STOP conditions.

field.name: IDLE
field.description:
I2C idle
0: The I2C controller is not idle. 1: The I2C controller is idle.

field.name: ARBLST
field.description:
Arbitration lost
0: The I2C controller won arbitration. 1: The I2C controller lost arbitration.

field.name: DATACK_N
field.description:
Data Was Not Acknowledge
0: The transmitted data was acknowledged. 1: The transmitted data was not acknowledged.

field.name: ADRACK_N
field.description:
Address Was Not Acknowledge
0: The transmitted address was acknowledged. 1: The transmitted address was not acknowledged.

field.name: ERR
field.description:
Error
0: No error was detected on the last operation. 1: An error occurred on the last operation.

field.name: BUSY
field.description:
I2C busy
0: The controller is idle. 1: The controller is busy.
When this bit-field is set, the other status bits are not valid.
Note: The I2C controller requires four SYSBUS clock cycles to assert the BUSY status after I2C master operation has been initiated through MCTRL register. Hence after programming MCTRL register, application is requested to wait for four SYSBUS clock cycles before issuing a controller status inquiry through MSTAT register. Any prior inquiry would result in wrong status being reported.

register.name: MCTRL
register.description:
Master Control
This register accesses status bits when read and control bits when written. When read, the status register indicates the state of the I2C bus controller as stated in MSTAT. When written, the control register configures the I2C controller operation.
To generate a single transmit cycle, the I2C Master Slave Address (MSA) register is written with the desired address, the MSA.RS bit is cleared, and this register is written with * ACK=X (0 or 1), * STOP=1, * START=1, * RUN=1 to perform the operation and stop. When the operation is completed (or aborted due an error), an interrupt becomes active and the data may be read from the MDR register.

field.name: RESERVED4
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: ACK
field.description:
Data acknowledge enable
0: The received data byte is not acknowledged automatically by the master. 1: The received data byte is acknowledged automatically by the master.
This bit-field must be cleared when the I2C bus controller requires no further data to be transmitted from the slave transmitter.

field.name: STOP
field.description:
This bit-field determines if the cycle stops at the end of the data cycle or continues on to a repeated START condition.
0: The controller does not generate the Stop condition. 1: The controller generates the Stop condition.

field.name: START
field.description:
This bit-field generates the Start or Repeated Start condition.
0: The controller does not generate the Start condition. 1: The controller generates the Start condition.

field.name: RUN
field.description:
I2C master enable
0: The master is disabled. 1: The master is enabled to transmit or receive data.

register.name: MDR
register.description: Master Data This register contains the data to be transmitted when in the Master Transmit state and the data received when in the Master Receive state.

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: DATA
field.description: When Read: Last RX Data is returned When Written: Data is transferred during TX transaction

register.name: MTPR
register.description: I2C Master Timer Period This register specifies the period of the SCL clock.

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: TPR_7
field.description: Must be set to 0 to set TPR. If set to 1, a write to TPR will be ignored.

field.name: TPR
field.description: SCL clock period This field specifies the period of the SCL clock. SCL_PRD = 2*(1+TPR)*(SCL_LP + SCL_HP)*CLK_PRD where: SCL_PRD is the SCL line period (I2C clock). TPR is the timer period register value (range of 1 to 127) SCL_LP is the SCL low period (fixed at 6). SCL_HP is the SCL high period (fixed at 4). CLK_PRD is the system clock period in ns.

register.name: MIMR
register.description: Master Interrupt Mask This register controls whether a raw interrupt is promoted to a controller interrupt.

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: IM
field.description:
Interrupt mask
0: The MRIS.RIS interrupt is suppressed and not sent to the interrupt controller. 1: The master interrupt is sent to the interrupt controller when the MRIS.RIS is set.

register.name: MRIS
register.description: Master Raw Interrupt Status This register show the unmasked interrupt status.

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: RIS
field.description:
Raw interrupt status
0: No interrupt 1: A master interrupt is pending.
This bit is cleared by writing 1 to the MICR.IC bit .

register.name: MMIS
register.description: Master Masked Interrupt Status This register show which interrupt is active (based on result from MRIS and MIMR).

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: MIS
field.description:
Masked interrupt status
0: An interrupt has not occurred or is masked. 1: A master interrupt is pending.
This bit is cleared by writing 1 to the MICR.IC bit .

register.name: MICR
register.description: Master Interrupt Clear This register clears the raw and masked interrupt.

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: IC
field.description:
Interrupt clear Writing 1 to this bit clears MRIS.RIS and MMIS.MIS .
Reading this register returns no meaningful data.

register.name: MCR
register.description: Master Configuration This register configures the mode (Master or Slave) and sets the interface for test mode loopback.

field.name: RESERVED6
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: SFE
field.description: I2C slave function enable

field.name: MFE
field.description: I2C master function enable

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: LPBK
field.description:
I2C loopback
0: Normal operation 1: Loopback operation (test mode)

peripheral.name: I2S0
peripheral.description: I2S Audio DMA module supporting formats I2S, LJF, RJF and DSP

register.name: AIFWCLKSRC
register.description: WCLK Source Selection

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: WCLK_INV
field.description:
Inverts WCLK source (pad or internal) when set.
0: Not inverted 1: Inverted

field.name: WCLK_SRC
field.description: Selects WCLK source for AIF (should be the same as the BCLK source). The BCLK source is defined in the PRCM:I2SBCLKSEL.SRC

enumeratedValue.name: RESERVED
enumeratedValue.description: Not supported. Will give same WCLK as 'NONE' ('00')

enumeratedValue.name: INT
enumeratedValue.description: Internal WCLK generator, from module PRCM

register.name: AIFDMACFG
register.description: DMA Buffer Size Configuration

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: END_FRAME_IDX
field.description: Defines the length of the DMA buffer. Writing a non-zero value to this register field enables and initializes AIF. Note that before doing so, all other configuration must have been done, and AIFINPTRNEXT/AIFOUTPTRNEXT must have been loaded.

register.name: AIFDIRCFG
register.description: Pin Direction

field.name: RESERVED6
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: AD1
field.description:
Configures the AD1 audio data pin usage:
0x3: Reserved

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: AD0
field.description:
Configures the AD0 audio data pin usage:
0x3: Reserved

register.name: AIFFMTCFG
register.description: Serial Interface Format Configuration

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: DATA_DELAY
field.description:
The number of BCLK periods between a WCLK edge and MSB of the first word in a phase:
0x00: LJF and DSP format 0x01: I2S and DSP format 0x02: RJF format ... 0xFF: RJF format
Note: When 0, MSB of the next word will be output in the idle period between LSB of the previous word and the start of the next word. Otherwise logical 0 will be output until the data delay has expired.

field.name: MEM_LEN_24
field.description: The size of each word stored to or loaded from memory:

enumeratedValue.name: _24BIT
enumeratedValue.description: 24-bit (one 8 bit and one 16 bit locked access per sample)

field.name: SMPL_EDGE
field.description: On the serial audio interface, data (and wclk) is sampled and clocked out on opposite edges of BCLK.

enumeratedValue.name: POS
enumeratedValue.description: Data is sampled on the positive edge and clocked out on the negative edge.

enumeratedValue.name: NEG
enumeratedValue.description: Data is sampled on the negative edge and clocked out on the positive edge.

field.name: DUAL_PHASE
field.description:
Selects dual- or single-phase format.
0: Single-phase: DSP format 1: Dual-phase: I2S, LJF and RJF formats

field.name: WORD_LEN
field.description:
Number of bits per word (8-24): In single-phase format, this is the exact number of bits per word. In dual-phase format, this is the maximum number of bits per word.
Values below 8 and above 24 give undefined behavior. Data written to memory is always aligned to 16 or 24 bits as defined by MEM_LEN_24. Bit widths that differ from this alignment will either be truncated or zero padded.

register.name: AIFWMASK0
register.description: Word Selection Bit Mask for Pin 0

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: MASK
field.description:
Bit-mask indicating valid channels in a frame on AD0.
In single-phase mode, each bit represents one channel, starting with LSB for the first word in the frame. A frame can contain up to 8 channels. Channels that are not included in the mask will not be sampled and stored in memory, and clocked out as '0'.
In dual-phase mode, only the two LSBs are considered. For a stereo configuration, set both bits. For a mono configuration, set bit 0 only. In mono mode, only channel 0 will be sampled and stored to memory, and channel 0 will be repeated when clocked out.
In mono mode, only channel 0 will be sampled and stored to memory, and channel 0 will be repeated in the second phase when clocked out.
If all bits are zero, no input words will be stored to memory, and the output data lines will be constant '0'. This can be utilized when PWM debug output is desired without any actively used output pins.

register.name: AIFWMASK1
register.description: Word Selection Bit Mask for Pin 1

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: MASK
field.description:
Bit-mask indicating valid channels in a frame on AD1.
In single-phase mode, each bit represents one channel, starting with LSB for the first word in the frame. A frame can contain up to 8 channels. Channels that are not included in the mask will not be sampled and stored in memory, and clocked out as '0'.
In dual-phase mode, only the two LSBs are considered. For a stereo configuration, set both bits. For a mono configuration, set bit 0 only. In mono mode, only channel 0 will be sampled and stored to memory, and channel 0 will be repeated when clocked out.
In mono mode, only channel 0 will be sampled and stored to memory, and channel 0 will be repeated in the second phase when clocked out.
If all bits are zero, no input words will be stored to memory, and the output data lines will be constant '0'. This can be utilized when PWM debug output is desired without any actively used output pins.

register.name: AIFWMASK2
register.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

field.name: RESERVED0
field.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

register.name: AIFPWMVALUE
register.description: Audio Interface PWM Debug Value

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: PULSE_WIDTH
field.description:
The value written to this register determines the width of the active high PWM pulse (pwm_debug), which starts together with MSB of the first output word in a DMA buffer:
0x0000: Constant low 0x0001: Width of the pulse (number of BCLK cycles, here 1). ... 0xFFFE: Width of the pulse (number of BCLK cycles, here 65534). 0xFFFF: Constant high

register.name: AIFINPTRNEXT
register.description: DMA Input Buffer Next Pointer

field.name: PTR
field.description:
Pointer to the first byte in the next DMA input buffer.
The read value equals the last written value until the currently used DMA input buffer is completed, and then becomes null when the last written value is transferred to the DMA controller to start on the next buffer. This event is signalized by IRQFLAGS.AIF_DMA_IN.
At startup, the value must be written once before and once after configuring the DMA buffer size in AIFDMACFG.
The next pointer must be written to this register while the DMA function uses the previously written pointer. If not written in time, IRQFLAGS.PTR_ERR will be raised and all input pins will be disabled.

register.name: AIFINPTR
register.description: DMA Input Buffer Current Pointer

field.name: PTR
field.description: Value of the DMA input buffer pointer currently used by the DMA controller. Incremented by 1 (byte) or 2 (word) for each AHB access.

register.name: AIFOUTPTRNEXT
register.description: DMA Output Buffer Next Pointer

field.name: PTR
field.description:
Pointer to the first byte in the next DMA output buffer.
The read value equals the last written value until the currently used DMA output buffer is completed, and then becomes null when the last written value is transferred to the DMA controller to start on the next buffer. This event is signalized by IRQFLAGS.AIF_DMA_OUT.
At startup, the value must be written once before and once after configuring the DMA buffer size in AIFDMACFG. At this time, the first two samples will be fetched from memory.
The next pointer must be written to this register while the DMA function uses the previously written pointer. If not written in time, IRQFLAGS.PTR_ERR will be raised and all output pins will be disabled.

register.name: AIFOUTPTR
register.description: DMA Output Buffer Current Pointer

field.name: PTR
field.description: Value of the DMA output buffer pointer currently used by the DMA controller Incremented by 1 (byte) or 2 (word) for each AHB access.

register.name: STMPCTL
register.description: Samplestamp Generator Control Register

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: OUT_RDY
field.description: Low until the output pins are ready to be started by the samplestamp generator. When started (that is STMPOUTTRIG equals the WCLK counter) the bit goes back low.

field.name: IN_RDY
field.description: Low until the input pins are ready to be started by the samplestamp generator. When started (that is STMPINTRIG equals the WCLK counter) the bit goes back low.

field.name: STMP_EN
field.description: Enables the samplestamp generator. The samplestamp generator must only be enabled after it has been properly configured. When cleared, all samplestamp generator counters and capture values are cleared.

register.name: STMPXCNTCAPT0
register.description: Captured XOSC Counter Value, Capture Channel 0

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CAPT_VALUE
field.description: The value of the samplestamp XOSC counter (STMPXCNT.CURR_VALUE) last time an event was pulsed (event source selected in [EVENT.I2SSTMPSEL0.EV] for channel 0). This number corresponds to the number of 24 MHz clock cycles since the last positive edge of the selected WCLK. The value is cleared when STMPCTL.STMP_EN = 0. Note: Due to buffering and synchronization, WCLK is delayed by a small number of BCLK periods and clk periods. Note: When calculating the fractional part of the sample stamp, STMPXPER may be less than this bit field.

register.name: STMPXPER
register.description: XOSC Period Value

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: VALUE
field.description: The number of 24 MHz clock cycles in the previous WCLK period (that is - the next value of the XOSC counter at the positive WCLK edge, had it not been reset to 0). The value is cleared when STMPCTL.STMP_EN = 0.

register.name: STMPWCNTCAPT0
register.description: Captured WCLK Counter Value, Capture Channel 0

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CAPT_VALUE
field.description: The value of the samplestamp WCLK counter (STMPWCNT.CURR_VALUE) last time an event was pulsed (event source selected in EVENT:I2SSTMPSEL0.EV for channel 0). This number corresponds to the number of positive WCLK edges since the samplestamp generator was enabled (not taking modification through STMPWADD/STMPWSET into account). The value is cleared when STMPCTL.STMP_EN = 0.

register.name: STMPWPER
register.description: WCLK Counter Period Value

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: VALUE
field.description: Used to define when STMPWCNT is to be reset so number of WCLK edges are found for the size of the sample buffer. This is thus a modulo value for the WCLK counter. This number must correspond to the size of the sample buffer used by the system (that is the index of the last sample plus 1).

register.name: STMPINTRIG
register.description: WCLK Counter Trigger Value for Input Pins

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: IN_START_WCNT
field.description:
Compare value used to start the incoming audio streams. This bit field shall equal the WCLK counter value during the WCLK period in which the first input word(s) are sampled and stored to memory (that is the sample at the start of the very first DMA input buffer).
The value of this register takes effect when the following conditions are met: - One or more pins are configured as inputs in AIFDIRCFG. - AIFDMACFG has been configured for the correct buffer size, and at least 32 BCLK cycle ticks have happened.
Note: To avoid false triggers, this bit field should be set higher than STMPWPER.VALUE.

register.name: STMPOUTTRIG
register.description: WCLK Counter Trigger Value for Output Pins

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: OUT_START_WCNT
field.description:
Compare value used to start the outgoing audio streams.
This bit field must equal the WCLK counter value during the WCLK period in which the first output word(s) read from memory are clocked out (that is the sample at the start of the very first DMA output buffer).
The value of this register takes effect when the following conditions are met: - One or more pins are configured as outputs in AIFDIRCFG. - AIFDMACFG has been configured for the correct buffer size, and 32 BCLK cycle ticks have happened. - 2 samples have been preloaded from memory (examine the AIFOUTPTR register if necessary). Note: The memory read access is only performed when required, that is channels 0/1 must be selected in AIFWMASK0/AIFWMASK1.
Note: To avoid false triggers, this bit field should be set higher than STMPWPER.VALUE.

register.name: STMPWSET
register.description: WCLK Counter Set Operation

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: VALUE
field.description: WCLK counter modification: Sets the running WCLK counter equal to the written value.

register.name: STMPWADD
register.description: WCLK Counter Add Operation

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: VALUE_INC
field.description: WCLK counter modification: Adds the written value to the running WCLK counter. If a positive edge of WCLK occurs at the same time as the operation, this will be taken into account. To add a negative value, write "STMPWPER.VALUE - value".

register.name: STMPXPERMIN
register.description: XOSC Minimum Period Value Minimum Value of STMPXPER

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: VALUE
field.description: Each time STMPXPER is updated, the value is also loaded into this register, provided that the value is smaller than the current value in this register. When written, the register is reset to 0xFFFF (65535), regardless of the value written. The minimum value can be used to detect extra WCLK pulses (this registers value will be significantly smaller than STMPXPER.VALUE).

register.name: STMPWCNT
register.description: Current Value of WCNT

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CURR_VALUE
field.description: Current value of the WCLK counter

register.name: STMPXCNT
register.description: Current Value of XCNT

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CURR_VALUE
field.description: Current value of the XOSC counter, latched when reading STMPWCNT.

register.name: STMPXCNTCAPT1
register.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

field.name: CAPT_VALUE
field.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

register.name: STMPWCNTCAPT1
register.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

field.name: CAPT_VALUE
field.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

register.name: IRQMASK
register.description:
Interrupt Mask Register
Selects mask states of the flags in IRQFLAGS that contribute to the I2S_IRQ event.

field.name: RESERVED6
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: AIF_DMA_IN
field.description:
IRQFLAGS.AIF_DMA_IN interrupt mask
0: Disable 1: Enable

field.name: AIF_DMA_OUT
field.description:
IRQFLAGS.AIF_DMA_OUT interrupt mask
0: Disable 1: Enable

field.name: WCLK_TIMEOUT
field.description:
IRQFLAGS.WCLK_TIMEOUT interrupt mask
0: Disable 1: Enable

field.name: BUS_ERR
field.description:
IRQFLAGS.BUS_ERR interrupt mask
0: Disable 1: Enable

field.name: WCLK_ERR
field.description:
IRQFLAGS.WCLK_ERR interrupt mask
0: Disable 1: Enable

field.name: PTR_ERR
field.description:
IRQFLAGS.PTR_ERR interrupt mask.
0: Disable 1: Enable

register.name: IRQFLAGS
register.description: Raw Interrupt Status Register

field.name: RESERVED6
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: AIF_DMA_IN
field.description: Set when condition for this bit field event occurs (auto cleared when input pointer is updated - AIFINPTRNEXT), see description of AIFINPTRNEXT register for details.

field.name: AIF_DMA_OUT
field.description: Set when condition for this bit field event occurs (auto cleared when output pointer is updated - AIFOUTPTRNEXT), see description of AIFOUTPTRNEXT register for details

field.name: WCLK_TIMEOUT
field.description:
Set when the sample stamp generator does not detect a positive WCLK edge for 65535 clk periods. This signalizes that the internal or external BCLK and WCLK generator source has been disabled.
The bit is sticky and may only be cleared by software (by writing '1' to IRQCLR.WCLK_TIMEOUT).

field.name: BUS_ERR
field.description:
Set when a DMA operation is not completed in time (that is audio output buffer underflow, or audio input buffer overflow). This error requires a complete restart since word synchronization has been lost. The bit is sticky and may only be cleared by software (by writing '1' to IRQCLR.BUS_ERR).
Note that DMA initiated transactions to illegal addresses will not trigger an interrupt. The response to such transactions is undefined.

field.name: WCLK_ERR
field.description: Set when: - An unexpected WCLK edge occurs during the data delay period of a phase. Note unexpected WCLK edges during the word and idle periods of the phase are not detected. - In dual-phase mode, when two WCLK edges are less than 4 BCLK cycles apart. - In single-phase mode, when a WCLK pulse occurs before the last channel. This error requires a complete restart since word synchronization has been lost. The bit is sticky and may only be cleared by software (by writing '1' to IRQCLR.WCLK_ERR).

field.name: PTR_ERR
field.description: Set when AIFINPTRNEXT or AIFOUTPTRNEXT has not been loaded with the next block address in time. This error requires a complete restart since word synchronization has been lost. The bit is sticky and may only be cleared by software (by writing '1' to IRQCLR.PTR_ERR).

register.name: IRQSET
register.description: Interrupt Set Register

field.name: RESERVED6
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: AIF_DMA_IN
field.description: 1: Sets the interrupt of IRQFLAGS.AIF_DMA_IN (unless a auto clear criteria was given at the same time, in which the set will be ignored)

field.name: AIF_DMA_OUT
field.description: 1: Sets the interrupt of IRQFLAGS.AIF_DMA_OUT (unless a auto clear criteria was given at the same time, in which the set will be ignored)

field.name: WCLK_TIMEOUT
field.description: 1: Sets the interrupt of IRQFLAGS.WCLK_TIMEOUT

field.name: BUS_ERR
field.description: 1: Sets the interrupt of IRQFLAGS.BUS_ERR

field.name: WCLK_ERR
field.description: 1: Sets the interrupt of IRQFLAGS.WCLK_ERR

field.name: PTR_ERR
field.description: 1: Sets the interrupt of IRQFLAGS.PTR_ERR

register.name: IRQCLR
register.description: Interrupt Clear Register

field.name: RESERVED6
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: AIF_DMA_IN
field.description: 1: Clears the interrupt of IRQFLAGS.AIF_DMA_IN (unless a set criteria was given at the same time in which the clear will be ignored)

field.name: AIF_DMA_OUT
field.description: 1: Clears the interrupt of IRQFLAGS.AIF_DMA_OUT (unless a set criteria was given at the same time in which the clear will be ignored)

field.name: WCLK_TIMEOUT
field.description: 1: Clears the interrupt of IRQFLAGS.WCLK_TIMEOUT (unless a set criteria was given at the same time in which the clear will be ignored)

field.name: BUS_ERR
field.description: 1: Clears the interrupt of IRQFLAGS.BUS_ERR (unless a set criteria was given at the same time in which the clear will be ignored)

field.name: WCLK_ERR
field.description: 1: Clears the interrupt of IRQFLAGS.WCLK_ERR (unless a set criteria was given at the same time in which the clear will be ignored)

field.name: PTR_ERR
field.description: 1: Clears the interrupt of IRQFLAGS.PTR_ERR (unless a set criteria was given at the same time in which the clear will be ignored)

peripheral.name: IOC
peripheral.description: IO Controller (IOC) - configures all the DIOs and resides in the MCU domain.

register.name: IOCFG0
register.description: Configuration of DIO0

field.name: RESERVED31
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: HYST_EN
field.description: 0: Input hysteresis disable 1: Input hysteresis enable

field.name: IE
field.description:
0: Input disabled 1: Input enabled
Note: If IO is configured for AUX ie. PORT_ID = 0x08, the enable will be ignored.

field.name: WU_CFG
field.description:
If DIO is configured GPIO or non-AON peripheral signals, i.e. PORT_ID 0x00 or >0x08:
00: No wake-up 01: No wake-up 10: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going low. 11: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going high.
If IO is configured for AON peripheral signals or AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08, this register only sets wakeup enable or not.
00, 01: Wakeup disabled 10, 11: Wakeup enabled
Polarity is controlled from AON registers.
Note:When the MSB is set, the IOC will deactivate the output enable for the DIO.

field.name: IOMODE
field.description:
IO Mode N/A for IO configured for AON periph. signals and AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08 AUX has its own open_source/drain configuration.
0x2: Reserved. Undefined behavior. 0x3: Reserved. Undefined behavior.

field.name: RESERVED19
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: EDGE_IRQ_EN
field.description: 0: No interrupt generation 1: Enable interrupt generation for this IO (Only effective if EDGE_DET is enabled)

field.name: EDGE_DET
field.description: Enable generation of edge detection events on this IO

field.name: RESERVED15
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: PULL_CTL
field.description: Pull control

field.name: SLEW_RED
field.description: 0: Normal slew rate 1: Enables reduced slew rate in output driver.

field.name: IOCURR
field.description: Selects IO current mode of this IO.

enumeratedValue.name: _4_8MA
enumeratedValue.description: Extended-Current (EC) mode: Min 8 mA for double drive strength IOs (min 4 mA for normal IOs) when IOSTR is set to AUTO

enumeratedValue.name: _4MA
enumeratedValue.description: High-Current (HC) mode: Min 4 mA when IOSTR is set to AUTO

enumeratedValue.name: _2MA
enumeratedValue.description: Low-Current (LC) mode: Min 2 mA when IOSTR is set to AUTO

field.name: IOSTR
field.description: Select source for drive strength control of this IO. This setting controls the drive strength of the Low-Current (LC) mode. Higher drive strength can be selected in IOCURR

enumeratedValue.name: MAX
enumeratedValue.description: Maximum drive strength, controlled by AON_IOC:IOSTRMAX (min 2 mA @1.8V with default values)

enumeratedValue.name: MED
enumeratedValue.description: Medium drive strength, controlled by AON_IOC:IOSTRMED (min 2 mA @2.5V with default values)

enumeratedValue.name: MIN
enumeratedValue.description: Minimum drive strength, controlled by AON_IOC:IOSTRMIN (min 2 mA @3.3V with default values)

enumeratedValue.name: AUTO
enumeratedValue.description: Automatic drive strength, controlled by AON BATMON based on battery voltage. (min 2 mA @VDDS)

field.name: RESERVED6
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: PORT_ID
field.description: Selects usage for DIO0

enumeratedValue.description: RF Core SMI Command Link In

enumeratedValue.name: RFC_SMI_CL_OUT
enumeratedValue.description: RF Core SMI Command Link Out

enumeratedValue.description: RF Core SMI Data Link In

field.name: WU_CFG
field.description:
If DIO is configured GPIO or non-AON peripheral signals, i.e. PORT_ID 0x00 or >0x08:
00: No wake-up 01: No wake-up 10: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going low. 11: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going high.
If IO is configured for AON peripheral signals or AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08, this register only sets wakeup enable or not.
00, 01: Wakeup disabled 10, 11: Wakeup enabled
Polarity is controlled from AON registers.
Note:When the MSB is set, the IOC will deactivate the output enable for the DIO.

field.name: IOMODE
field.description:
IO Mode N/A for IO configured for AON periph. signals and AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08 AUX has its own open_source/drain configuration.
0x2: Reserved. Undefined behavior. 0x3: Reserved. Undefined behavior.

field.name: RESERVED19
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: EDGE_IRQ_EN
field.description: 0: No interrupt generation 1: Enable interrupt generation for this IO (Only effective if EDGE_DET is enabled)

field.name: EDGE_DET
field.description: Enable generation of edge detection events on this IO

field.name: RESERVED15
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: PULL_CTL
field.description: Pull control

field.name: SLEW_RED
field.description: 0: Normal slew rate 1: Enables reduced slew rate in output driver.

field.name: IOCURR
field.description: Selects IO current mode of this IO.

enumeratedValue.name: _4_8MA
enumeratedValue.description: Extended-Current (EC) mode: Min 8 mA for double drive strength IOs (min 4 mA for normal IOs) when IOSTR is set to AUTO

enumeratedValue.name: _4MA
enumeratedValue.description: High-Current (HC) mode: Min 4 mA when IOSTR is set to AUTO

enumeratedValue.name: _2MA
enumeratedValue.description: Low-Current (LC) mode: Min 2 mA when IOSTR is set to AUTO

field.name: IOSTR
field.description: Select source for drive strength control of this IO. This setting controls the drive strength of the Low-Current (LC) mode. Higher drive strength can be selected in IOCURR

enumeratedValue.name: MAX
enumeratedValue.description: Maximum drive strength, controlled by AON_IOC:IOSTRMAX (min 2 mA @1.8V with default values)

enumeratedValue.name: MED
enumeratedValue.description: Medium drive strength, controlled by AON_IOC:IOSTRMED (min 2 mA @2.5V with default values)

enumeratedValue.name: MIN
enumeratedValue.description: Minimum drive strength, controlled by AON_IOC:IOSTRMIN (min 2 mA @3.3V with default values)

enumeratedValue.name: AUTO
enumeratedValue.description: Automatic drive strength, controlled by AON BATMON based on battery voltage. (min 2 mA @VDDS)

field.name: RESERVED6
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: PORT_ID
field.description: Selects usage for DIO4

register.name: IOCFG9
register.description: Configuration of DIO9

field.name: RESERVED31
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: HYST_EN
field.description: 0: Input hysteresis disable 1: Input hysteresis enable

field.name: IE
field.description:
0: Input disabled 1: Input enabled
Note: If IO is configured for AUX ie. PORT_ID = 0x08, the enable will be ignored.

field.name: WU_CFG
field.description:
If DIO is configured GPIO or non-AON peripheral signals, i.e. PORT_ID 0x00 or >0x08:
00: No wake-up 01: No wake-up 10: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going low. 11: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going high.
If IO is configured for AON peripheral signals or AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08, this register only sets wakeup enable or not.
00, 01: Wakeup disabled 10, 11: Wakeup enabled
Polarity is controlled from AON registers.
Note:When the MSB is set, the IOC will deactivate the output enable for the DIO.

field.name: IOMODE
field.description:
IO Mode N/A for IO configured for AON periph. signals and AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08 AUX has its own open_source/drain configuration.
0x2: Reserved. Undefined behavior. 0x3: Reserved. Undefined behavior.

field.name: RESERVED19
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: EDGE_IRQ_EN
field.description: 0: No interrupt generation 1: Enable interrupt generation for this IO (Only effective if EDGE_DET is enabled)

field.name: EDGE_DET
field.description: Enable generation of edge detection events on this IO

field.name: RESERVED15
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: PULL_CTL
field.description: Pull control

field.name: SLEW_RED
field.description: 0: Normal slew rate 1: Enables reduced slew rate in output driver.

field.name: IOCURR
field.description: Selects IO current mode of this IO.

enumeratedValue.name: _4_8MA
enumeratedValue.description: Extended-Current (EC) mode: Min 8 mA for double drive strength IOs (min 4 mA for normal IOs) when IOSTR is set to AUTO

enumeratedValue.name: _4MA
enumeratedValue.description: High-Current (HC) mode: Min 4 mA when IOSTR is set to AUTO

enumeratedValue.name: _2MA
enumeratedValue.description: Low-Current (LC) mode: Min 2 mA when IOSTR is set to AUTO

field.name: IOSTR
field.description: Select source for drive strength control of this IO. This setting controls the drive strength of the Low-Current (LC) mode. Higher drive strength can be selected in IOCURR

enumeratedValue.name: MAX
enumeratedValue.description: Maximum drive strength, controlled by AON_IOC:IOSTRMAX (min 2 mA @1.8V with default values)

enumeratedValue.name: MED
enumeratedValue.description: Medium drive strength, controlled by AON_IOC:IOSTRMED (min 2 mA @2.5V with default values)

enumeratedValue.name: MIN
enumeratedValue.description: Minimum drive strength, controlled by AON_IOC:IOSTRMIN (min 2 mA @3.3V with default values)

enumeratedValue.name: AUTO
enumeratedValue.description: Automatic drive strength, controlled by AON BATMON based on battery voltage. (min 2 mA @VDDS)

field.name: RESERVED6
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: PORT_ID
field.description: Selects usage for DIO9

enumeratedValue.name: RFC_SMI_CL_IN
enumeratedValue.description: RF Core SMI Command Link In

field.name: EDGE_DET
field.description: Enable generation of edge detection events on this IO

field.name: RESERVED15
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: PULL_CTL
field.description: Pull control

field.name: SLEW_RED
field.description: 0: Normal slew rate 1: Enables reduced slew rate in output driver.

field.name: IOCURR
field.description: Selects IO current mode of this IO.

enumeratedValue.name: _4_8MA
enumeratedValue.description: Extended-Current (EC) mode: Min 8 mA for double drive strength IOs (min 4 mA for normal IOs) when IOSTR is set to AUTO

enumeratedValue.name: _4MA
enumeratedValue.description: High-Current (HC) mode: Min 4 mA when IOSTR is set to AUTO

enumeratedValue.name: _2MA
enumeratedValue.description: Low-Current (LC) mode: Min 2 mA when IOSTR is set to AUTO

field.name: IOSTR
field.description: Select source for drive strength control of this IO. This setting controls the drive strength of the Low-Current (LC) mode. Higher drive strength can be selected in IOCURR

enumeratedValue.name: MAX
enumeratedValue.description: Maximum drive strength, controlled by AON_IOC:IOSTRMAX (min 2 mA @1.8V with default values)

enumeratedValue.name: MED
enumeratedValue.description: Medium drive strength, controlled by AON_IOC:IOSTRMED (min 2 mA @2.5V with default values)

enumeratedValue.name: MIN
enumeratedValue.description: Minimum drive strength, controlled by AON_IOC:IOSTRMIN (min 2 mA @3.3V with default values)

enumeratedValue.name: AUTO
enumeratedValue.description: Automatic drive strength, controlled by AON BATMON based on battery voltage. (min 2 mA @VDDS)

field.name: RESERVED6
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: PORT_ID
field.description: Selects usage for DIO13

register.name: IOCFG14
register.description: Configuration of DIO14

field.name: RESERVED31
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: HYST_EN
field.description: 0: Input hysteresis disable 1: Input hysteresis enable

field.name: IE
field.description:
0: Input disabled 1: Input enabled
Note: If IO is configured for AUX ie. PORT_ID = 0x08, the enable will be ignored.

field.name: WU_CFG
field.description:
If DIO is configured GPIO or non-AON peripheral signals, i.e. PORT_ID 0x00 or >0x08:
00: No wake-up 01: No wake-up 10: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going low. 11: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going high.
If IO is configured for AON peripheral signals or AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08, this register only sets wakeup enable or not.
00, 01: Wakeup disabled 10, 11: Wakeup enabled
Polarity is controlled from AON registers.
Note:When the MSB is set, the IOC will deactivate the output enable for the DIO.

field.name: IOMODE
field.description:
IO Mode N/A for IO configured for AON periph. signals and AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08 AUX has its own open_source/drain configuration.
0x2: Reserved. Undefined behavior. 0x3: Reserved. Undefined behavior.

field.name: RESERVED19
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: EDGE_IRQ_EN
field.description: 0: No interrupt generation 1: Enable interrupt generation for this IO (Only effective if EDGE_DET is enabled)

field.name: EDGE_DET
field.description: Enable generation of edge detection events on this IO

field.name: RESERVED15
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: PULL_CTL
field.description: Pull control

field.name: SLEW_RED
field.description: 0: Normal slew rate 1: Enables reduced slew rate in output driver.

field.name: IOCURR
field.description: Selects IO current mode of this IO.

register.name: IOCFG18
register.description: Configuration of DIO18

field.name: RESERVED31
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: HYST_EN
field.description: 0: Input hysteresis disable 1: Input hysteresis enable

field.name: IE
field.description:
0: Input disabled 1: Input enabled
Note: If IO is configured for AUX ie. PORT_ID = 0x08, the enable will be ignored.

field.name: WU_CFG
field.description:
If DIO is configured GPIO or non-AON peripheral signals, i.e. PORT_ID 0x00 or >0x08:
00: No wake-up 01: No wake-up 10: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going low. 11: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going high.
If IO is configured for AON peripheral signals or AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08, this register only sets wakeup enable or not.
00, 01: Wakeup disabled 10, 11: Wakeup enabled
Polarity is controlled from AON registers.
Note:When the MSB is set, the IOC will deactivate the output enable for the DIO.

field.name: IOMODE
field.description:
IO Mode N/A for IO configured for AON periph. signals and AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08 AUX has its own open_source/drain configuration.
0x2: Reserved. Undefined behavior. 0x3: Reserved. Undefined behavior.

field.name: RESERVED19
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: EDGE_IRQ_EN
field.description: 0: No interrupt generation 1: Enable interrupt generation for this IO (Only effective if EDGE_DET is enabled)

field.name: EDGE_DET
field.description: Enable generation of edge detection events on this IO

field.name: RESERVED15
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: PULL_CTL
field.description: Pull control

field.name: SLEW_RED
field.description: 0: Normal slew rate 1: Enables reduced slew rate in output driver.

field.name: IOCURR
field.description: Selects IO current mode of this IO.

enumeratedValue.name: _4_8MA
enumeratedValue.description: Extended-Current (EC) mode: Min 8 mA for double drive strength IOs (min 4 mA for normal IOs) when IOSTR is set to AUTO

enumeratedValue.name: _4MA
enumeratedValue.description: High-Current (HC) mode: Min 4 mA when IOSTR is set to AUTO

enumeratedValue.name: _2MA
enumeratedValue.description: Low-Current (LC) mode: Min 2 mA when IOSTR is set to AUTO

field.name: IOSTR
field.description: Select source for drive strength control of this IO. This setting controls the drive strength of the Low-Current (LC) mode. Higher drive strength can be selected in IOCURR

enumeratedValue.name: MAX
enumeratedValue.description: Maximum drive strength, controlled by AON_IOC:IOSTRMAX (min 2 mA @1.8V with default values)

enumeratedValue.name: MED
enumeratedValue.description: Medium drive strength, controlled by AON_IOC:IOSTRMED (min 2 mA @2.5V with default values)

enumeratedValue.name: MIN
enumeratedValue.description: Minimum drive strength, controlled by AON_IOC:IOSTRMIN (min 2 mA @3.3V with default values)

enumeratedValue.name: AUTO
enumeratedValue.description: Automatic drive strength, controlled by AON BATMON based on battery voltage. (min 2 mA @VDDS)

field.name: RESERVED6
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: PORT_ID
field.description: Selects usage for DIO18

enumeratedValue.name: _2MA
enumeratedValue.description: Low-Current (LC) mode: Min 2 mA when IOSTR is set to AUTO

field.name: IOSTR
field.description: Select source for drive strength control of this IO. This setting controls the drive strength of the Low-Current (LC) mode. Higher drive strength can be selected in IOCURR

enumeratedValue.name: MAX
enumeratedValue.description: Maximum drive strength, controlled by AON_IOC:IOSTRMAX (min 2 mA @1.8V with default values)

enumeratedValue.name: MED
enumeratedValue.description: Medium drive strength, controlled by AON_IOC:IOSTRMED (min 2 mA @2.5V with default values)

enumeratedValue.name: MIN
enumeratedValue.description: Minimum drive strength, controlled by AON_IOC:IOSTRMIN (min 2 mA @3.3V with default values)

enumeratedValue.name: AUTO
enumeratedValue.description: Automatic drive strength, controlled by AON BATMON based on battery voltage. (min 2 mA @VDDS)

field.name: RESERVED6
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: PORT_ID
field.description: Selects usage for DIO22

register.name: IOCFG23
register.description: Configuration of DIO23

field.name: RESERVED31
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: HYST_EN
field.description: 0: Input hysteresis disable 1: Input hysteresis enable

field.name: IE
field.description:
0: Input disabled 1: Input enabled
Note: If IO is configured for AUX ie. PORT_ID = 0x08, the enable will be ignored.

field.name: WU_CFG
field.description:
If DIO is configured GPIO or non-AON peripheral signals, i.e. PORT_ID 0x00 or >0x08:
00: No wake-up 01: No wake-up 10: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going low. 11: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going high.
If IO is configured for AON peripheral signals or AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08, this register only sets wakeup enable or not.
00, 01: Wakeup disabled 10, 11: Wakeup enabled
Polarity is controlled from AON registers.
Note:When the MSB is set, the IOC will deactivate the output enable for the DIO.

field.name: IOMODE
field.description:
IO Mode N/A for IO configured for AON periph. signals and AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08 AUX has its own open_source/drain configuration.
0x2: Reserved. Undefined behavior. 0x3: Reserved. Undefined behavior.

field.name: RESERVED19
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: EDGE_IRQ_EN
field.description: 0: No interrupt generation 1: Enable interrupt generation for this IO (Only effective if EDGE_DET is enabled)

field.name: EDGE_DET
field.description: Enable generation of edge detection events on this IO

field.name: RESERVED15
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: PULL_CTL
field.description: Pull control

field.name: SLEW_RED
field.description: 0: Normal slew rate 1: Enables reduced slew rate in output driver.

field.name: IOCURR
field.description: Selects IO current mode of this IO.

enumeratedValue.description: High-Current (HC) mode: Min 4 mA when IOSTR is set to AUTO

register.name: IOCFG27
register.description: Configuration of DIO27

field.name: RESERVED31
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: HYST_EN
field.description: 0: Input hysteresis disable 1: Input hysteresis enable

field.name: IE
field.description:
0: Input disabled 1: Input enabled
Note: If IO is configured for AUX ie. PORT_ID = 0x08, the enable will be ignored.

field.name: WU_CFG
field.description:
If DIO is configured GPIO or non-AON peripheral signals, i.e. PORT_ID 0x00 or >0x08:
00: No wake-up 01: No wake-up 10: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going low. 11: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going high.
If IO is configured for AON peripheral signals or AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08, this register only sets wakeup enable or not.
00, 01: Wakeup disabled 10, 11: Wakeup enabled
Polarity is controlled from AON registers.
Note:When the MSB is set, the IOC will deactivate the output enable for the DIO.

field.name: IOMODE
field.description:
IO Mode N/A for IO configured for AON periph. signals and AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08 AUX has its own open_source/drain configuration.
0x2: Reserved. Undefined behavior. 0x3: Reserved. Undefined behavior.

field.name: RESERVED19
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: EDGE_IRQ_EN
field.description: 0: No interrupt generation 1: Enable interrupt generation for this IO (Only effective if EDGE_DET is enabled)

field.name: EDGE_DET
field.description: Enable generation of edge detection events on this IO

field.name: RESERVED15
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: PULL_CTL
field.description: Pull control

field.name: SLEW_RED
field.description: 0: Normal slew rate 1: Enables reduced slew rate in output driver.

field.name: IOCURR
field.description: Selects IO current mode of this IO.

enumeratedValue.name: _4_8MA
enumeratedValue.description: Extended-Current (EC) mode: Min 8 mA for double drive strength IOs (min 4 mA for normal IOs) when IOSTR is set to AUTO

enumeratedValue.name: _4MA
enumeratedValue.description: High-Current (HC) mode: Min 4 mA when IOSTR is set to AUTO

enumeratedValue.name: _2MA
enumeratedValue.description: Low-Current (LC) mode: Min 2 mA when IOSTR is set to AUTO

field.name: IOSTR
field.description: Select source for drive strength control of this IO. This setting controls the drive strength of the Low-Current (LC) mode. Higher drive strength can be selected in IOCURR

enumeratedValue.name: MAX
enumeratedValue.description: Maximum drive strength, controlled by AON_IOC:IOSTRMAX (min 2 mA @1.8V with default values)

enumeratedValue.name: MED
enumeratedValue.description: Medium drive strength, controlled by AON_IOC:IOSTRMED (min 2 mA @2.5V with default values)

enumeratedValue.name: MIN
enumeratedValue.description: Minimum drive strength, controlled by AON_IOC:IOSTRMIN (min 2 mA @3.3V with default values)

enumeratedValue.name: AUTO
enumeratedValue.description: Automatic drive strength, controlled by AON BATMON based on battery voltage. (min 2 mA @VDDS)

field.name: RESERVED6
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: PORT_ID
field.description: Selects usage for DIO27

register.name: VDCTL
register.description: MCU Voltage Domain Control

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: MCU_VD
field.description:
Request WUC to power down the MCU voltage domain
0: No request 1: Assert request when possible. An asserted power down request will result in a boot of the MCU system when powered up again.
The bit will have no effect before the following requirements are met: 1. PDCTL1.CPU_ON = 0 2. PDCTL1.VIMS_MODE = 0 3. SECDMACLKGDS.DMA_CLK_EN = 0 (Note: Setting must be loaded with CLKLOADCTL.LOAD) 4. SECDMACLKGDS.CRYPTO_CLK_EN = 0 (Note: Setting must be loaded with CLKLOADCTL.LOAD) 5. RFC do no request access to BUS 6. System CPU in deepsleep

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: ULDO
field.description:
Request WUC to switch to uLDO.
0: No request 1: Assert request when possible
The bit will have no effect before the following requirements are met: 1. PDCTL1.CPU_ON = 0 2. PDCTL1.VIMS_MODE = 0 3. SECDMACLKGDS.DMA_CLK_EN = 0 (Note: Setting must be loaded with CLKLOADCTL.LOAD) 4. SECDMACLKGDS.CRYPTO_CLK_EN = 0 (Note: Setting must be loaded with CLKLOADCTL.LOAD) 5. RFC do no request access to BUS 6. System CPU in deepsleep

register.name: CLKLOADCTL
register.description: Load PRCM Settings To CLKCTRL Power Domain

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: LOAD_DONE
field.description:
Status of LOAD. Will be cleared to 0 when any of the registers requiring a LOAD is written to, and be set to 1 when a LOAD is done. Note that writing no change to a register will result in the LOAD_DONE being cleared.
0 : One or more registers have been write accessed after last LOAD 1 : No registers are write accessed after last LOAD

field.name: LOAD
field.description:
0: No action 1: Load settings to CLKCTRL. Bit is HW cleared.
Multiple changes to settings may be done before LOAD is written once so all changes takes place at the same time. LOAD can also be done after single setting updates.
Registers that needs to be followed by LOAD before settings being applied are: - RFCCLKG - VIMSCLKG - SECDMACLKGR - SECDMACLKGS - SECDMACLKGDS - GPIOCLKGR - GPIOCLKGS - GPIOCLKGDS - GPTCLKGR - GPTCLKGS - GPTCLKGDS - GPTCLKDIV - I2CCLKGR - I2CCLKGS - I2CCLKGDS - SSICLKGR - SSICLKGS - SSICLKGDS - UARTCLKGR - UARTCLKGS - UARTCLKGDS - I2SCLKGR - I2SCLKGS - I2SCLKGDS - I2SBCLKSEL - I2SCLKCTL - I2SMCLKDIV - I2SBCLKDIV - I2SWCLKDIV

register.name: GPTCLKDIV
register.description: GPT Scalar

field.name: RESERVED4
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: RATIO
field.description:
