For changes to take effect, CLKLOADCTL.LOAD needs to be written Other values are not supported.

register.name: I2SCLKCTL
register.description: I2S Clock Control

field.name: RESERVED4
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: SMPL_ON_POSEDGE
field.description:
On the I2S serial interface, data and WCLK is sampled and clocked out on opposite edges of BCLK.
0 - data and WCLK are sampled on the negative edge and clocked out on the positive edge. 1 - data and WCLK are sampled on the positive edge and clocked out on the negative edge.
For changes to take effect, CLKLOADCTL.LOAD needs to be written

field.name: WCLK_PHASE
field.description:
Decides how the WCLK division ratio is calculated and used to generate different duty cycles (See I2SWCLKDIV.WDIV).
0: Single phase 1: Dual phase 2: User Defined 3: Reserved/Undefined
For changes to take effect, CLKLOADCTL.LOAD needs to be written

field.name: EN
field.description:
0: MCLK, BCLK and WCLK will be static low 1: Enables the generation of MCLK, BCLK and WCLK
For changes to take effect, CLKLOADCTL.LOAD needs to be written

register.name: I2SMCLKDIV
register.description: MCLK Division Ratio

field.name: RESERVED10
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: MDIV
field.description:
An unsigned factor of the division ratio used to generate MCLK [2-1024]:
MCLK = MCUCLK/MDIV[Hz] MCUCLK is 48MHz in normal mode. For powerdown mode the frequency is defined by AON_WUC:MCUCLK.PWR_DWN_SRC
A value of 0 is interpreted as 1024. A value of 1 is invalid. If MDIV is odd the low phase of the clock is one MCUCLK period longer than the high phase.
For changes to take effect, CLKLOADCTL.LOAD needs to be written

register.name: I2SBCLKDIV
register.description: BCLK Division Ratio

field.name: RESERVED10
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: BDIV
field.description:
An unsigned factor of the division ratio used to generate I2S BCLK [2-1024]:
BCLK = MCUCLK/BDIV[Hz] MCUCLK is 48MHz in normal mode. For powerdown mode the frequency is defined by AON_WUC:MCUCLK.PWR_DWN_SRC
A value of 0 is interpreted as 1024. A value of 1 is invalid. If BDIV is odd and I2SCLKCTL.SMPL_ON_POSEDGE = 0, the low phase of the clock is one MCUCLK period longer than the high phase. If BDIV is odd and I2SCLKCTL.SMPL_ON_POSEDGE = 1 , the high phase of the clock is one MCUCLK period longer than the low phase.
For changes to take effect, CLKLOADCTL.LOAD needs to be written

register.name: I2SWCLKDIV
register.description: WCLK Division Ratio

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: WDIV
field.description:
If I2SCLKCTL.WCLK_PHASE = 0, Single phase. WCLK is high one BCLK period and low WDIV[9:0] (unsigned, [1-1023]) BCLK periods.
WCLK = MCUCLK / BDIV*(WDIV[9:0] + 1) [Hz] MCUCLK is 48MHz in normal mode. For powerdown mode the frequency is defined by AON_WUC:MCUCLK.PWR_DWN_SRC
If I2SCLKCTL.WCLK_PHASE = 1, Dual phase. Each phase on WCLK (50% duty cycle) is WDIV[9:0] (unsigned, [1-1023]) BCLK periods.
WCLK = MCUCLK / BDIV*(2*WDIV[9:0]) [Hz]
If I2SCLKCTL.WCLK_PHASE = 2, User defined. WCLK is high WDIV[7:0] (unsigned, [1-255]) BCLK periods and low WDIV[15:8] (unsigned, [1-255]) BCLK periods.
WCLK = MCUCLK / (BDIV*(WDIV[7:0] + WDIV[15:8]) [Hz]
For changes to take effect, CLKLOADCTL.LOAD needs to be written

register.name: SWRESET
register.description: SW Initiated Resets

field.name: RESERVED3

field.name: MCU
field.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

register.name: WARMRESET
register.description: WARM Reset Control And Status

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: WR_TO_PINRESET
field.description:
0: No action 1: A warm system reset event triggered by the below listed sources will result in an emulated pin reset.
Warm reset sources included: ICEPick sysreset System CPU reset request, CPU_SCS:AIRCR.SYSRESETREQ System CPU Lockup WDT timeout
An active ICEPick block system reset will gate all sources except ICEPick sysreset
SW can read AON_SYSCTL:RESETCTL.RESET_SRC to find the source of the last reset resulting in a full power up sequence. WARMRESET in this register is set in the scenario that WR_TO_PINRESET=1 and one of the above listed sources is triggered.

field.name: LOCKUP_STAT
field.description:
0: No registred event 1: A system CPU LOCKUP event has occured since last SW clear of the register.
A read of this register clears both WDT_STAT and LOCKUP_STAT.

field.name: WDT_STAT
field.description:
0: No registered event 1: A WDT event has occured since last SW clear of the register.
A read of this register clears both WDT_STAT and LOCKUP_STAT.

register.description: Power Domain Control

field.name: RESERVED5
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: RESERVED4
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: VIMS_MODE
field.description: 0: VIMS power domain is only powered when CPU power domain is powered. 1: VIMS power domain is powered whenever the BUS power domain is powered.

field.name: RFC_ON
field.description:
0: RFC power domain powered off if also PDCTL0.RFC_ON = 0 1: RFC power domain powered on
Bit shall be used by RFC in autonomus mode but there is no HW restrictions fom system CPU to access the bit.

field.name: CPU_ON
field.description:
0: Causes a power down of the CPU power domain when system CPU indicates it is idle. 1: Initiates power-on of the CPU power domain.
This bit is automatically set by a WIC power-on event.

field.name: RESERVED0
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

register.name: PDCTL1CPU
register.description: CPU Power Domain Direct Control

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: ON
field.description: This is an alias for PDCTL1.CPU_ON

register.name: PDCTL1RFC
register.description: RFC Power Domain Direct Control

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: ON
field.description: This is an alias for PDCTL1.RFC_ON

register.name: PDCTL1VIMS
register.description: VIMS Mode Direct Control

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: ON
field.description: This is an alias for PDCTL1.VIMS_MODE

register.name: PDSTAT1
register.description: Power Manager Status

field.name: RESERVED5
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: BUS_ON
field.description: 0: BUS domain not accessible 1: BUS domain is currently accessible

field.name: VIMS_MODE
field.description: 0: VIMS domain not accessible 1: VIMS domain is currently accessible

field.name: RFC_ON
field.description: 0: RFC domain not accessible 1: RFC domain is currently accessible

field.name: CPU_ON
field.description: 0: CPU and BUS domain not accessible 1: CPU and BUS domains are both currently accessible

field.name: RESERVED0
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

register.name: PDSTAT1BUS
register.description: BUS Power Domain Direct Read Status

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: ON
field.description: This is an alias for PDSTAT1.BUS_ON

register.name: PDSTAT1RFC
register.description: RFC Power Domain Direct Read Status

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: ON
field.description: This is an alias for PDSTAT1.RFC_ON

register.name: PDSTAT1CPU
register.description: CPU Power Domain Direct Read Status

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: ON
field.description: This is an alias for PDSTAT1.CPU_ON

register.name: PDSTAT1VIMS
register.description: VIMS Mode Direct Read Status

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: ON
field.description: This is an alias for PDSTAT1.VIMS_MODE

register.name: RFCBITS
register.description: Control To RFC

field.name: READ
field.description: Control bits for RFC. The RF core CPE processor will automatically check this register when it boots, and it can be used to immediately instruct CPE to perform some tasks at its start-up. The supported functionality is ROM-defined and may vary. See the technical reference manual for more details.

register.name: RFCMODESEL
register.description: Selected RFC Mode

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: CURR
field.description: Selects the set of commands that the RFC will accept. Only modes permitted by RFCMODEHWOPT.AVAIL are writeable. See the technical reference manual for details.

register.name: RFCMODEHWOPT
register.description: Allowed RFC Modes

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: AVAIL
field.description: Permitted RFC modes. More than one mode can be permitted.

register.name: PWRPROFSTAT
register.description: Power Profiler Register

field.name: RESERVED8
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: VALUE
field.description: SW can use these bits to timestamp the application. These bits are also available through the testtap and can thus be used by the emulator to profile in real time.

register.name: RAMRETEN
register.description: Memory Retention Control

field.name: RESERVED3
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: RFC
field.description:
0: Retention for RFC SRAM disabled 1: Retention for RFC SRAM enabled
Memories controlled: CPERAM MCERAM RFERAM

field.name: VIMS
field.description:
0: Memory retention disabled 1: Memory retention enabled
Bit 0: VIMS_TRAM Bit 1: VIMS_CRAM
Legal modes depend on settings in VIMS:CTL.MODE
00: VIMS:CTL.MODE must be OFF before DEEPSLEEP is asserted - must be set to CACHE or SPLIT mode after waking up again 01: VIMS:CTL.MODE must be GPRAM before DEEPSLEEP is asserted. Must remain in GPRAM mode after wake up, alternatively select OFF mode first and then CACHE or SPILT mode. 10: Illegal mode 11: No restrictions

register.name: CMDR
register.description: Doorbell Command Register

field.name: CMD
field.description: Command register. Raises an interrupt to the Command and packet engine (CPE) upon write.

register.name: CMDSTA
register.description: Doorbell Command Status Register

field.name: STAT
field.description: Status of the last command used

register.name: RFHWIFG
register.description: Interrupt Flags From RF Hardware Modules

field.name: RESERVED20
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: RATCH7
field.description: Radio timer channel 7 interrupt flag. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: RATCH6
field.description: Radio timer channel 6 interrupt flag. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: RATCH5
field.description: Radio timer channel 5 interrupt flag. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: RATCH4
field.description: Radio timer channel 4 interrupt flag. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: RATCH3
field.description: Radio timer channel 3 interrupt flag. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: RATCH2
field.description: Radio timer channel 2 interrupt flag. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: RATCH1
field.description: Radio timer channel 1 interrupt flag. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: RATCH0
field.description: Radio timer channel 0 interrupt flag. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: RFESOFT2
field.description: RF engine software defined interrupt 2 flag. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: RFESOFT1
field.description: RF engine software defined interrupt 1 flag. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: RFESOFT0
field.description: RF engine software defined interrupt 0 flag. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: RFEDONE
field.description: RF engine command done interrupt flag. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: RESERVED7
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: TRCTK
field.description: Debug tracer system tick interrupt flag. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: MDMSOFT
field.description: Modem synchronization word detection interrupt flag. This interrupt will be raised by modem when the synchronization word is received. The CPE may decide to reject the packet based on its header (protocol specific). Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: MDMOUT
field.description: Modem FIFO output interrupt flag. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: MDMIN
field.description: Modem FIFO input interrupt flag. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: MDMDONE
field.description: Modem command done interrupt flag. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: FSCA
field.description: Frequency synthesizer calibration accelerator interrupt flag. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: RESERVED0
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

register.name: RFCPEIFG
register.description: Interrupt Flags For Command and Packet Engine Generated Interrupts

field.name: INTERNAL_ERROR
field.description: Interrupt flag 31. The command and packet engine (CPE) has observed an unexpected error. A reset of the CPE is needed. This can be done by switching the RF Core power domain off and on in PRCM:PDCTL1RFC. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: BOOT_DONE
field.description: Interrupt flag 30. The command and packet engine (CPE) boot is finished. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: MODULES_UNLOCKED
field.description: Interrupt flag 29. As part of command and packet engine (CPE) boot process, it has opened access to RF Core modules and memories. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: SYNTH_NO_LOCK
field.description: Interrupt flag 28. The phase-locked loop in frequency synthesizer has reported loss of lock. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: IRQ27
field.description: Interrupt flag 27. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: RX_ABORTED
field.description: Interrupt flag 26. Packet reception stopped before packet was done. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: RX_N_DATA_WRITTEN
field.description: Interrupt flag 25. Specified number of bytes written to partial read Rx buffer. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: RX_DATA_WRITTEN
field.description: Interrupt flag 24. Data written to partial read Rx buffer. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: RX_ENTRY_DONE
field.description: Interrupt flag 23. Rx queue data entry changing state to finished. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: RX_BUF_FULL
field.description: Interrupt flag 22. Packet received that did not fit in Rx queue. BLE mode: Packet received that did not fit in the Rx queue. IEEE 802.15.4 mode: Frame received that did not fit in the Rx queue. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: RX_CTRL_ACK
field.description: Interrupt flag 21. BLE mode only: LL control packet received with CRC OK, not to be ignored, then acknowledgement sent. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: RX_CTRL
field.description: Interrupt flag 20. BLE mode only: LL control packet received with CRC OK, not to be ignored. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: RX_EMPTY
field.description: Interrupt flag 19. BLE mode only: Packet received with CRC OK, not to be ignored, no payload. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: RX_IGNORED
field.description: Interrupt flag 18. Packet received, but can be ignored. BLE mode: Packet received with CRC OK, but to be ignored. IEEE 802.15.4 mode: Frame received with ignore flag set. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: RX_NOK
field.description: Interrupt flag 17. Packet received with CRC error. BLE mode: Packet received with CRC error. IEEE 802.15.4 mode: Frame received with CRC error. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: RX_OK
field.description: Interrupt flag 16. Packet received correctly. BLE mode: Packet received with CRC OK, payload, and not to be ignored. IEEE 802.15.4 mode: Frame received with CRC OK. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: IRQ15
field.description: Interrupt flag 15. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: IRQ14
field.description: Interrupt flag 14. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: IRQ13
field.description: Interrupt flag 13. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: IRQ12
field.description: Interrupt flag 12. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: TX_BUFFER_CHANGED
field.description: Interrupt flag 11. BLE mode only: A buffer change is complete after CMD_BLE_ADV_PAYLOAD. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: TX_ENTRY_DONE
field.description: Interrupt flag 10. Tx queue data entry state changed to finished. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: TX_RETRANS
field.description: Interrupt flag 9. BLE mode only: Packet retransmitted. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: TX_CTRL_ACK_ACK
field.description: Interrupt flag 8. BLE mode only: Acknowledgement received on a transmitted LL control packet, and acknowledgement transmitted for that packet. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: TX_CTRL_ACK
field.description: Interrupt flag 7. BLE mode: Acknowledgement received on a transmitted LL control packet. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: TX_CTRL
field.description: Interrupt flag 6. BLE mode: Transmitted LL control packet. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: TX_ACK
field.description: Interrupt flag 5. BLE mode: Acknowledgement received on a transmitted packet. IEEE 802.15.4 mode: Transmitted automatic ACK frame. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: TX_DONE
field.description: Interrupt flag 4. Packet transmitted. (BLE mode: A packet has been transmitted.) (IEEE 802.15.4 mode: A frame has been transmitted). Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: LAST_FG_COMMAND_DONE
field.description: Interrupt flag 3. IEEE 802.15.4 mode only: The last foreground radio operation command in a chain of commands has finished. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: FG_COMMAND_DONE
field.description: Interrupt flag 2. IEEE 802.15.4 mode only: A foreground radio operation command has finished. Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: LAST_COMMAND_DONE
field.description: Interrupt flag 1. The last radio operation command in a chain of commands has finished. (IEEE 802.15.4 mode: The last background level radio operation command in a chain of commands has finished.) Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

field.name: COMMAND_DONE
field.description: Interrupt flag 0. A radio operation has finished. (IEEE 802.15.4 mode: A background level radio operation command has finished.) Write zero to clear flag. Write to one has no effect.

register.name: RFACKIFG
register.description: Doorbell Command Acknowledgement Interrupt Flag

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: ACKFLAG
field.description: Interrupt flag for Command ACK

register.name: SYSGPOCTL
register.description: RF Core General Purpose Output Control

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: GPOCTL3
field.description: RF Core GPO control bit 3. Selects which signal to output on the RF Core GPO line 3.

field.name: GPOCTL2
field.description: RF Core GPO control bit 2. Selects which signal to output on the RF Core GPO line 2.

field.name: GPOCTL1
field.description: RF Core GPO control bit 1. Selects which signal to output on the RF Core GPO line 1.

field.name: GPOCTL0
field.description: RF Core GPO control bit 0. Selects which signal to output on the RF Core GPO line 0.

register.name: PWMCLKEN
register.description: RF Core Power Management and Clock Enable

field.name: RESERVED11
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: RFCTRC
field.description: Enable clock to the RF Core Tracer (RFCTRC) module.

field.name: FSCA
field.description: Enable clock to the Frequency Synthesizer Calibration Accelerator (FSCA) module.

field.name: PHA
field.description: Enable clock to the Packet Handling Accelerator (PHA) module.

field.name: RAT
field.description: Enable clock to the Radio Timer (RAT) module.

field.name: RFERAM
field.description: Enable clock to the RF Engine RAM module.

field.name: RFE
field.description: Enable clock to the RF Engine (RFE) module.

field.name: MDMRAM
field.description: Enable clock to the Modem RAM module.

field.name: MDM
field.description: Enable clock to the Modem (MDM) module.

field.name: CPERAM
field.description: Enable clock to the Command and Packet Engine (CPE) RAM module. As part of RF Core initialization, set this bit together with CPE bit to enable CPE to boot.

field.name: CPE
field.description: Enable processor clock (hclk) to the Command and Packet Engine (CPE). As part of RF Core initialization, set this bit together with CPERAM bit to enable CPE to boot.

field.name: RFC
field.description: Enable essential clocks for the RF Core interface. This includes the interconnect, the radio doorbell DBELL command interface, the power management (PWR) clock control module, and bus clock (sclk) for the CPE. To remove possibility of locking yourself out from the RF Core, this bit can not be cleared. If you need to disable all clocks to the RF Core, see the PRCM:RFCCLKG.CLK_EN register.

register.name: RATCNT
register.description: Radio Timer Counter Value

field.name: CNT
field.description: Counter value. This is not writable while radio timer counter is enabled.

register.name: RATCH0VAL

field.name: VAL
field.description: Capture/compare value. The system CPU can safely read this register, but it is recommended to use the CPE API commands to configure it for compare mode.

peripheral.name: SMPH
peripheral.description:
MCU Semaphore Module
This module provides 32 binary semaphores. The state of a binary semaphore is either taken or available.
A semaphore does not implement any ownership attribute. Still, a semaphore can be used to handle mutual exclusion scenarios.

register.name: SMPH0
register.description: MCU SEMAPHORE 0

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

field.name: STAT
field.description:
Status when reading:
0: Semaphore is taken 1: Semaphore is available
Reading the register causes it to change value to 0. Releasing the semaphore is done by writing 1.

0: Semaphore is taken 1: Semaphore is available
Used for semaphore debugging. A read operation will not change register value. Register writing is not possible.
